notes: [defines.events.on_entity_cloned](defines.events.on_entity_cloned) is raised.

parameters.name: create_build_effect_smoke
parameters.description: If false, the building effect smoke will not be shown around the new entity.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The destination position

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: The destination surface

methods.return_description: The cloned entity or `nil` if this entity can't be cloned/can't be cloned to the given location.

methods.name: connect_linked_belts
methods.description:
Connects current linked belt with another one.

Neighbours have to be of different type. If given linked belt is connected to something else it will be disconnected first. If provided neighbour is connected to something else it will also be disconnected first. Automatically updates neighbour to be connected back to this one.
notes: Can also be used on entity ghost if it contains linked-belt

parameters.name: neighbour
parameters.description: Another linked belt or entity ghost containing linked belt to connect or nil to disconnect

methods.name: connect_neighbour
methods.description:
Connect two devices with a circuit wire or copper cable. Depending on which type of connection should be made, there are different procedures:

- To connect two electric poles, `target` must be a [LuaEntity](LuaEntity) that specifies another electric pole. This will connect them with copper cable.
- To connect two devices with circuit wire, `target` must be a table of type [WireConnectionDefinition](WireConnectionDefinition).

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target with which to establish a connection.

methods.return_description: Whether the connection was successfully formed.

methods.name: connect_rolling_stock
methods.description: Connects the rolling stock in the given direction.
methods.return_description: If any connection was made

methods.name: copy_settings
methods.description: Copies settings from the given entity onto this entity.

parameters.name: by_player
parameters.description: If provided, the copying is done 'as' this player and [on_entity_settings_pasted](on_entity_settings_pasted) is triggered.

methods.return_description: Any items removed from this entity as a result of copying the settings.

methods.name: create_build_effect_smoke
methods.description: Creates the same smoke that is created when you place a building by hand. You can play the building sound to go with it by using [LuaSurface::play_sound](LuaSurface::play_sound), eg: entity.surface.play_sound{path="entity-build/"..entity.prototype.name, position=entity.position}

methods.name: damage
methods.description: Damages the entity.

parameters.name: damage
parameters.description: The amount of damage to be done

parameters.name: dealer
parameters.description: The entity to consider as the damage dealer.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force that will be doing the damage.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of damage to be done, defaults to "impact".

methods.return_description: the total damage actually applied after resistances.

methods.name: deplete
methods.description: Depletes and destroys this resource entity.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys the entity.
notes: Not all entities can be destroyed - things such as rails under trains cannot be destroyed until the train is moved or destroyed.

parameters.name: do_cliff_correction
parameters.description: Whether neighbouring cliffs should be corrected. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: raise_destroy
parameters.description: If `true`, [script_raised_destroy](script_raised_destroy) will be called. Defaults to `false`.

methods.return_description: Returns `false` if the entity was valid and destruction failed, `true` in all other cases.

methods.name: die
methods.description:
Immediately kills the entity. Does nothing if the entity doesn't have health.

Unlike [LuaEntity::destroy](LuaEntity::destroy), `die` will trigger the [on_entity_died](on_entity_died) event and the entity will produce a corpse and drop loot if it has any.
notes: If `force` is not specified, `on_entity_died` will blame the `"neutral"` force.
examples:
This function can be called with only the `cause` argument and no `force`: 
```
entity.die(nil, killer_entity)
```

parameters.name: cause
parameters.description: The cause to attribute the kill to.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force to attribute the kill to.

methods.return_description: Whether the entity was successfully killed.

methods.name: disconnect_linked_belts
methods.description: Disconnects linked belt from its neighbour.
notes: Can also be used on entity ghost if it contains linked-belt

methods.name: disconnect_neighbour
methods.description:
Disconnect circuit wires or copper cables between devices. Depending on which type of connection should be cut, there are different procedures:

- To remove all copper cables, leave the `target` parameter blank: `pole.disconnect_neighbour()`.
- To remove all wires of a specific color, set `target` to [defines.wire_type.red](defines.wire_type.red) or [defines.wire_type.green](defines.wire_type.green).
- To remove a specific copper cable between two electric poles, `target` must be a [LuaEntity](LuaEntity) that specifies the other pole: `pole1.disconnect_neighbour(pole2)`.
- To remove a specific circuit wire, `target` must be a table of type [WireConnectionDefinition](WireConnectionDefinition).

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target with which to cut a connection.

methods.name: disconnect_rolling_stock
methods.description: Tries to disconnect this rolling stock in the given direction.
methods.return_description: If anything was disconnected

methods.name: get_beam_source
methods.description: Get the source of this beam.

methods.name: get_beam_target
methods.description: Get the target of this beam.

methods.name: get_burnt_result_inventory
methods.description: The burnt result inventory for this entity or `nil` if this entity doesn't have a burnt result inventory.

methods.name: get_circuit_network

parameters.name: circuit_connector
parameters.description: The connector to get circuit network for. Must be specified for entities with more than one circuit network connector.

parameters.name: wire
parameters.description: Wire color of the network connected to this entity.

methods.return_description: The circuit network or nil.

methods.name: get_connected_rail
methods.return_description: Rail connected in the specified manner to this one.

methods.name: get_connected_rails
methods.description: Get the rails that this signal is connected to.

methods.name: get_connected_rolling_stock
methods.description: Gets rolling stock connected to the given end of this stock
notes: This will also return [defines.rail_direction](defines.rail_direction) of other rolling stock that is connected back to this rolling stock
methods.return_description: One of connected rolling stocks

methods.name: get_control_behavior
methods.description: Gets the control behavior of the entity (if any).
methods.return_description: The control behavior or nil.

methods.name: get_damage_to_be_taken
methods.description: Returns the amount of damage to be taken by this entity.

methods.name: get_driver
methods.description: Gets the driver of this vehicle if any.
notes: May be `nil` if the vehicle contains no driver. To check if there's a passenger see [LuaEntity::get_passenger](LuaEntity::get_passenger).

methods.name: get_filter
methods.description: Get the filter for a slot in an inserter, loader, or logistic storage container.
notes: The entity must allow filters.

parameters.name: slot_index
parameters.description: Index of the slot to get the filter for.

methods.return_description: Prototype name of the item being filtered. `nil` if the given slot has no filter.

methods.name: get_fluid_contents
methods.description: Get amounts of all fluids in this entity.
notes: If information about fluid temperatures is required, [LuaEntity::fluidbox](LuaEntity::fluidbox) should be used instead.
methods.return_description: The amounts, indexed by fluid names.

methods.name: get_fluid_count
methods.description: Get the amount of all or some fluid in this entity.
notes: If information about fluid temperatures is required, [LuaEntity::fluidbox](LuaEntity::fluidbox) should be used instead.

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: Prototype name of the fluid to count. If not specified, count all fluids.

methods.name: get_fuel_inventory
methods.description: The fuel inventory for this entity or `nil` if this entity doesn't have a fuel inventory.

methods.name: get_health_ratio
methods.description: The health ratio of this entity between 1 and 0 (for full health and no health respectively).

methods.name: get_heat_setting
methods.description: Gets the heat setting for this heat interface.

methods.name: get_infinity_container_filter
methods.description: Gets the filter for this infinity container at the given index or `nil` if the filter index doesn't exist or is empty.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get.

methods.name: get_infinity_pipe_filter
methods.description: Gets the filter for this infinity pipe or `nil` if the filter is empty.

methods.name: get_logistic_point
methods.description: Gets all the `LuaLogisticPoint`s that this entity owns. Optionally returns only the point specified by the index parameter.
notes: When `index` is not given, this will be a single `LuaLogisticPoint` for most entities. For some (such as the player character), it can be zero or more.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If provided, only returns the `LuaLogisticPoint` specified by this index.

methods.name: get_market_items
methods.description: Get all offers in a market as an array.

methods.name: get_max_transport_line_index
methods.description: Get the maximum transport line index of a belt or belt connectable entity.

methods.name: get_merged_signal
methods.description: Read a single signal from the combined circuit networks.

parameters.name: circuit_connector
parameters.description: The connector to get signals for. Must be specified for entities with more than one circuit network connector.

parameters.name: signal
parameters.description: The signal to read.

methods.return_description: The current value of the signal.

methods.name: get_merged_signals
methods.description: The merged circuit network signals or `nil` if there are no signals.

parameters.name: circuit_connector
parameters.description: The connector to get signals for. Must be specified for entities with more than one circuit network connector.

methods.return_description: The sum of signals on both the red and green networks, or nil if it doesn't have a circuit connector.

methods.name: get_module_inventory
methods.return_description: Inventory for storing modules of this entity; `nil` if this entity has no module inventory.

methods.name: get_or_create_control_behavior
methods.description: Gets (and or creates if needed) the control behavior of the entity.
methods.return_description: The control behavior or nil.

methods.name: get_output_inventory
methods.description: Gets the entities output inventory if it has one.
methods.return_description: a reference to the entities output inventory.

methods.name: get_passenger
methods.description: Gets the passenger of this car or spidertron if any.
notes: May be `nil` if the vehicle contains no passenger. To check if there's a driver see [LuaEntity::get_driver](LuaEntity::get_driver).
This differs over [LuaEntity::get_driver](LuaEntity::get_driver) in that the passenger can't drive the car.

methods.name: get_radius
methods.description: The radius of this entity.

methods.name: get_rail_segment_end
methods.description: Get the rail at the end of the rail segment this rail is in.
notes: A rail segment is a continuous section of rail with no branches, signals, nor train stops.
This function has a second return value. A [defines.rail_direction](defines.rail_direction) that points out of the rail segment from the end rail.

methods.name: get_rail_segment_entity
methods.description: Get the rail signal or train stop at the start/end of the rail segment this rail is in, or `nil` if the rail segment doesn't start/end with a signal nor a train stop.
notes: A rail segment is a continuous section of rail with no branches, signals, nor train stops.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of travel relative to this rail.

parameters.name: in_else_out
parameters.description: If true, gets the entity at the entrance of the rail segment, otherwise gets the entity at the exit of the rail segment.

methods.name: get_rail_segment_length
methods.description: Get the length of the rail segment this rail is in.
notes: A rail segment is a continuous section of rail with no branches, signals, nor train stops.

methods.name: get_rail_segment_overlaps
methods.description: Get a rail from each rail segment that overlaps with this rail's rail segment.
notes: A rail segment is a continuous section of rail with no branches, signals, nor train stops.

methods.name: get_recipe
methods.description: Current recipe being assembled by this machine or `nil` if no recipe is set.

methods.name: get_request_slot
methods.description: Get a logistic requester slot.
notes: Useable only on entities that have requester slots.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: The slot index.

methods.return_description: Contents of the specified slot; `nil` if the given slot contains no request.

methods.name: get_stopped_train
methods.description: The train currently stopped at this train stop or `nil` if none.

methods.name: get_train_stop_trains
methods.description: The trains scheduled to stop at this train stop.

methods.name: get_transport_line
methods.description: Get a transport line of a belt or belt connectable entity.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index of the requested transport line. Transport lines are 1-indexed.

methods.name: get_upgrade_direction
methods.description: Returns the new entity direction after upgrading.
methods.return_description: nil if this entity is not marked for upgrade.

methods.name: get_upgrade_target
methods.description: Returns the new entity prototype.
methods.return_description: nil if this entity is not marked for upgrade.

methods.name: ghost_has_flag
methods.description: Same as [LuaEntity::has_flag](LuaEntity::has_flag), but targets the inner entity on a entity ghost.

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: The flag to test. See [EntityPrototypeFlags](EntityPrototypeFlags) for a list of flags.

methods.return_description: `true` if the entity has the given flag set.

methods.name: has_command
methods.description: Has this unit been assigned a command?

methods.name: has_flag
methods.description: Test whether this entity's prototype has a certain flag set.
notes: `entity.has_flag(f)` is a shortcut for `entity.prototype.has_flag(f)`.

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: The flag to test. See [EntityPrototypeFlags](EntityPrototypeFlags) for a list of flags.

methods.return_description: `true` if this entity has the given flag set.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.name: insert_fluid
methods.description: Insert fluid into this entity. Fluidbox is chosen automatically.

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: Fluid to insert.

methods.return_description: Amount of fluid actually inserted.

methods.name: is_closed
methods.return_description: `true` if this gate is currently closed.

methods.name: is_closing
methods.return_description: `true` if this gate is currently closing

methods.name: is_connected_to_electric_network
methods.description: Returns true if this entity is connected to an electric network.

methods.name: is_crafting
methods.description: Returns whether a craft is currently in process. It does not indicate whether progress is currently being made, but whether any crafting action has made progress in this machine.

methods.name: is_opened
methods.return_description: `true` if this gate is currently opened.

methods.name: is_opening
methods.return_description: `true` if this gate is currently opening.

methods.name: is_registered_for_construction
methods.description: Is this entity or tile ghost or item request proxy registered for construction? If false, it means a construction robot has been dispatched to build the entity, or it is not an entity that can be constructed.

methods.name: is_registered_for_deconstruction
methods.description: Is this entity registered for deconstruction with this force? If false, it means a construction robot has been dispatched to deconstruct it, or it is not marked for deconstruction. This is worst-case O(N) complexity where N is the current number of things in the deconstruct queue.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force construction manager to check.

methods.name: is_registered_for_repair
methods.description: Is this entity registered for repair? If false, it means a construction robot has been dispatched to upgrade it, or it is not damaged. This is worst-case O(N) complexity where N is the current number of things in the repair queue.

methods.name: is_registered_for_upgrade
methods.description: Is this entity registered for upgrade? If false, it means a construction robot has been dispatched to upgrade it, or it is not marked for upgrade. This is worst-case O(N) complexity where N is the current number of things in the upgrade queue.

methods.name: launch_rocket
methods.return_description: `true` if the rocket was successfully launched. Return value of `false` means the silo is not ready for launch.

methods.name: mine
methods.description: Mines this entity.
notes: 'standard' operation is to keep calling mine() with an inventory until all items are transferred and the items dealt with.
The result of mining the entity (the item(s) it produces when mined) will be dropped on the ground if they don't fit into the provided inventory.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If true, when the item(s) don't fit into the given inventory the entity is force mined. If false, the mining operation fails when there isn't enough room to transfer all of the items into the inventory. Defaults to false. This is ignored and acts as 'true' if no inventory is provided.

parameters.name: ignore_minable
parameters.description: If true, the minable state of the entity is ignored. Defaults to false. If false, an entity that isn't minable (set as not-minable in the prototype or isn't minable for other reasons) will fail to be mined.

parameters.name: inventory
parameters.description: If provided the item(s) will be transferred into this inventory. If provided, this must be an inventory created with [LuaGameScript::create_inventory](LuaGameScript::create_inventory) or be a basic inventory owned by some entity.

parameters.name: raise_destroyed
parameters.description: If true, [script_raised_destroy](script_raised_destroy) will be raised. Defaults to true.

methods.return_description: Whether mining succeeded.

methods.name: order_deconstruction
methods.description: Sets the entity to be deconstructed by construction robots.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force whose robots are supposed to do the deconstruction.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to set the last_user to if any.

methods.return_description: if the entity was marked for deconstruction.

methods.name: order_upgrade
methods.description: Sets the entity to be upgraded by construction robots.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The new direction if any.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force whose robots are supposed to do the upgrade.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The prototype of the entity to upgrade to.

methods.return_description: if the entity was marked for upgrade.

methods.name: play_note
methods.description: Plays a note with the given instrument and note.
methods.return_description: If the request is valid. The sound may or may not be played depending on polyphony settings.

methods.name: release_from_spawner
methods.description: Release the unit from the spawner which spawned it. This allows the spawner to continue spawning additional units.

methods.name: remove_fluid
methods.description: Remove fluid from this entity.
notes: If temperature is given only fluid matching that exact temperature is removed. If minimum and maximum is given fluid within that range is removed.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount to remove

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Fluid prototype name.

methods.return_description: Amount of fluid actually removed.

methods.name: remove_market_item
methods.description: Remove an offer from a market.
notes: The other offers are moved down to fill the gap created by removing the offer, which decrements the overall size of the offer array.

parameters.name: offer
parameters.description: Index of offer to remove.

methods.return_description: `true` if the offer was successfully removed; `false` when the given index was not valid.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force that requests the gate to be closed.

parameters.name: extra_time
parameters.description: Extra ticks to stay open.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force that requests the gate to be open.

methods.name: revive
methods.description: Revive a ghost. I.e. turn it from a ghost to a real entity or tile.
notes: If this is an entity ghost and it is successfully revived this will also return the revived entity or `nil` as a second return value and possibly item request proxy as the third parameter depending on value of return_item_request_proxy.

parameters.name: raise_revive
parameters.description: If true, and an entity ghost; [script_raised_revive](script_raised_revive) will be called. Else if true, and a tile ghost; [script_raised_set_tiles](script_raised_set_tiles) will be called.

parameters.name: return_item_request_proxy
parameters.description: If `true` the function will return item request proxy as the third parameter.

methods.return_description: Any items the new real entity collided with or `nil` if the ghost could not be revived.

methods.name: rotate
methods.description: Rotates this entity as if the player rotated it.

parameters.name: enable_looted
parameters.description: When true, each spilled item will be flagged with the [LuaEntity::to_be_looted](LuaEntity::to_be_looted) flag.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: When provided the spilled items will be marked for deconstruction by this force.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: If `true`, rotate the entity in the counter-clockwise direction.

parameters.name: spill_items
parameters.description: If the player is not given should extra items be spilled or returned as a second return value from this.

methods.return_description: Whether the rotation was successful.

methods.name: set_beam_source
methods.description: Set the source of this beam.

methods.name: set_beam_target
methods.description: Set the target of this beam.

methods.name: set_command
methods.description: Give the entity a command.

methods.name: set_distraction_command
methods.description: Give the entity a distraction command.

methods.name: set_driver
methods.description: Sets the driver of this vehicle.
notes: This differs over [LuaEntity::set_passenger](LuaEntity::set_passenger) in that the passenger can't drive the vehicle.

parameters.name: driver
parameters.description: The new driver or `nil` to eject the current driver if any.

methods.name: set_filter
methods.description: Set the filter for a slot in an inserter, loader, or logistic storage container.
notes: The entity must allow filters.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Prototype name of the item to filter.

parameters.name: slot_index
parameters.description: Index of the slot to set the filter for.

methods.name: set_heat_setting
methods.description: Sets the heat setting for this heat interface.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The new setting.

methods.name: set_infinity_container_filter
methods.description: Sets the filter for this infinity container at the given index.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The new filter or `nil` to clear the filter.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to set.

methods.name: set_infinity_pipe_filter
methods.description: Sets the filter for this infinity pipe.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The new filter or `nil` to clear the filter.

methods.name: set_passenger
methods.description: Sets the passenger of this car or spidertron.
notes: This differs over [LuaEntity::get_driver](LuaEntity::get_driver) in that the passenger can't drive the car.

methods.name: set_recipe
methods.description: Sets the current recipe in this assembly machine.

parameters.name: recipe
parameters.description: The new recipe or `nil` to clear the recipe.

methods.return_description: Any items removed from this entity as a result of setting the recipe.

methods.name: set_request_slot
methods.description: Set a logistic requester slot.
notes: Useable only on entities that have requester slots.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: What to request.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: The slot index.

methods.return_description: If the slot was set.

methods.name: silent_revive
methods.description: Revives a ghost silently.
notes: If this is an entity ghost and it is successfully revived this will also return the revived entity or `nil` as a second return value and possibly item request proxy as the third parameter depending on value of return_item_request_proxy.

parameters.name: raise_revive
parameters.description: If true, and an entity ghost; [script_raised_revive](script_raised_revive) will be called. Else if true, and a tile ghost; [script_raised_set_tiles](script_raised_set_tiles) will be called.

parameters.name: return_item_request_proxy
parameters.description: If `true` the function will return item request proxy as the third parameter.

methods.return_description: Any items the new real entity collided with or `nil` if the ghost could not be revived.

methods.name: spawn_decorations
methods.description: Triggers spawn_decoration actions defined in the entity prototype or does nothing if entity is not "turret" or "unit-spawner".

methods.name: start_fading_out
methods.description: Only works if the entity is a speech-bubble, with an "effect" defined in its wrapper_flow_style. Starts animating the opacity of the speech bubble towards zero, and destroys the entity when it hits zero.

methods.name: supports_backer_name
methods.description: Whether this entity supports a backer name.

methods.name: to_be_deconstructed
methods.description: Is this entity marked for deconstruction?

methods.name: to_be_upgraded
methods.description: Is this entity marked for upgrade?

methods.name: toggle_equipment_movement_bonus
methods.description: Toggle this entity's equipment movement bonus. Does nothing if the entity does not have an equipment grid.
notes: This property can also be read and written on the equipment grid of this entity.

methods.name: update_connections
methods.description: Reconnect loader, beacon, cliff and mining drill connections to entities that might have been teleported out or in by the script. The game doesn't do this automatically as we don't want to loose performance by checking this in normal games.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Deactivating an entity will stop all its operations (car will stop moving, inserters will stop working, fish will stop moving etc).
notes: Entities that are not active naturally can't be set to be active (setting it to be active will do nothing)
Ghosts, simple smoke, and corpses can't be modified at this time.
It is even possible to set the character to not be active, so he can't move and perform most of the tasks.

attributes.name: ai_settings
attributes.description: The ai settings of this unit.

attributes.name: allow_dispatching_robots
attributes.description: Whether this character's personal roboports are allowed to dispatch robots.

attributes.name: amount
attributes.description: Count of resource units contained.

attributes.name: armed
attributes.description: If this land mine is armed.

attributes.name: associated_player
attributes.description: The player this character is associated with or `nil` if none. When the player logs off in multiplayer all of the associated characters will be logged off with him.
notes: A character associated with a player is not directly controlled by any player.
Set to `nil` to clear. The player will be automatically disassociated when a controller is set on the character.

attributes.name: auto_launch
attributes.description: Whether this rocket silo automatically launches the rocket when cargo is inserted.

attributes.name: autopilot_destination
attributes.description: Destination position of spidertron's autopilot. Returns `nil` if autopilot doesn't have destination set.

attributes.name: autopilot_destinations
attributes.description: The queued destination positions of spidertron's autopilot.

attributes.name: backer_name
attributes.description: The backer name assigned to this entity, or `nil` if this entity doesn't support backer names. Entities that support backer names are labs, locomotives, radars, roboports, and train stops.
notes: While train stops get the name of a backer when placed down, players can rename them if they want to. In this case, `backer_name` returns the player-given name of the entity.

attributes.name: belt_neighbours
attributes.description: The belt connectable neighbours of this belt connectable entity. Only entities that input to or are outputs of this entity. Does not contain the other end of an underground belt, see [LuaEntity::neighbours](LuaEntity::neighbours) for that. This is a dictionary with `"inputs"`, `"outputs"` entries that are arrays of transport belt connectable entities, or empty tables if no entities.

attributes.name: belt_to_ground_type
attributes.description: `"input"` or `"output"`, depending on whether this underground belt goes down or up.

attributes.name: bonus_mining_progress
attributes.description: The bonus mining progress for this mining drill or `nil` if this isn't a mining drill. Read yields a number in range [0, mining_target.prototype.mineable_properties.mining_time]

attributes.name: bonus_progress
attributes.description: The current productivity bonus progress, as a number in range [0, 1].

attributes.name: bounding_box
attributes.description: [LuaEntityPrototype::collision_box](LuaEntityPrototype::collision_box) around entity's given position and respecting the current entity orientation.

attributes.name: burner
attributes.description: The burner energy source for this entity or `nil` if there isn't one.

attributes.name: chain_signal_state
attributes.description: The state of this chain signal.

attributes.name: character_corpse_death_cause
attributes.description: The reason this character corpse character died (if any).

attributes.name: character_corpse_player_index
attributes.description: The player index associated with this character corpse.
notes: The index is not guaranteed to be valid so it should always be checked first if a player with that index actually exists.

attributes.name: character_corpse_tick_of_death
attributes.description: The tick this character corpse died at.

attributes.name: circuit_connected_entities
attributes.description: Entities that are directly connected to this entity via the circuit network.

parameters.name: green
parameters.description: Entities connected via the green wire.

parameters.name: red
parameters.description: Entities connected via the red wire.

attributes.name: circuit_connection_definitions
attributes.description: The connection definition for entities that are directly connected to this entity via the circuit network.

attributes.name: cliff_orientation
attributes.description: The orientation of this cliff.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The character, rolling stock, train stop, car, spider-vehicle, flying text, corpse or simple-entity-with-owner color. Returns `nil` if this entity doesn't use custom colors.
notes: Car color is overridden by the color of the current driver/passenger, if there is one.

attributes.name: combat_robot_owner
attributes.description: The owner of this combat robot if any.

attributes.name: command
attributes.description: The command given to this unit or `nil` is the unit has no command.

attributes.name: connected_rail
attributes.description: The rail entity this train stop is connected to or `nil` if there is none.

attributes.name: connected_rail_direction
attributes.description: Rail direction to which this train stop is binding. This returns a value even when no rails are present.

attributes.name: consumption_bonus
attributes.description: The consumption bonus of this entity.

attributes.name: consumption_modifier
attributes.description: Multiplies the energy consumption.

attributes.name: corpse_expires
attributes.description: Whether this corpse will ever fade away.
notes: Useable only on corpses.

attributes.name: corpse_immune_to_entity_placement
attributes.description: If true, corpse won't be destroyed when entities are placed over it. If false, whether corpse will be removed or not depends on value of CorpsePrototype::remove_on_entity_placement.
notes: Useable only on corpses.

attributes.name: crafting_progress
attributes.description: The current crafting progress, as a number in range [0, 1].

attributes.name: crafting_speed
attributes.description: The current crafting speed, including speed bonuses from modules and beacons.

attributes.name: damage_dealt
attributes.description: The damage dealt by this turret, artillery turret, or artillery wagon.

attributes.name: destructible
attributes.description: When the entity is not destructible it can't be damaged.
notes: An indestructible entity can still be mined.
Entities that are indestructible naturally (they have no health, like smoke, resource etc) can't be set to be destructible.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: The current direction this entity is facing.

attributes.name: distraction_command
attributes.description: The distraction command given to this unit or `nil` is the unit currently isn't distracted.

attributes.name: driver_is_gunner
attributes.description: Whether the driver of this car or spidertron is the gunner, if false, the passenger is the gunner.

attributes.name: drop_position
attributes.description: Position where the entity puts its stuff.
notes: Meaningful only for entities that put stuff somewhere, such as mining drills or inserters. Mining drills can't have their drop position changed; inserters must have `allow_custom_vectors` set to true on their prototype to allow changing the drop position.

attributes.name: drop_target
attributes.description: The entity this entity is putting its items to, or `nil` if there is no such entity. If there are multiple possible entities at the drop-off point, writing to this attribute allows a mod to choose which one to drop off items to. The entity needs to collide with the tile box under the drop-off position.
notes: Meaningful only for entities that put items somewhere, such as mining drills or inserters. Returns `nil` for any other entity.

attributes.name: effective_speed
attributes.description: The current speed of this unit in tiles per tick, taking into account any walking speed modifier given by the tile the unit is standing on.

attributes.name: effectivity_modifier
attributes.description: Multiplies the acceleration the vehicle can create for one unit of energy. By default is `1`.

attributes.name: effects
attributes.description: The effects being applied to this entity or `nil`. For beacons this is the effect the beacon is broadcasting.

attributes.name: electric_buffer_size
attributes.description: The buffer size for the electric energy source or nil if the entity doesn't have an electric energy source.
notes: Write access is limited to the ElectricEnergyInterface type

attributes.name: electric_drain
attributes.description: The electric drain for the electric energy source or nil if the entity doesn't have an electric energy source.

attributes.name: electric_emissions
attributes.description: The emissions for the electric energy source or nil if the entity doesn't have an electric energy source.

attributes.name: electric_input_flow_limit
attributes.description: The input flow limit for the electric energy source or nil if the entity doesn't have an electric energy source.

attributes.name: electric_network_id
attributes.description: Returns the id of the electric network that this entity is connected to or `nil`.

attributes.name: electric_network_statistics
attributes.description: The electric network statistics for this electric pole.

attributes.name: electric_output_flow_limit
attributes.description: The output flow limit for the electric energy source or nil if the entity doesn't have an electric energy source.

attributes.name: enable_logistics_while_moving
attributes.description: If equipment grid logistics are enabled while this vehicle is moving.

attributes.name: energy
attributes.description: Energy stored in the entity (heat in furnace, energy stored in electrical devices etc.). always 0 for entities that don't have the concept of energy stored inside.
examples:
```
game.player.print("Machine energy: " .. game.player.selected.energy .. "J")
game.player.selected.energy = 3000
```

attributes.name: energy_generated_last_tick
attributes.description: How much energy this generator generated in the last tick.

attributes.name: entity_label
attributes.description: The label of this entity if it has one or `nil`. Changing the value will trigger on_entity_renamed event
notes: only usable on entities that have labels (currently only spider-vehicles).

attributes.name: filter_slot_count
attributes.description: The number of filter slots this inserter, loader, or logistic storage container has. 0 if not one of those entities.

attributes.name: fluidbox
attributes.description: Fluidboxes of this entity.

attributes.name: follow_offset
attributes.description: The follow offset of this spidertron if any. If it is not following an entity this will be nil. This is randomized each time the follow entity is set.

attributes.name: follow_target
attributes.description: The follow target of this spidertron if any.

attributes.name: friction_modifier
attributes.description: Multiplies the car friction rate.
examples:
This will allow the car to go much faster 
```
game.player.vehicle.friction_modifier = 0.5
```

attributes.name: ghost_localised_name
attributes.description: Localised name of the entity or tile contained in this ghost.

attributes.name: ghost_name
attributes.description: Name of the entity or tile contained in this ghost

attributes.name: ghost_prototype
attributes.description: The prototype of the entity or tile contained in this ghost.

attributes.name: ghost_type
attributes.description: The prototype type of the entity or tile contained in this ghost.

attributes.name: ghost_unit_number
attributes.description: The unit number of the entity contained in this ghost or nil if the entity doesn't have one.

attributes.name: graphics_variation
attributes.description: The graphics variation for this entity or `nil` if this entity doesn't use graphics variations.

attributes.name: grid
attributes.description: The equipment grid or `nil` if this entity doesn't have an equipment grid.

attributes.name: health
attributes.description: The current health of the entity, or `nil` if it doesn't have health. Health is automatically clamped to be between `0` and max health (inclusive). Entities with a health of `0` can not be attacked.
notes: To get the maximum possible health of this entity, see [LuaEntityPrototype::max_health](LuaEntityPrototype::max_health) on its prototype.

attributes.name: held_stack
attributes.description: The item stack currently held in an inserter's hand.

attributes.name: held_stack_position
attributes.description: Current position of the inserter's "hand".

attributes.name: highlight_box_blink_interval
attributes.description: The blink interval of this highlight box entity. 0 indicates no blink.

attributes.name: highlight_box_type
attributes.description: The hightlight box type of this highlight box entity.

attributes.name: infinity_container_filters
attributes.description: The filters for this infinity container.

attributes.name: initial_amount
attributes.description: Count of initial resource units contained.
notes: If this is not an infinite resource reading will give `nil` and writing will give an error.

attributes.name: inserter_filter_mode
attributes.description: The filter mode for this filter inserter: "whitelist", "blacklist", or `nil` if this inserter doesn't use filters.

attributes.name: inserter_stack_size_override
attributes.description: Sets the stack size limit on this inserter. If the stack size is > than the force stack size limit the value is ignored.
notes: Set to 0 to reset.

attributes.name: is_entity_with_force
attributes.description: If this entity is EntityWithForce

attributes.name: is_entity_with_health
attributes.description: If this entity is EntityWithHealth

attributes.name: is_entity_with_owner
attributes.description: If this entity is EntityWithOwner

attributes.name: item_requests
attributes.description: Items this ghost will request when revived or items this item request proxy is requesting. Result is a dictionary mapping each item prototype name to the required count.

attributes.name: kills
attributes.description: The number of units killed by this turret, artillery turret, or artillery wagon.

attributes.name: last_user
attributes.description: The last player that changed any setting on this entity. This includes building the entity, changing its color, or configuring its circuit network. Can be `nil` if the last user is not part of the save anymore. Mods can overwrite it if desired.

attributes.name: link_id
attributes.description: The link ID this linked container is using.

attributes.name: linked_belt_neighbour
attributes.description: Neighbour to which this linked belt is connected to. Returns nil if not connected.
notes: Can also be used on entity ghost if it contains linked-belt
May return entity ghost which contains linked belt to which connection is made

attributes.name: linked_belt_type
attributes.description: Type of linked belt: it is either `"input"` or `"output"`. Changing type will also flip direction so the belt is out of the same side
notes: Can only be changed when linked belt is disconnected (has no neighbour set)
Can also be used on entity ghost if it contains linked-belt

attributes.name: loader_container
attributes.description: The container entity this loader is pointing at/pulling from depending on the [LuaEntity::loader_type](LuaEntity::loader_type).

attributes.name: loader_type
attributes.description: `"input"` or `"output"`, depending on whether this loader puts to or gets from a container.

attributes.name: localised_name
attributes.description: Localised name of the entity.

attributes.name: logistic_cell
attributes.description: The logistic cell this entity is a part of. Will be `nil` if this entity is not a part of any logistic cell.

attributes.name: logistic_network
attributes.description: The logistic network this entity is a part of.

attributes.name: minable
notes: Not minable entities can still be destroyed.
Entities that are not minable naturally (like smoke, character, enemy units etc) can't be set to minable.

attributes.name: mining_progress
attributes.description: The mining progress for this mining drill or `nil` if this isn't a mining drill. Is a number in range [0, mining_target.prototype.mineable_properties.mining_time]

attributes.name: mining_target
attributes.description: The mining target or `nil` if none

attributes.name: moving
attributes.description: Returns true if this unit is moving.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the entity prototype. E.g. "inserter" or "filter-inserter".

attributes.name: neighbour_bonus
attributes.description: The current total neighbour bonus of this reactor.

attributes.name: neighbours
attributes.description:
- When called on an electric pole, this is a dictionary of all connections, indexed by the strings `"copper"`, `"red"`, and `"green"`.
- When called on a pipe-connectable entity, this is an array of entity arrays of all entities a given fluidbox is connected to.
- When called on an underground transport belt, this is the other end of the underground belt connection, or `nil` if none.
- When called on a wall-connectable entity or reactor, this is a dictionary of all connections indexed by the connection direction "north", "south", "east", and "west".

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: operable
attributes.description: Player can't open gui of this entity and he can't quick insert/input stuff in to the entity when it is not operable.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: The smooth orientation of this entity, if it supports orientation.

attributes.name: pickup_position
attributes.description: Where the inserter will pick up items from.
notes: Inserters must have `allow_custom_vectors` set to true on their prototype to allow changing the pickup position.

attributes.name: pickup_target
attributes.description: The entity this inserter will attempt to pick up items from, or `nil` if there is no such entity. If there are multiple possible entities at the pick-up point, writing to this attribute allows a mod to choose which one to pick up items from. The entity needs to collide with the tile box under the pick-up position.

attributes.name: player
attributes.description: The player connected to this character or `nil` if none.

attributes.name: pollution_bonus
attributes.description: The pollution bonus of this entity.

attributes.name: power_production
attributes.description: The power production specific to the ElectricEnergyInterface entity type.

attributes.name: power_switch_state
attributes.description: The state of this power switch.

attributes.name: power_usage
attributes.description: The power usage specific to the ElectricEnergyInterface entity type.

attributes.name: previous_recipe
attributes.description: The previous recipe this furnace was using or nil if the furnace had no previous recipe.

attributes.name: productivity_bonus
attributes.description: The productivity bonus of this entity.
notes: This includes force based bonuses as well as beacon/module bonuses.

attributes.name: products_finished
attributes.description: The number of products this machine finished crafting in its lifetime.

attributes.name: prototype
attributes.description: The entity prototype of this entity.

attributes.name: proxy_target
attributes.description: The target entity for this item-request-proxy or `nil`

attributes.name: pump_rail_target
attributes.description: The rail target of this pump or `nil`.

attributes.name: recipe_locked
attributes.description: When locked; the recipe in this assembling machine can't be changed by the player.

attributes.name: relative_turret_orientation
attributes.description: The relative orientation of the vehicle turret, artillery turret, artillery wagon or `nil` if this entity isn't a vehicle with a vehicle turret or artillery turret/wagon.
notes: Writing does nothing if the vehicle doesn't have a turret.

attributes.name: remove_unfiltered_items
attributes.description: If items not included in this infinity container filters should be removed from the container.

attributes.name: render_player
attributes.description: The player that this `simple-entity-with-owner`, `simple-entity-with-force`, `flying-text`, or `highlight-box` is visible to. `nil` means it is rendered for every player.

attributes.name: render_to_forces
attributes.description: The forces that this `simple-entity-with-owner`, `simple-entity-with-force`, or `flying-text` is visible to. `nil` or an empty array means it is rendered for every force.
notes: Reading will always give an array of [LuaForce](LuaForce)

attributes.name: request_from_buffers
attributes.description: Whether this requester chest is set to also request from buffer chests.
notes: Useable only on entities that have requester slots.

attributes.name: request_slot_count
attributes.description: The index of the configured request with the highest index for this entity. This means 0 if no requests are set and e.g. 20 if the 20th request slot is configured.

attributes.name: rocket_parts
attributes.description: Number of rocket parts in the silo.

attributes.name: rotatable
attributes.description: When entity is not to be rotatable (inserter, transport belt etc), it can't be rotated by player using the R key.
notes: Entities that are not rotatable naturally (like chest or furnace) can't be set to be rotatable.

attributes.name: secondary_bounding_box
attributes.description: The secondary bounding box of this entity or `nil` if it doesn't have one.

attributes.name: secondary_selection_box
attributes.description: The secondary selection box of this entity or `nil` if it doesn't have one.

attributes.name: selected_gun_index
attributes.description: Index of the currently selected weapon slot of this character, car, or spidertron, or `nil` if the car/spidertron doesn't have guns.

attributes.name: selection_box
attributes.description: [LuaEntityPrototype::selection_box](LuaEntityPrototype::selection_box) around entity's given position and respecting the current entity orientation.

attributes.name: shooting_target
attributes.description: The shooting target for this turret or `nil`.

attributes.name: signal_state
attributes.description: The state of this rail signal.

attributes.name: spawner
attributes.description: The spawner associated with this unit entity or `nil` if the unit has no associated spawner.

attributes.name: speed
attributes.description: The current speed of this car in tiles per tick, rolling stock, projectile or spider vehicle, or current max speed of the unit. Only the speed of units, cars, and projectiles are writable.

attributes.name: speed_bonus
attributes.description: The speed bonus of this entity.
notes: This includes force based bonuses as well as beacon/module bonuses.

attributes.name: splitter_filter
attributes.description: The filter for this splitter or `nil` if no filter is set.

attributes.name: splitter_input_priority
attributes.description: The input priority for this splitter : "left", "none", or "right".

attributes.name: splitter_output_priority
attributes.description: The output priority for this splitter : "left", "none", or "right".

attributes.name: status
attributes.description: The status of this entity or `nil` if no status.

attributes.name: sticked_to
attributes.description: The entity this sticker is sticked to.

attributes.name: stickers
attributes.description: The sticker entities attached to this entity or `nil` if none.

attributes.name: storage_filter
attributes.description: The storage filter for this logistic storage container.

attributes.name: supports_direction
attributes.description: Whether the entity has direction. When it is false for this entity, it will always return north direction when asked for.

attributes.name: tags
attributes.description: The tags associated with this entity ghost or `nil` if not an entity ghost.

attributes.name: temperature
attributes.description: The temperature of this entities heat energy source if this entity uses a heat energy source or `nil`.

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The text of this flying-text entity.

attributes.name: tick_of_last_attack
attributes.description: The last tick this character entity was attacked.

attributes.name: tick_of_last_damage
attributes.description: The last tick this character entity was damaged.

attributes.name: time_to_live
attributes.description:
The ticks left before a ghost, combat robot, highlight box or smoke with trigger is destroyed.

- for ghosts set to uint32 max (4,294,967,295) to never expire.
- for ghosts Cannot be set higher than [LuaForce::ghost_time_to_live](LuaForce::ghost_time_to_live) of the entity's force.

attributes.name: time_to_next_effect
attributes.description: The ticks until the next trigger effect of this smoke-with-trigger.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: The timeout that's left on this landmine in ticks. It describes the time between the landmine being placed and it being armed.

attributes.name: to_be_looted
attributes.description: Will this entity be picked up automatically when the player walks over it?

attributes.name: torso_orientation
attributes.description: The torso orientation of this spider vehicle.

attributes.name: train
attributes.description: The train this rolling stock belongs to or nil if not rolling stock.

attributes.name: trains_count
attributes.description: Amount of trains related to this particular train stop. Includes train stopped at this train stop (until it finds a path to next target) and trains having this train stop as goal or waypoint. Writing nil will disable the limit (will set a maximum possible value).
notes: Train may be included multiple times when braking distance covers this train stop multiple times
Value may be read even when train stop has no control behavior

attributes.name: trains_in_block
attributes.description: The number of trains in this rail block for this rail entity.

attributes.name: trains_limit
attributes.description: Amount of trains above which no new trains will be sent to this train stop.
notes: When a train stop has a control behavior with wire connected and set_trains_limit enabled, this value will be overwritten by it

attributes.name: tree_color_index
attributes.description: Index of the tree color.

attributes.name: tree_color_index_max
attributes.description: Maximum index of the tree colors.

attributes.name: tree_gray_stage_index
attributes.description: Index of the tree gray stage

attributes.name: tree_gray_stage_index_max
attributes.description: Maximum index of the tree gray stages.

attributes.name: tree_stage_index
attributes.description: Index of the tree stage.

attributes.name: tree_stage_index_max
attributes.description: Maximum index of the tree stages.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The entity prototype type of this entity.

attributes.name: unit_group
attributes.description: The unit group this unit is a member of, or `nil` if none.

attributes.name: unit_number
attributes.description: The unit number or nil if the entity doesn't have one. This is universally unique for every entity that has one, for the lifetime of a whole game.

attributes.name: units
attributes.description: The units associated with this spawner entity.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: vehicle_automatic_targeting_parameters
attributes.description: Read when this spidertron auto-targets enemies

methods.name: get_inventory_size
methods.description: Gets the base size of the given inventory on this entity or `nil` if the given inventory doesn't exist.

methods.name: has_flag
methods.description: Test whether this entity prototype has a certain flag set.

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: The flag to test. See [EntityPrototypeFlags](EntityPrototypeFlags) for a list of flags.

methods.return_description: `true` if this prototype has the given flag set.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

attributes.name: additional_pastable_entities
attributes.description: Entities this entity can be pasted onto in addition to the normal allowed ones.

attributes.name: adjacent_tile_collision_box
attributes.description: The bounding box that specifies which tiles adjacent to the offshore pump should be checked.

attributes.name: adjacent_tile_collision_mask
attributes.description: Tiles adjacent to the offshore pump must not collide with this collision mask.

attributes.name: adjacent_tile_collision_test
attributes.description: If this mask is not empty, tiles adjacent to the offshore pump must not collide with this collision mask.

attributes.name: affected_by_tiles
attributes.description: Whether this unit prototype is affected by tile walking speed modifiers or `nil`.

attributes.name: air_resistance
attributes.description: The air resistance of this rolling stock prototype or `nil` if not a rolling stock prototype.

attributes.name: alert_icon_shift
attributes.description: The alert icon shift of this entity prototype.

attributes.name: alert_when_attacking
attributes.description: Does this turret prototype alert when attacking? or `nil` if not turret prototype.

attributes.name: alert_when_damaged
attributes.description: Does this entity with health prototype alert when damaged? or `nil` if not entity with health prototype.

attributes.name: allow_access_to_all_forces
attributes.description: If this market allows access to all forces or just friendly ones.

attributes.name: allow_burner_leech
attributes.description: If this inserter allows burner leeching.

attributes.name: allow_copy_paste
attributes.description: When false copy-paste is not allowed for this entity.

attributes.name: allow_custom_vectors
attributes.description: If this inserter allows custom pickup and drop vectors.

attributes.name: allow_passengers
attributes.description: If this vehicle allows passengers.

attributes.name: allowed_effects
attributes.description: The allowed module effects for this entity or `nil`.

attributes.name: always_on
attributes.description: Whether the lamp is always on (except when out of power or turned off by the circuit network) or `nil`.

attributes.name: attack_parameters
attributes.description: The attack parameters for this entity or `nil` if the entity doesn't use attack parameters.

attributes.name: attack_result
attributes.description: The attack result of this entity if the entity has one, else `nil`.

attributes.name: automated_ammo_count
attributes.description: The amount of ammo that inserters automatically insert into this ammo-turret or artillery-turret or `nil`.

attributes.name: autoplace_specification
attributes.description: Autoplace specification for this entity prototype. `nil` if none.

attributes.name: base_productivity
attributes.description: The base productivity of this crafting machine, lab, or mining drill, or `nil`.

attributes.name: belt_speed
attributes.description: The speed of this transport belt or `nil` if this isn't a transport belt related prototype.

attributes.name: braking_force
attributes.description: The braking force of this vehicle prototype or `nil` if not a vehicle prototype.

attributes.name: build_base_evolution_requirement
attributes.description: The evolution requirement to build this entity as a base when expanding enemy bases.

attributes.name: building_grid_bit_shift
attributes.description: The log2 of grid size of the building

attributes.name: burner_prototype
attributes.description: The burner energy source prototype this entity uses or `nil`.

attributes.name: can_open_gates
attributes.description: Whether this unit prototype can open gates or `nil`.

attributes.name: center_collision_mask
attributes.description: The collision mask used only for collision test with tile directly at offshore pump position.

attributes.name: cliff_explosive_prototype
attributes.description: The item prototype name used to destroy this cliff or `nil`.

attributes.name: collision_box
attributes.description: The bounding box used for collision checking.

attributes.name: collision_mask
attributes.description: The collision masks this entity uses

attributes.name: collision_mask_collides_with_self
attributes.description: Does this prototype collision mask collide with itself?

attributes.name: collision_mask_collides_with_tiles_only
attributes.description: Does this prototype collision mask collide with tiles only?

attributes.name: collision_mask_considers_tile_transitions
attributes.description: Does this prototype collision mask consider tile transitions?

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The color of the prototype, or `nil` if the prototype doesn't have color.

attributes.name: construction_radius
attributes.description: The construction radius for this roboport prototype or `nil`.

attributes.name: consumption
attributes.description: The energy consumption of this car prototype or `nil` if not a car prototype.

attributes.name: corpses
attributes.description: Corpses used when this entity is destroyed. It is a dictionary indexed by the corpse's prototype name.

attributes.name: count_as_rock_for_filtered_deconstruction
attributes.description: If this simple-entity is counted as a rock for the deconstruction planner "trees and rocks only" filter.

attributes.name: crafting_categories
attributes.description: The crafting categories this entity supports. Only meaningful when this is a crafting-machine or player entity type.
notes: The value in the dictionary is meaningless and exists just to allow the dictionary type for easy lookup.

attributes.name: crafting_speed
attributes.description: The crafting speed of this crafting-machine or `nil`.

attributes.name: create_ghost_on_death
attributes.description: If this prototype will attempt to create a ghost of itself on death.
notes: If this is false then a ghost will never be made, if it's true a ghost may be made.

attributes.name: created_effect
attributes.description: The trigger run when this entity is created or `nil`.

attributes.name: created_smoke
attributes.description: The smoke trigger run when this entity is built or `nil`.

attributes.name: darkness_for_all_lamps_off
attributes.description: Value between 0 and 1 darkness where all lamps of this lamp prototype are off or `nil`.

attributes.name: darkness_for_all_lamps_on
attributes.description: Value between 0 and 1 darkness where all lamps of this lamp prototype are on or `nil`.

attributes.name: default_collision_mask_with_flags
attributes.description: The hardcoded default collision mask (with flags) for this entity prototype type.

attributes.name: distraction_cooldown
attributes.description: The distraction cooldown of this unit prototype or `nil`.

attributes.name: distribution_effectivity
attributes.description: The distribution effectivity for this beacon prototype or `nil` if not a beacon prototype.

attributes.name: door_opening_speed
attributes.description: The door opening speed for this rocket silo prototype or `nil`.

attributes.name: draw_cargo
attributes.description: Whether this logistics or construction robot renders its cargo when flying or `nil`.

attributes.name: drawing_box
attributes.description: The bounding box used for drawing the entity icon.

attributes.name: effectivity
attributes.description: The effectivity of this car prototype, generator prototype or `nil`.

attributes.name: electric_energy_source_prototype
attributes.description: The electric energy source prototype this entity uses or `nil`.

attributes.name: emissions_per_second
attributes.description: Amount of pollution emissions per second this entity will create.

attributes.name: enemy_map_color
attributes.description: The enemy map color used when charting this entity.

attributes.name: energy_per_hit_point
attributes.description: The energy used per hitpoint taken for this vehicle during collisions or `nil`.

attributes.name: energy_per_move
attributes.description: The energy consumed per tile moved for this flying robot or `nil`.

attributes.name: energy_per_tick
attributes.description: The energy consumed per tick for this flying robot or `nil`.

attributes.name: energy_usage
attributes.description: The direct energy usage of this entity or `nil` if this entity doesn't have a direct energy usage.

attributes.name: engine_starting_speed
attributes.description: The engine starting speed for this rocket silo rocket prototype or `nil`.

attributes.name: explosion_beam
attributes.description: Does this explosion have a beam or `nil` if not an explosion prototype.

attributes.name: explosion_rotate
attributes.description: Does this explosion rotate or `nil` if not an explosion prototype.

attributes.name: fast_replaceable_group
attributes.description: The group of mutually fast-replaceable entities. Possibly `nil`.

attributes.name: filter_count
attributes.description: The filter count of this inserter, loader, or logistic chest or `nil`. For logistic containers, `nil` means no limit.

attributes.name: final_attack_result
attributes.description: The final attack result for projectiles `nil` if not a projectile

attributes.name: fixed_recipe
attributes.description: The fixed recipe name for this assembling machine prototype or `nil`.

attributes.name: flags
attributes.description: The flags for this entity prototype.

attributes.name: fluid
attributes.description: The fluid this offshore pump produces or `nil`.

attributes.name: fluid_capacity
attributes.description: The fluid capacity of this entity or 0 if this entity doesn't support fluids.
notes: Crafting machines will report 0 due to their fluid capacity being what ever a given recipe needs.

attributes.name: fluid_energy_source_prototype
attributes.description: The fluid energy source prototype this entity uses or `nil`.

attributes.name: fluid_usage_per_tick
attributes.description: The fluid usage of this generator prototype or `nil`.

attributes.name: fluidbox_prototypes
attributes.description: The fluidbox prototypes for this entity.

attributes.name: flying_acceleration
attributes.description: The flying acceleration for this rocket silo rocket prototype or `nil`.

attributes.name: flying_speed
attributes.description: The flying speed for this rocket silo rocket prototype or `nil`.

attributes.name: friction_force
attributes.description: The friction of this vehicle prototype or `nil` if not a vehicle prototype.

attributes.name: friendly_map_color
attributes.description: The friendly map color used when charting this entity.

attributes.name: grid_prototype
attributes.description: The equipment grid prototype for this entity or `nil`.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description: Group of this entity.

attributes.name: guns
attributes.description: The guns this prototype uses or `nil`.

attributes.name: has_belt_immunity
attributes.description: Whether this unit, car, or character prototype has belt immunity, `nil` if not car, unit, or character prototype.

attributes.name: healing_per_tick
attributes.description: Amount this entity can heal per tick.

attributes.name: heat_energy_source_prototype
attributes.description: The heat energy source prototype this entity uses or `nil`.

attributes.name: infinite_depletion_resource_amount

classes.name: LuaFlowStatistics
classes.description:
Encapsulates statistic data for different parts of the game. In the context of flow statistics, `input` and `output` describe on which side of the associated GUI the values are shown. Input values are shown on the left side, output values on the right side.

Examples:
- The item production GUI shows "consumption" on the right, thus `output` describes the item consumption numbers. The same goes for fluid consumption.
- The kills gui shows "losses" on the right, so `output` describes how many of the force's entities were killed by enemies.
- The electric network GUI shows "power consumption" on the left side, so in this case `input` describes the power consumption numbers.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Reset all the statistics data to 0.

methods.name: get_flow_count
methods.description: Gets the flow count value for the given time frame.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: If true, the count is returned instead of the per-time-frame value.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Read the input values or the output values

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The prototype name.

parameters.name: precision_index
parameters.description: The precision to read.

parameters.description: The prototype name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The prototype name.

methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

classes.name: LuaFluidBox
classes.description:
An array of fluid boxes of an entity. Entities may contain more than one fluid box, and some can change the number of fluid boxes -- for instance, an assembling machine will change its number of fluid boxes depending on its active recipe.

See [Fluid](Fluid)

Do note that reading from a [LuaFluidBox](LuaFluidBox) creates a new table and writing will copy the given fields from the table into the engine's own fluid box structure. Therefore, the correct way to update a fluidbox of an entity is to read it first, modify the table, then write the modified table back. Directly accessing the returned table's attributes won't have the desired effect.
examples:
Double the temperature of the fluid in `entity`'s first fluid box. 
```
fluid = entity.fluidbox[1]
fluid.temperature = fluid.temperature * 2
entity.fluidbox[1] = fluid
```

methods.name: flush
methods.description: Flushes all fluid from this fluidbox and its fluid system.

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: If provided, only this fluid is flushed.

methods.return_description: The fluid removed.

methods.name: get_capacity
methods.description: The capacity of the given fluidbox index.

methods.name: get_connections
methods.description: The fluidbox connections for the given fluidbox index.

methods.name: get_filter
methods.description: Get a fluid box filter

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the filter to get.

methods.return_description: The filter at the requested index. `nil` if there isn't one.

methods.name: get_flow
methods.description: Flow through the fluidbox in the last tick. It is the larger of in-flow and out-flow.
notes: Fluid wagons do not track it and will return 0.

methods.name: get_locked_fluid
methods.description: Returns the fluid the fluidbox is locked onto Returns 'nil' for no lock

methods.name: get_prototype
methods.description: The prototype of this fluidbox index.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.description: Set a fluid box filter.
notes: Some entities cannot have their fluidbox filter set, notably fluid wagons and crafting machines.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter to set. Setting `nil` clears the filter.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index of the filter to set.

methods.return_description: Whether the filter was set successfully.

attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

operators.name: index
operators.description: Access, set or clear a fluid box. The index must always be in bounds (see [LuaFluidBox::operator #](LuaFluidBox::operator #)). New fluidboxes may not be added or removed using this operator. If the given fluid box doesn't contain any fluid, `nil` is returned. Similarly, `nil` can be written to a fluid box to remove all fluid from it.

classes.name: LuaFluidBoxPrototype
classes.description: A prototype of a fluidbox owned by some [LuaEntityPrototype](LuaEntityPrototype).

methods.name: help

attributes.name: entity

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: The filter or `nil` if no filter is set.

attributes.name: index

attributes.name: maximum_temperature

attributes.name: minimum_temperature
attributes.description: The minimum temperature or `nil` if none is set.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.description: The pipe connection points.

attributes.name: production_type
attributes.description: The production type. "input", "output", "input-output", or "none".

attributes.name: render_layer
attributes.description: The render layer.

attributes.name: secondary_draw_orders
attributes.description: The secondary draw orders for the 4 possible connection directions.

attributes.name: group

attributes.name: heat_capacity

attributes.name: hidden
