classes.name: LuaForce
classes.description: `LuaForce` encapsulates data local to each "force" or "faction" of the game. Default forces are player, enemy and neutral. Players and mods can create additional forces (up to 64 total).

methods.name: add_chart_tag
methods.description: Adds a custom chart tag to the given surface and returns the new tag or `nil` if the given position isn't valid for a chart tag.
notes: The chunk must be charted for a tag to be valid at that location.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Which surface to add the tag to.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The tag to add.

methods.name: add_research
methods.description: Add this technology to the back of the research queue if the queue is enabled. Otherwise, set this technology to be researched now.
methods.return_description: If the technology was added.

methods.name: cancel_charting
methods.description: Cancels pending chart requests for the given surface or all surfaces.

methods.name: cancel_current_research
methods.description: Stop the research currently in progress. This will remove any dependent technologies from the research queue.

methods.name: chart
methods.description: Chart a portion of the map. The chart for the given area is refreshed; it creates chart for any parts of the given area that haven't been charted yet.
examples:
Charts a 2048x2048 rectangle centered around the origin. 
```
game.player.force.chart(game.player.surface, {{x = -1024, y = -1024}, {x = 1024, y = 1024}})
```

parameters.name: area
parameters.description: The area on the given surface to chart.

methods.name: chart_all
methods.description: Chart all generated chunks.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Which surface to chart or all if not given.

methods.name: clear_chart
methods.description: Erases chart data for this force.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Which surface to erase chart data for or if not provided all surfaces charts are erased.

methods.name: disable_all_prototypes
methods.description: Disable all recipes and technologies. Only recipes and technologies enabled explicitly will be useable from this point.

methods.name: disable_research
methods.description: Disable research for this force.

methods.name: enable_all_prototypes
methods.description: Enables all recipes and technologies. The opposite of [LuaForce::disable_all_prototypes](LuaForce::disable_all_prototypes)

methods.name: enable_all_recipes
methods.description: Unlock all recipes.

methods.name: enable_all_technologies
methods.description: Unlock all technologies.

methods.name: enable_research
methods.description: Enable research for this force.

methods.name: find_chart_tags
methods.description: Finds all custom chart tags within the given bounding box on the given surface.

methods.name: find_logistic_network_by_position

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Position to find a network for

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to search on

methods.return_description: The found network or `nil`.

parameters.name: ammo
parameters.description: Ammo category

methods.name: get_cease_fire
methods.description: Is `other` force in this force's cease fire list?

methods.name: get_entity_count
methods.description: Count entities of given type.
notes: This function has O(1) time complexity as entity counts are kept and maintained in the game engine.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the entity.

methods.return_description: Number of entities of given prototype belonging to this force.

methods.name: get_friend
methods.description: Is `other` force in this force's friends list.

parameters.name: ammo
parameters.description: Ammo category

methods.name: get_hand_crafting_disabled_for_recipe
methods.description: Gets if the given recipe is explicitly disabled from being hand crafted.

methods.name: get_item_launched
methods.description: Gets the count of a given item launched in rockets.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to get

methods.return_description: The count of the item that has been launched.

methods.name: get_linked_inventory
methods.description: Gets the linked inventory for the given prototype and link ID if it exists or `nil`.

methods.name: get_saved_technology_progress
methods.description: Gets the saved progress for the given technology or `nil` if there is no saved progress.

parameters.name: technology
parameters.description: The technology

methods.return_description: The progress as a percent.

methods.name: get_train_stops
methods.description: Gets train stops matching the given filters.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: If given only trains on the surface are returned.

parameters.name: turret
parameters.description: Turret prototype name

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.name: is_chunk_charted
methods.description: Has a chunk been charted?

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Position of the chunk.

methods.name: is_chunk_visible
methods.description: Is the given chunk currently charted and visible (not covered by fog of war) on the map.

methods.name: is_enemy
methods.description: Is this force an enemy? This differs from `get_cease_fire` in that it is always false for neutral force. This is equivalent to checking the `enemy` ForceCondition.

methods.name: is_friend
methods.description: Is this force a friend? This differs from `get_friend` in that it is always true for neutral force. This is equivalent to checking the `friend` ForceCondition.

methods.name: is_pathfinder_busy
methods.description: Is pathfinder busy? When the pathfinder is busy, it won't accept any more pathfinding requests.

methods.name: kill_all_units
methods.description: Kill all units and flush the pathfinder.

methods.name: play_sound
methods.description: Play a sound for every player in this force.

parameters.name: override_sound_type
parameters.description: The volume mixer to play the sound through. Defaults to the default mixer for the given sound type.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The sound to play.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the sound should be played. If not given, it's played at the current position of each player.

parameters.name: volume_modifier
parameters.description: The volume of the sound to play. Must be between 0 and 1 inclusive.

methods.name: print
methods.description: Print text to the chat console of all players on this force.
notes: Messages that are identical to a message sent in the last 60 ticks are not printed again.

methods.name: rechart
methods.description: Force a rechart of the whole chart.

methods.name: research_all_technologies
methods.description: Research all technologies.

parameters.name: include_disabled_prototypes
parameters.description: Whether technologies that are explicitly disabled in the prototype should also be researched. Defaults to `false`.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Reset everything. All technologies are set to not researched, all modifiers are set to default values.

methods.name: reset_evolution
methods.description: Resets evolution for this force to zero.

methods.name: reset_recipes
methods.description: Load the original version of all recipes from the prototypes.

methods.name: reset_technologies
methods.description: Load the original versions of technologies from prototypes. Preserves research state of technologies.

methods.name: reset_technology_effects
methods.description: Reapplies all possible research effects, including unlocked recipes. Any custom changes are lost. Preserves research state of technologies.

parameters.name: ammo
parameters.description: Ammo category

methods.name: set_cease_fire
methods.description: Add `other` force to this force's cease fire list. Forces on the cease fire list won't be targeted for attack.

methods.name: set_friend
methods.description: Add `other` force to this force's friends list. Friends have unrestricted access to buildings and turrets won't fire at them.

parameters.name: ammo
parameters.description: Ammo category

methods.name: set_hand_crafting_disabled_for_recipe
methods.description: Sets if the given recipe can be hand-crafted. This is used to explicitly disable hand crafting a recipe - it won't allow hand-crafting otherwise not hand-craftable recipes.

methods.name: set_item_launched
methods.description: Sets the count of a given item launched in rockets.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The count to set

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to set

methods.name: set_saved_technology_progress
methods.description: Sets the saved progress for the given technology. The technology must not be in progress, must not be completed, and the new progress must be < 100%.

parameters.name: progress
parameters.description: Progress as a percent. Set to `nil` to remove the saved progress.

parameters.name: technology
parameters.description: The technology

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The new position on the given surface.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to set the spawn position for.

parameters.name: turret
parameters.description: Turret prototype name

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The chunk position to unchart.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: Surface to unchart on.

attributes.name: ai_controllable
attributes.description: Enables some higher-level AI behaviour for this force. When set to `true`, biters belonging to this force will automatically expand into new territories, build new spawners, and form unit groups. By default, this value is `true` for the enemy force and `false` for all others.
notes: Setting this to `false` does not turn off biters' AI. They will still move around and attack players who come close.
It is necessary for a force to be AI controllable in order to be able to create unit groups or build bases from scripts.

attributes.name: character_inventory_slots_bonus
attributes.description: the number of additional inventory slots the character main inventory has.

attributes.name: character_logistic_requests
attributes.description: `true` if character requester logistics is enabled.

attributes.name: character_running_speed_modifier
attributes.description: Modifies the running speed of all characters in this force by the given value as a percentage. Setting the running modifier to `0.5` makes the character run 50% faster. The minimum value of `-1` reduces the movement speed by 100%, resulting in a speed of `0`.

attributes.name: character_trash_slot_count
attributes.description: Number of character trash slots.

attributes.name: connected_players
attributes.description:
The connected players belonging to this force.

This is primarily useful when you want to do some action against all online players of this force.
notes: This does *not* index using player index. See [LuaPlayer::index](LuaPlayer::index) on each player instance for the player index.

attributes.name: current_research
attributes.description: The current technology in research, or `nil` if no research is currently ongoing.

attributes.name: deconstruction_time_to_live
attributes.description: The time, in ticks, before a deconstruction order is removed.

attributes.name: entity_build_count_statistics
attributes.description: The entity build statistics for this force (built and mined)

attributes.name: evolution_factor
attributes.description: Evolution factor of this force.

attributes.name: fluid_production_statistics
attributes.description: The fluid production statistics for this force.

attributes.name: following_robots_lifetime_modifier
attributes.description: Additional lifetime for following robots.

attributes.name: friendly_fire
attributes.description: If friendly fire is enabled for this force.

attributes.name: ghost_time_to_live
attributes.description: The time, in ticks, before a placed ghost disappears.

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: Unique ID associated with this force.

attributes.name: inserter_stack_size_bonus
attributes.description: The inserter stack size bonus for non stack inserters

attributes.name: item_production_statistics
attributes.description: The item production statistics for this force.

attributes.name: items_launched
attributes.description: All of the items that have been launched in rockets.

attributes.name: kill_count_statistics
attributes.description: The kill counter statistics for this force.

attributes.name: logistic_networks
attributes.description: List of logistic networks, grouped by surface.

attributes.name: manual_crafting_speed_modifier
attributes.description: Multiplier of the manual crafting speed. Default value is `0`. The actual crafting speed will be multiplied by `1 + manual_crafting_speed_modifier`.
examples:
Double the player's crafting speed 
```
game.player.force.manual_crafting_speed_modifier = 1
```

attributes.name: manual_mining_speed_modifier
attributes.description: Multiplier of the manual mining speed. Default value is `0`. The actual mining speed will be multiplied by `1 + manual_mining_speed_modifier`.
examples:
Double the player's mining speed 
```
game.player.force.manual_mining_speed_modifier = 1
```

attributes.name: maximum_following_robot_count
attributes.description: Maximum number of follower robots.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the force.
examples:
Prints "`player`" 
```
game.player.print(game.player.force.name)
```

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: players
attributes.description: Players belonging to this force.

attributes.name: previous_research
attributes.description: The previous research if any.

attributes.name: recipes
attributes.description: Recipes available to this force, indexed by `name`.
examples:
Prints the category of the given recipe 
```
game.player.print(game.player.force.recipes["transport-belt"].category)
```

attributes.name: research_enabled
attributes.description: Whether research is enabled for this force, see [LuaForce::enable_research](LuaForce::enable_research) and [LuaForce::disable_research](LuaForce::disable_research)

attributes.name: research_progress
attributes.description: Progress of current research, as a number in range [0, 1].

attributes.name: research_queue
attributes.description:
The research queue of this force. The first technology in the array is the currently active one. Reading this attribute gives an array of [LuaTechnology](LuaTechnology).

To write to this, the entire table must be written. Providing an empty table or `nil` will empty the research queue and cancel the current research. Writing to this when the research queue is disabled will simply set the last research in the table as the current research.
notes: This only allows mods to queue research that this force is able to research in the first place. As an example, an already researched technology or one whose prerequisites are not fulfilled will not be queued, but dropped silently instead.

attributes.name: research_queue_enabled
attributes.description: Whether the research queue is available for this force.

attributes.name: rockets_launched
attributes.description: The number of rockets launched.

attributes.name: share_chart
attributes.description: If sharing chart data is enabled for this force.

attributes.name: stack_inserter_capacity_bonus
attributes.description: Number of items that can be transferred by stack inserters. When writing to this value, it must be >= 0 and <= 254.

attributes.name: technologies
attributes.description: Technologies owned by this force, indexed by `name`.
examples:
Researches the technology for the player's force 
```
game.player.force.technologies["steel-processing"].researched = true
```

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: zoom_to_world_blueprint_enabled
attributes.description: Ability to create new blueprints using empty blueprint item when using zoom-to-world.

attributes.name: zoom_to_world_deconstruction_planner_enabled
attributes.description: Ability to use deconstruction planner when using zoom-to-world.

attributes.name: zoom_to_world_enabled
attributes.description: Ability to use zoom-to-world on map.

attributes.name: zoom_to_world_ghost_building_enabled
attributes.description: Ability to build ghosts through blueprint or direct ghost placement, or "mine" ghosts when using zoom-to-world.

attributes.name: zoom_to_world_selection_tool_enabled
attributes.description: Ability to use custom selection tools when using zoom-to-world.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of this prototype.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Order string of this prototype.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaGameScript
classes.description: Main toplevel type, provides access to most of the API though its members. An instance of LuaGameScript is available as the global object named `game`.

methods.name: auto_save
methods.description: Instruct the game to perform an auto-save.
notes: Only the server will save in multiplayer. In single player a standard auto-save is triggered.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The autosave name if any. Saves will be named _autosave-*name* when provided.

methods.name: ban_player
methods.description: Bans the given player from this multiplayer game. Does nothing if this is a single player game of if the player running this isn't an admin.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to ban.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason given if any.

methods.name: check_consistency
methods.description: Run internal consistency checks. Allegedly prints any errors it finds.
notes: Exists mainly for debugging reasons.

methods.name: check_prototype_translations
methods.description: Goes over all items, entities, tiles, recipes, technologies among other things and logs if the locale is incorrect.
notes: Also prints true/false if called from the console.

methods.name: count_pipe_groups
methods.description: Counts how many distinct groups of pipes exist in the world.

methods.name: create_force
methods.description: Create a new force.
notes: The game currently supports a maximum of 64 forces, including the three built-in forces. This means that a maximum of 61 new forces may be created.
Force names must be unique.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Name of the new force

methods.return_description: The force that was just created

methods.name: create_inventory
methods.description: Creates an inventory that is not owned by any game object. It can be resized later with [LuaInventory::resize](LuaInventory::resize).
notes: Make sure to destroy it when you are done with it with [LuaInventory::destroy](LuaInventory::destroy).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of slots the inventory initially has.

methods.name: create_profiler
methods.description: Creates a [LuaProfiler](LuaProfiler), which is used for measuring script performance.
notes: LuaProfiler cannot be serialized.

parameters.name: stopped
parameters.description: Create the timer stopped

methods.name: create_random_generator
methods.description: Creates a deterministic standalone random generator with the given seed or if a seed is not provided the initial map seed is used.
notes: *Make sure* you actually want to use this over math.random(...) as this provides entirely different functionality over math.random(...).

methods.name: create_surface
methods.description: Create a new surface
notes: The game currently supports a maximum of 4,294,967,295 surfaces, including the default surface.
Surface names must be unique

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the new surface

parameters.name: settings
parameters.description: Map generation settings

methods.return_description: The surface that was just created

methods.name: decode_string
methods.description: Base64 decodes and inflates the given string.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The string to decode.

methods.return_description: The decoded string or `nil` if the decode failed.

methods.name: delete_surface
methods.description: Deletes the given surface and all entities on it.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: The surface to be deleted. Currently the primary surface (1, 'nauvis') cannot be deleted.

methods.name: direction_to_string
methods.description: Converts the given direction into the string version of the direction.

methods.name: disable_replay
methods.description: Disables replay saving for the current save file. Once done there's no way to re-enable replay saving for the save file without loading an old save.

methods.name: disable_tutorial_triggers
methods.description: Disables tutorial triggers, that unlock new tutorials and show notices about unlocked tutorials.

methods.name: encode_string
methods.description: Deflates and base64 encodes the given string.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The string to encode.

methods.return_description: The encoded string or `nil` if the encode failed.

methods.name: evaluate_expression
methods.description: Evaluate an expression, substituting variables as provided. For details on the formula, see the relevant page on the [Factorio wiki](https://wiki.factorio.com/Prototype/Technology#unit).
examples:
Calculate the number of research units required to unlock mining productivity level 10. 
```
local formula = game.forces["player"].technologies["mining-productivity-4"].research_unit_count_formula
local units = game.evaluate_expression(formula, { L = 10, l = 10 })
```

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description: Variables to be substituted.

methods.name: force_crc
methods.description: Force a CRC check. Tells all peers to calculate their current map CRC; these CRC are then compared against each other. If a mismatch is detected, the game is desynced and some peers are forced to reconnect.

methods.name: get_active_entities_count
methods.description: Gets the number of entities that are active (updated each tick).
notes: This is very expensive to calculate.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: If give, only the entities active on this surface are counted.

methods.name: get_filtered_achievement_prototypes
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaAchievementPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
Get every achievement prototype that is not allowed to be completed on the peaceful difficulty setting. 
```
local prototypes = game.get_filtered_achievement_prototypes{{filter="allowed-without-fight", invert=true}}
```

methods.name: get_filtered_decorative_prototypes
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaDecorativePrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
Get every decorative prototype that is auto-placed. 
```
local prototypes = game.get_filtered_decorative_prototypes{{filter="autoplace"}}
```

methods.name: get_filtered_entity_prototypes
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaEntityPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
Get every entity prototype that can craft recipes involving fluids in the way some assembling machines can. 
```
local prototypes = game.get_filtered_entity_prototypes{{filter="crafting-category", crafting_category="crafting-with-fluid"}}
```

methods.name: get_filtered_equipment_prototypes
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaEquipmentPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
Get every equipment prototype that functions as a battery. 
```
local prototypes = game.get_filtered_equipment_prototypes{{filter="type", type="battery-equipment"}}
```

methods.name: get_filtered_fluid_prototypes
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaFluidPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
Get every fluid prototype that has a heat capacity of exactly `100`. 
```
local prototypes = game.get_filtered_fluid_prototypes{{filter="heat-capacity", comparison="=", value=100}}
```

methods.name: get_filtered_item_prototypes
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaItemPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
Get every item prototype that, when launched with a rocket, produces a result. 
```
local prototypes = game.get_filtered_item_prototypes{{filter="has-rocket-launch-products"}}
```

methods.name: get_filtered_mod_setting_prototypes
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaModSettingPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
Get every mod setting prototype that belongs to the specified mod. 
```
local prototypes = game.get_filtered_mod_setting_prototypes{{filter="mod", mod="space-exploration"}}
```

methods.name: get_filtered_recipe_prototypes
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaRecipePrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
Get every recipe prototype that takes less than half a second to craft (at crafting speed `1`). 
```
local prototypes = game.get_filtered_recipe_prototypes{{filter="energy", comparison="<", value=0.5}}
```

methods.name: get_filtered_technology_prototypes
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaTechnologyPrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
Get every technology prototype that can be researched at the start of the game. 
```
local prototypes = game.get_filtered_technology_prototypes{{filter="has-prerequisites", invert=true}}
```

methods.name: get_filtered_tile_prototypes
methods.description: Returns a dictionary of all LuaTilePrototypes that fit the given filters. The prototypes are indexed by `name`.
examples:
Get every tile prototype that improves a player's walking speed by at least 50%. 
```
local prototypes = game.get_filtered_tile_prototypes{{filter="walking-speed-modifier", comparison="≥", value=1.5}}
```

methods.name: kick_player

methods.name: merge_forces
methods.description: Marks two forces to be merge together. All entities in the source force will be reassigned to the target force. The source force will then be destroyed.
notes: The three built-in forces -- player, enemy and neutral -- can't be destroyed. I.e. they can't be used as the source argument to this function.

The source force is not merged until the end of the current tick or if called during the [on_forces_merging](on_forces_merging) event or [on_forces_merged](on_forces_merged) event the end of the next tick.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The force to reassign all entities to

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The force to remove

methods.name: play_sound

parameters.name: override_sound_type
parameters.description: The volume mixer to play the sound through. Defaults to the default mixer for the given sound type.

parameters.name: path

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the sound should be played. If not given, it's played at the current position of each player.

parameters.name: volume_modifier

methods.name: print

methods.name: take_screenshot
methods.description: Take a screenshot and save it to a file. The filename should include a file extension indicating the desired image format. Supports `.png`, `.jpg` / `.jpeg`, `.tga` and `.bmp`.
notes: If Factorio is running headless, this function will do nothing.

parameters.name: allow_in_replay
parameters.description: Whether to save the screenshot even during replay playback. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: anti_alias
parameters.description: Whether to render in double resolution and downscale the result (including GUI). Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: by_player
parameters.description: If defined, the screenshot will only be taken for this player.

parameters.name: daytime
parameters.description: Overrides the current surface daytime for the duration of screenshot rendering.

parameters.name: force_render
parameters.description: Screenshot requests are processed in between game update and render. The game may skip rendering (ie. drop frames) if the previous frame has not finished rendering or the game simulation starts to fall below 60 updates per second. If `force_render` is set to `true`, the game won't drop frames and process the screenshot request at the end of the update in which the request was created. This is not honored on multiplayer clients that are catching up to server. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The sub-path in `"script-output"` to save the screenshot to. Defaults to `"screenshot.png"`.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to focus on. Defaults to the local player.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: If defined, the screenshot will be centered on this position. Otherwise, the screenshot will center on `player`.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: The `.jpg` render quality as a percentage (from 0% to 100% inclusive), if used. A lower value means a more compressed image. Defaults to `80`.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: The maximum allowed resolution is 16384x16384 (8192x8192 when `anti_alias` is `true`), but the maximum recommended resolution is 4096x4096 (resp. 2048x2048).

parameters.name: show_cursor_building_preview
parameters.description: When `true` and when `player` is specified, the building preview for the item in the player's cursor will also be rendered. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: show_entity_info
parameters.description: Whether to include entity info ("Alt mode") or not. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: show_gui
parameters.description: Whether to include GUIs in the screenshot or not. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: surface
parameters.description: If defined, the screenshot will be taken on this surface.

parameters.name: water_tick
parameters.description: Overrides the tick of water animation, if animated water is enabled.

parameters.name: zoom
parameters.description: The map zoom to take the screenshot at. Defaults to `1`.

methods.name: take_technology_screenshot
methods.description: Take a screenshot of the technology screen and save it to a file. The filename should include a file extension indicating the desired image format. Supports `.png`, `.jpg` / `.jpeg`, `.tga` and `.bmp`.

parameters.name: by_player
parameters.description: If given, the screenshot will only be taken for this player.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force whose technology to screenshot. If not given, the `"player`" force is used.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The sub-path in `"script-output"` to save the screenshot to. Defaults to `"technology-screenshot.png"`.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: The `.jpg` render quality as a percentage (from 0% to 100% inclusive), if used. A lower value means a more compressed image. Defaults to `80`.

parameters.name: selected_technology
parameters.description: The technology to highlight.

parameters.name: skip_disabled
parameters.description: If `true`, disabled technologies will be skipped. Their successors will be attached to the disabled technology's parents. Defaults to `false`.

methods.name: unban_player
methods.description: Unbans the given player from this multiplayer game. Does nothing if this is a single player game of if the player running this isn't an admin.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to unban.

methods.name: unmute_player
methods.description: Unmutes the given player. Does nothing if the player running this isn't an admin.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to unmute.

methods.name: write_file
methods.description: Write a string to a file.

parameters.name: append
parameters.description: When `true`, this will append to the end of the file. Defaults to `false`, which will overwrite any pre-existing file with the new data.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: File content

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Path to the file to write to.

parameters.name: for_player
parameters.description: If given, the file will only be written for this player_index. 0 means only the server if one exists.

notes: This differs over [LuaGameScript::tick](LuaGameScript::tick) in that making a game from a scenario always starts with ticks_played value at 0 even if the scenario has its own level data where the [LuaGameScript::tick](LuaGameScript::tick) is > 0.

When [LuaGameScript::tick_paused](LuaGameScript::tick_paused) is true, ticks_to_run behaves the following way: While this is > 0, the entity update is running normally and this value is decremented every tick. When this reaches 0, the game will pause again.

classes.name: LuaGenericOnOffControlBehavior
classes.description: An abstract base class for behaviors that support switching the entity on or off based on some condition.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

attributes.name: circuit_condition
attributes.description: The circuit condition.
notes: `condition` may be `nil` in order to clear the circuit condition.
examples:
Tell an entity to be active (e.g. a lamp to be lit) when it receives a circuit signal of more than 4 chain signals. 
```
a_behavior.circuit_condition = {condition={comparator=">",
                                           first_signal={type="item", name="rail-chain-signal"},
                                           constant=4}}
```

attributes.name: logistic_condition
attributes.description: The logistic condition.
notes: `condition` may be `nil` in order to clear the logistic condition.
examples:
Tell an entity to be active (e.g. a lamp to be lit) when the logistics network it's connected to has more than four chain signals. 
```
a_behavior.logistic_condition = {condition={comparator=">",
                                            first_signal={type="item", name="rail-chain-signal"},
                                            constant=4}}
```

attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.description: The additional order value used in recipe ordering.
notes: Can only be used on groups, not on subgroups.

attributes.name: subgroups
attributes.description: Subgroups of this group.
notes: Can only be used on groups, not on subgroups.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaGui
classes.description: The root of the GUI. This type houses the root elements, `top`, `left`, `center`, `goal`, and `screen`, to which other elements can be added to be displayed on screen.
notes: Every player can have a different GUI state.

methods.name: help

methods.name: is_valid_sprite_path

parameters.name: sprite_path
parameters.description: Path to a image.

attributes.name: center
attributes.description: The center part of the GUI. It is a flow element.

attributes.name: children
attributes.description: The children GUI elements mapped by name <> element.

attributes.name: goal
attributes.description: The flow used in the objectives window. It is a flow element. The objectives window is only visible when the flow is not empty or the objective text is set.

attributes.name: left
attributes.description: The left part of the GUI. It is a flow element inside a scroll pane element.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: top

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaGuiElement
classes.description:
An element of a custom GUI. This type is used to represent any kind of a GUI element - labels, buttons and frames are all instances of this type. Just like [LuaEntity](LuaEntity), different kinds of elements support different attributes; attempting to access an attribute on an element that doesn't support it (for instance, trying to access the `column_count` of a `textfield`) will result in a runtime error.

The following types of GUI element are supported:

- `"button"`: A clickable element. Relevant event: [on_gui_click](on_gui_click)
- `"sprite-button"`: A `button` that displays a sprite rather than text. Relevant event: [on_gui_click](on_gui_click)
- `"checkbox"`: A clickable element with a check mark that can be turned off or on. Relevant event: [on_gui_checked_state_changed](on_gui_checked_state_changed)
- `"flow"`: An invisible container that lays out its children either horizontally or vertically.
- `"frame"`: A non-transparent box that contains other elements. It can have a title (set via the `caption` attribute). Just like a `flow`, it lays out its children either horizontally or vertically. Relevant event: [on_gui_location_changed](on_gui_location_changed)
- `"label"`: A piece of text.
- `"line"`: A horizontal or vertical separation line.
- `"progressbar"`: A partially filled bar that can be used to indicate progress.
- `"table"`: An invisible container that lays out its children in a specific number of columns. The width of each column is determined by the widest element it contains.
- `"textfield"`: A single-line box the user can type into. Relevant events: [on_gui_text_changed](on_gui_text_changed), [on_gui_confirmed](on_gui_confirmed)
- `"radiobutton"`: A clickable element that is functionally identical to a `checkbox`, but has a circular appearance. Relevant event: [on_gui_checked_state_changed](on_gui_checked_state_changed)
- `"sprite"`: An element that shows an image.
- `"scroll-pane"`: An invisible element that is similar to a `flow`, but has the ability to show and use scroll bars.
- `"drop-down"`: A drop-down containing strings of text. Relevant event: [on_gui_selection_state_changed](on_gui_selection_state_changed)
- `"list-box"`: A list of strings, only one of which can be selected at a time. Shows a scroll bar if necessary. Relevant event: [on_gui_selection_state_changed](on_gui_selection_state_changed)
- `"camera"`: A camera that shows the game at the given position on the given surface. It can visually track an [entity](LuaGuiElement::entity) that is set after the element has been created.
- `"choose-elem-button"`: A button that lets the player pick from a certain kind of prototype, with optional filtering. Relevant event: [on_gui_elem_changed](on_gui_elem_changed)
- `"text-box"`: A multi-line `textfield`. Relevant event: [on_gui_text_changed](on_gui_text_changed)
- `"slider"`: A horizontal number line which can be used to choose a number. Relevant event: [on_gui_value_changed](on_gui_value_changed)
- `"minimap"`: A minimap preview, similar to the normal player minimap. It can visually track an [entity](LuaGuiElement::entity) that is set after the element has been created.
- `"entity-preview"`: A preview of an entity. The [entity](LuaGuiElement::entity) has to be set after the element has been created.
- `"empty-widget"`: An empty element that just exists. The root GUI elements `screen` and `relative` are `empty-widget`s.
- `"tabbed-pane"`: A collection of `tab`s and their contents. Relevant event: [on_gui_selected_tab_changed](on_gui_selected_tab_changed)
- `"tab"`: A tab for use in a `tabbed-pane`.
- `"switch"`: A switch with three possible states. Can have labels attached to either side. Relevant event: [on_gui_switch_state_changed](on_gui_switch_state_changed)

Each GUI element allows access to its children by having them as attributes. Thus, one can use the `parent.child` syntax to refer to children. Lua also supports the `parent["child"]` syntax to refer to the same element. This can be used in cases where the child has a name that isn't a valid Lua identifier.
examples:
This will add a label called `greeting` to the top flow. Immediately after, it will change its text to illustrate accessing child elements. 
```
game.player.gui.top.add{type="label", name="greeting", caption="Hi"}
game.player.gui.top.greeting.caption = "Hello there!"
game.player.gui.top["greeting"].caption = "Actually, never mind, I don't like your face"
```

methods.description: Remove this element, along with its children. Any [LuaGuiElement](LuaGuiElement) objects referring to the destroyed elements become invalid after this operation.
notes: The top-level GUI elements - [LuaGui::top](LuaGui::top), [LuaGui::left](LuaGui::left), [LuaGui::center](LuaGui::center) and [LuaGui::screen](LuaGui::screen) - can't be destroyed.

```

attributes.name: elem_filters
attributes.description:
The elem filters of this choose-elem-button or `nil` if there are no filters.

The compatible type of filter is determined by elem_type:
- Type `"item"` - [ItemPrototypeFilter](ItemPrototypeFilter)
- Type `"tile"` - [TilePrototypeFilter](TilePrototypeFilter)
- Type `"entity"` - [EntityPrototypeFilter](EntityPrototypeFilter)
- Type `"signal"` - Does not support filters
- Type `"fluid"` - [FluidPrototypeFilter](FluidPrototypeFilter)
- Type `"recipe"` - [RecipePrototypeFilter](RecipePrototypeFilter)
- Type `"decorative"` - [DecorativePrototypeFilter](DecorativePrototypeFilter)
- Type `"item-group"` - Does not support filters
- Type `"achievement"` - [AchievementPrototypeFilter](AchievementPrototypeFilter)
- Type `"equipment"` - [EquipmentPrototypeFilter](EquipmentPrototypeFilter)
- Type `"technology"` - [TechnologyPrototypeFilter](TechnologyPrototypeFilter)
notes: Writing to this field does not change or clear the currently selected element.
examples:
This will configure a choose-elem-button of type `"entity"` to only show items of type `"furnace"`. 
```
button.elem_filters = {{filter = "type", type = "furnace"}}
```

Then, there are some types of filters that work on a specific kind of attribute. The following will configure a choose-elem-button of type `"entity"` to only show entities that have their `"hidden"` [flags](EntityPrototypeFlags) set. 
```
button.elem_filters = {{filter = "hidden"}}
```

Lastly, these filters can be combined at will, taking care to specify how they should be combined (either `"and"` or `"or"`. The following will filter for any `"entities"` that are `"furnaces"` and that are not `"hidden"`. 
```
button.elem_filters = {{filter = "type", type = "furnace"}, {filter = "hidden", invert = true, mode = "and"}}
```

attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

attributes.name: circuit_set_stack_size
attributes.description: If the stack size of the inserter is set through the circuit network or not.

attributes.description: The signal used to set the stack size of the inserter.

attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. methods.name: can_insert
methods.description: Can at least some items be inserted?

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Items that would be inserted.

methods.return_description: `true` if at least a part of the given items could be inserted into this inventory.

methods.name: can_set_filter
methods.description: If the given inventory slot filter can be set to the given filter.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The item name of the filter

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The item stack index

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Make this inventory empty.

methods.name: count_empty_stacks
methods.description: Counts the number of empty stacks.

parameters.name: include_filtered
parameters.description: If true, filtered slots will be included. Defaults to false.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys this inventory.
notes: Only inventories created by [LuaGameScript::create_inventory](LuaGameScript::create_inventory) can be destroyed this way.

methods.name: find_empty_stack
methods.description: Finds the first empty stack. Filtered slots are excluded unless a filter item is given.
notes: This will also return the stack index if one is found that matches as a second return value.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: If given, empty stacks that are filtered for this item will be included.

methods.return_description: The first empty stack, or `nil` if there aren't any empty stacks.

methods.name: find_item_stack
methods.description: Gets the first LuaItemStack in the inventory that matches the given item name.
notes: This will also return the stack index if one is found that matches as a second return value.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item name to find

methods.return_description: The first matching stack, or `nil` if none match.

methods.name: get_bar
methods.description: Get the current bar. This is the index at which the red area starts.
notes: Only useable if this inventory supports having a bar.

methods.name: get_contents
methods.description: Get counts of all items in this inventory.
methods.return_description: The counts, indexed by item names.

methods.name: get_filter
methods.description: Gets the filter for the given item stack index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The item stack index

methods.return_description: The current filter or nil if none.

methods.name: get_insertable_count
methods.description: Gets the number of the given item that can be inserted into this inventory.
notes: This is a "best guess" number; things like assembling machine filtered slots, module slots, items with durability, and items with mixed health will cause the result to be inaccurate.
The main use for this is in checking how many of a basic item can fit into a basic inventory.
This accounts for the 'bar' on the inventory.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to check.

methods.name: get_item_count
methods.description: Get the number of all or some items in this inventory.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Prototype name of the item to count. If not specified, count all items.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Insert items into this inventory.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Items to insert.

methods.return_description: Number of items actually inserted.

methods.name: is_empty
methods.description: Does this inventory contain nothing?

methods.name: is_filtered
methods.description: If this inventory supports filters and has at least 1 filter set.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Remove items from this inventory.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Items to remove.

methods.return_description: Number of items actually removed.

methods.name: resize
methods.description: Resizes the inventory.
notes: Items in slots beyond the new capacity are deleted.
Only inventories created by [LuaGameScript::create_inventory](LuaGameScript::create_inventory) can be resized.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: New size of a inventory

methods.name: set_bar
methods.description: Set the current bar.
notes: Only useable if this inventory supports having a bar.

parameters.name: bar
parameters.description: The new limit. Omitting this parameter will clear the limit.

methods.name: set_filter
methods.description: Sets the filter for the given item stack index.
notes: Some inventory slots don't allow some filters (gun ammo can't be filtered for non-ammo).

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The new filter or nil to erase the filter

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The item stack index

methods.return_description: If the filter was allowed to be set.

methods.name: sort_and_merge
methods.description: Sorts and merges the items in this inventory.

methods.name: supports_bar
methods.description: Does this inventory support a bar? Bar is the draggable red thing, found for example on chests, that limits the portion of the inventory that may be manipulated by machines.
notes: "Supporting a bar" doesn't mean that the bar is set to some nontrivial value. Supporting a bar means the inventory supports having this limit at all. The character's inventory is an example of an inventory without a bar; the wooden chest's inventory is an example of one with a bar.

methods.name: supports_filters
methods.description: If this inventory supports filters.

It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. operators.name: index
examples:
Will get the first item in the player's inventory. 
```
game.player.get_main_inventory()[1]
```

operators.name: length
operators.description: Get the number of slots in this inventory.
examples:
Will print the number of slots in the player's main inventory. 
```
game.player.print(#game.player.get_main_inventory())
```

classes.name: LuaItemPrototype

game.item_prototypes["iron-plate"]
```

classes.name: LuaItemStack
classes.description: A reference to an item and count owned by some external entity.
notes: In most instances this is a simple reference as in: it points at a specific slot in an inventory and not the item in the slot.

In the instance this references an item on a [LuaTransportLine](LuaTransportLine) the reference is only guaranteed to stay valid (and refer to the same item) as long as nothing changes the transport line.

All strings in this array must be entity prototype names that don't have the `"not-deconstructable"` flag set and are either a `cliff` or marked as `minable`.

attributes.description: If this is a upgrade item.

attributes.name: item_number
attributes.description:
The unique identifier for this item if it has one, `nil` otherwise. Note that this ID stays the same no matter where the item is moved to.

Only these types of items have unique IDs:
- `"armor"`
- `"spidertron-remote"`
- `"selection-tool"`
- `"copy-paste-tool"`
- `"upgrade-item"`
- `"deconstruction-item"`
- `"blueprint"`
- `"blueprint-book"`
- `"item-with-entity-data"`
- `"item-with-inventory"`
- `"item-with-tags"`

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: valid_for_read
attributes.description: Is this valid for reading? Differs from the usual `valid` in that `valid` will be `true` even if the item stack is blank but the entity that holds it is still valid.

classes.name: LuaLazyLoadedValue
classes.description:
A lazily loaded value. For performance reasons, we sometimes return a custom lazily-loaded value type instead of the native Lua value. This custom type lazily constructs the necessary value when [LuaLazyLoadedValue::get](LuaLazyLoadedValue::get) is called, therefore preventing its unnecessary construction in some cases.

An instance of LuaLazyLoadedValue is only valid during the event it was created from and cannot be saved.

classes.name: LuaLogisticNetwork
classes.description: A single logistic network of a given force on a given surface.

methods.name: find_cell_closest_to
methods.description: Find logistic cell closest to a given position.
methods.return_description: May be `nil` if no cell was found.

methods.name: get_contents
methods.description: Get item counts for the entire network.
methods.return_description: A mapping of item prototype names to the number available in the network.

methods.name: get_item_count
methods.description: Count given or all items in the network or given members.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Item name to count. If not given, gives counts of all items in the network.

parameters.name: member
parameters.description: Logistic members to check, must be either `"storage"` or `"providers"`. If not given, gives count in the entire network.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Insert items into the logistic network. This will actually insert the items into some logistic chests.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: What to insert.

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: Which logistic members to insert the items to. Must be `"storage"`, `"storage-empty"` (storage chests that are completely empty), `"storage-empty-slot"` (storage chests that have an empty slot), or `"requester"`. If not specified, inserts items into the logistic network in the usual order.

methods.return_description: Number of items actually inserted.

methods.name: remove_item
methods.description: Remove items from the logistic network. This will actually remove the items from some logistic chests.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: What to remove.

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: Which logistic members to remove from. Must be `"storage"`, `"passive-provider"`, `"buffer"`, or `"active-provider"`. If not specified, removes from the network in the usual order.

methods.return_description: Number of items removed.

methods.name: select_drop_point
methods.description: Find a logistic point to drop the specific item stack.

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: When given, it will find from only the specific type of member. Must be `"storage"`, `"storage-empty"`, `"storage-empty-slot"` or `"requester"`. If not specified, selects with normal priorities.

parameters.name: stack
parameters.description: Name of the item to select.

methods.return_description: May be `nil` if no point was found.

methods.name: select_pickup_point
methods.description: Find the 'best' logistic point with this item ID and from the given position or from given chest type.

parameters.name: include_buffers
parameters.description: Whether to consider buffer chests or not. Defaults to false. Only considered if selecting with position.

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: When given, it will find from only the specific type of member. Must be `"storage"`, `"passive-provider"`, `"buffer"` or `"active-provider"`. If not specified, selects with normal priorities. Not considered if position is specified.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the item to select.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: When given, it will find the storage 'best' storage point from this position.

methods.return_description: May be `nil` if no point was found.

classes.name: LuaLogisticPoint

A "Logistic point" is the name given for settings and properties used by requester, provider, and storage points in a given logistic network. These "points" don't have to be a logistic container but often are. One other entity that can own several points is the "character" character type entity.

classes.name: LuaPlayer
classes.description: A player in the game. Pay attention that a player may or may not have a character, which is the [LuaEntity](LuaEntity) of the little guy running around the world doing things.

methods.name: activate_paste
methods.description: Gets a copy of the currently selected blueprint in the clipboard queue into the player's cursor, as if the player activated Paste.

methods.name: add_alert
methods.description: Adds an alert to this player for the given entity of the given alert type.

methods.name: add_custom_alert
methods.description: Adds a custom alert to this player.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: If the alert is clicked, the map will open at the position of this entity.

methods.name: add_recipe_notification
methods.description: Adds the given recipe to the list of recipe notifications for this player.

parameters.name: recipe
parameters.description: Name of the recipe prototype to add.

methods.name: add_to_clipboard
methods.description: Adds the given blueprint to this player's clipboard queue.

parameters.name: blueprint
parameters.description: The blueprint to add.

methods.name: associate_character
methods.description: Associates a character with this player.
notes: The character must not be connected to any controller.
If this player is currently disconnected (see [LuaPlayer::connected](LuaPlayer::connected)) the character will be immediately "logged off".
See [LuaPlayer::get_associated_characters](LuaPlayer::get_associated_characters) for more information.

parameters.name: character
parameters.description: The character entity.

methods.name: build_from_cursor
methods.description: Builds what ever is in the cursor on the surface the player is on.
notes: Anything built will fire normal player-built events.
The cursor stack will automatically be reduced as if the player built normally.

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: If alt build should be used instead of normal build. Defaults to normal.

parameters.name: direction

methods.name: clear_console
methods.description: Clear the chat console.

methods.name: clear_cursor
methods.description: Invokes the "clear cursor" action on the player as if the user pressed it.
methods.return_description: If the cursor is now empty.

methods.name: clear_recipe_notifications
methods.description: Clears all recipe notifications for this player.

methods.name: clear_selection
methods.description: Clears the players selection tool selection position.

methods.name: close_map
methods.description: Queues request to switch to the normal game view from the map or zoom to world view. Render mode change requests are processed before rendering of the next frame.

methods.name: connect_to_server
methods.description: Asks the player if they would like to connect to the given server.
notes: This only does anything when used on a multiplayer peer. Single player and server hosts will ignore the prompt.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The server (address:port) if port is not given the default Factorio port is used.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the server.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password if different from the one used to join this game. Note, if the current password is not empty but the one required to join the new server is an empty string should be given for this field.

methods.name: create_character
methods.description: Creates and attaches a character entity to this player.
notes: The player must not have a character already connected and must be online (see [LuaPlayer::connected](LuaPlayer::connected)).

parameters.name: character
parameters.description: The character to create else the default is used.

methods.return_description: Whether the character was created.

methods.name: create_local_flying_text
methods.description: Spawn flying text that is only visible to this player. Either `position` or `create_at_cursor` are required. When `create_at_cursor` is `true`, all parameters other than `text` are ignored.
notes: If no custom `speed` is set and the text is longer than 25 characters, its `time_to_live` and `speed` are dynamically adjusted to give players more time to read it.
Local flying text is not saved, which means it will disappear after a save/load-cycle.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color of the flying text. Defaults to white text.

parameters.name: create_at_cursor
parameters.description: If `true`, the flying text is created at the player's cursor. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The location on the map at which to show the flying text.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: The speed at which the text rises upwards in tiles/second. Can't be a negative value.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The flying text to show.

parameters.name: time_to_live
parameters.description: The amount of ticks that the flying text will be shown for. Defaults to `80`.

methods.name: disable_alert
methods.description: Disables alerts for the given alert category.
methods.return_description: If the alert type was disabled (false if it was already disabled).

methods.name: disable_recipe_groups
methods.description: Disable recipe groups.

methods.name: disable_recipe_subgroups
methods.description: Disable recipe subgroups.

methods.name: disassociate_character
methods.description: Disassociates a character from this player. This is functionally the same as setting [LuaEntity::associated_player](LuaEntity::associated_player) to `nil`.
notes: See [LuaPlayer::get_associated_characters](LuaPlayer::get_associated_characters) for more information.

parameters.name: character
parameters.description: The character entity

methods.name: drag_wire
methods.description: Start/end wire dragging at the specified location, wire type is based on the cursor contents

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Position at which cursor was clicked. Used only to decide which side of arithmetic combinator, decider combinator or power switch is to be connected. Entity itself to be connected is based on the player's selected entity.

methods.return_description: `true` if the action did something

methods.name: enable_alert
methods.description: Enables alerts for the given alert category.
methods.return_description: If the alert type was enabled (false if it was already enabled).

methods.name: enable_recipe_groups
methods.description: Enable recipe groups.

methods.name: enable_recipe_subgroups
methods.description: Enable recipe subgroups.

methods.name: exit_cutscene
methods.description: Exit the current cutscene. Errors if not in a cutscene.

methods.name: get_active_quick_bar_page
methods.description: Gets which quick bar page is being used for the given screen page or `nil` if not known.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The screen page. Index 1 is the top row in the gui. Index can go beyond the visible number of bars on the screen to account for the interface config setting change.

methods.name: get_alerts
methods.description: Get all alerts matching the given filters, or all alerts if no filters are given.
methods.return_description: A mapping of surface index to an array of arrays of [alerts](Alert) indexed by the [alert type](defines.alert_type).

methods.name: get_associated_characters
methods.description: The characters associated with this player.
notes: The array will always be empty when the player is disconnected (see [LuaPlayer::connected](LuaPlayer::connected)) regardless of there being associated characters.
Characters associated with this player will be logged off when this player disconnects but are not controlled by any player.

methods.name: get_goal_description
methods.description: Get the current goal description, as a localised string.

methods.name: get_infinity_inventory_filter
methods.description: Gets the filter for this map editor infinity filters at the given index or `nil` if the filter index doesn't exist or is empty.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to get.

methods.name: get_quick_bar_slot
methods.description: Gets the quick bar filter for the given slot or `nil`.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The slot index. 1 for the first slot of page one, 2 for slot two of page one, 11 for the first slot of page 2, etc.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.name: is_alert_enabled
methods.description: If the given alert type is currently enabled.

methods.name: is_alert_muted

methods.name: is_shortcut_toggled
methods.description: Is a custom Lua shortcut currently toggled?

parameters.name: prototype_name

methods.name: jump_to_cutscene_waypoint
methods.description: Jump to the specified cutscene waypoint. Only works when the player is viewing a cutscene.

methods.name: log_active_entity_chunk_counts

methods.name: log_active_entity_counts

methods.description: Mutes alerts for the given alert category.
methods.return_description: If the alert type was muted (false if it was already muted).

methods.name: open_map
methods.description: Queues a request to open the map at the specified position. If the map is already opened, the request will simply set the position (and scale). Render mode change requests are processed before rendering of the next frame.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the sound should be played. If not given, it's played at the current position of the player.

parameters.name: volume_modifier

methods.description: Print text to the chat console.
notes: Messages that are identical to a message sent in the last 60 ticks are not printed again.

methods.name: print_entity_statistics
methods.description: Print entity statistics to the player's console.

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: Entity prototypes to get statistics for. If not specified or empty, display statistics for all entities.

methods.name: print_lua_object_statistics

methods.name: print_robot_jobs

methods.name: remove_alert
methods.description: Removes all alerts matching the given filters or if an empty filters table is given all alerts are removed.

methods.name: request_translation
methods.description: Requests a translation for the given localised string. If the request is successful the [on_string_translated](on_string_translated) event will be fired at a later time with the results.
notes: Does nothing if this player is not connected. (see [LuaPlayer::connected](LuaPlayer::connected)).
methods.return_description: If the request was sent or not.

methods.name: set_active_quick_bar_page
methods.description: Sets which quick bar page is being used for the given screen page.

parameters.name: page_index
parameters.description: The new quick bar page.

parameters.name: screen_index
parameters.description: The screen page. Index 1 is the top row in the gui. Index can go beyond the visible number of bars on the screen to account for the interface config setting change.

methods.name: set_controller
methods.description: Set the controller type of the player.
notes: Setting a player to [defines.controllers.editor](defines.controllers.editor) auto promotes the player to admin and enables cheat mode.
Setting a player to [defines.controllers.editor](defines.controllers.editor) also requires the calling player be an admin.

parameters.name: character
parameters.description: Entity to control. Mandatory when `type` is [defines.controllers.character](defines.controllers.character), ignored otherwise.

parameters.name: chart_mode_cutoff
parameters.description: If specified and `type` is [defines.controllers.cutscene](defines.controllers.cutscene), the game will switch to chart-mode (map zoomed out) rendering when the zoom level is less than this value.

parameters.name: final_transition_time
parameters.description: If specified and `type` is [defines.controllers.cutscene](defines.controllers.cutscene), it is the time in ticks it will take for the camera to pan from the final waypoint back to the starting position. If not given the camera will not pan back to the start position/zoom.

parameters.name: start_position
parameters.description: If specified and `type` is [defines.controllers.cutscene](defines.controllers.cutscene), the cutscene will start at this position. If not given the start position will be the player position.

parameters.name: start_zoom
parameters.description: If specified and `type` is [defines.controllers.cutscene](defines.controllers.cutscene), the cutscene will start at this zoom level. If not given the start zoom will be the players zoom.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Which controller to use.

parameters.name: waypoints
parameters.description: List of waypoints for the cutscene controller. This parameter is mandatory when `type` is [defines.controllers.cutscene](defines.controllers.cutscene).

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Path to image to be shown.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message to be shown.

methods.name: set_goal_description
methods.description: Set the text in the goal window (top left).

parameters.name: only_update
parameters.description: When `true`, won't play the "goal updated" sound.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to display. Lines can be delimited with `\n`. Passing an empty string or omitting this parameter entirely will make the goal window disappear.

methods.name: set_infinity_inventory_filter
methods.description: Sets the filter for this map editor infinity filters at the given index.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The new filter or `nil` to clear the filter.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index to set.

methods.name: set_quick_bar_slot
methods.description: Sets the quick bar filter for the given slot.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter or `nil`.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The slot index. 1 for the first slot of page one, 2 for slot two of page one, 11 for the first slot of page 2, etc.

methods.name: set_shortcut_available
methods.description: Make a custom Lua shortcut available or unavailable.

parameters.name: prototype_name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the custom shortcut.

methods.name: set_shortcut_toggled
methods.description: Toggle or untoggle a custom Lua shortcut

parameters.name: prototype_name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the custom shortcut.

methods.name: start_selection
methods.description: Starts selection with selection tool from the specified position. Does nothing if the players cursor is not a selection tool.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position to start selection from.

parameters.name: selection_mode
parameters.description: The type of selection to start. Can be `select`, `alternative-select`, `reverse-select`.

methods.name: toggle_map_editor
methods.description: Toggles this player into or out of the map editor. Does nothing if this player isn't an admin or if the player doesn't have permission to use the map editor.

methods.name: unlock_achievement
methods.description: Unlock the achievements of the given player. This has any effect only when this is the local player, the achievement isn't unlocked so far and the achievement is of the type "achievement".

parameters.name: name

methods.description: Unmutes alerts for the given alert category.
