methods.description: Queues a request to zoom to world at the specified position. If the player is already zooming to world, the request will simply set the position (and scale). Render mode change requests are processed before rendering of the next frame.

attributes.name: admin
attributes.description: `true` if the player is an admin.
notes: Trying to change player admin status from the console when you aren't an admin does nothing.

attributes.name: afk_time
attributes.description: How many ticks since the last action of this player

attributes.name: auto_sort_main_inventory
attributes.description: If the main inventory will be auto sorted.

attributes.name: blueprint_to_setup
attributes.description: The item stack containing a blueprint to be setup.

attributes.name: character
attributes.description: The character attached to this player, or `nil` if no character.
notes: Will also return `nil` when the player is disconnected (see [LuaPlayer::connected](LuaPlayer::connected)).

attributes.name: chat_color
attributes.description: The color used when this player talks in game.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The color associated with the player. This will be used to tint the player's character as well as their buildings and vehicles.

attributes.name: connected
attributes.description: `true` if the player is currently connected to the game.

attributes.name: cutscene_character
attributes.description: When in a cutscene; the character this player would be using once the cutscene is over.
notes: Will also return `nil` when the player is disconnected (see [LuaPlayer::connected](LuaPlayer::connected)).

attributes.name: display_resolution
attributes.description: The display resolution for this player.
notes: During [on_player_created](on_player_created), this attribute will always return a resolution of `{width=1920, height=1080}`. To get the actual resolution, listen to the [on_player_display_resolution_changed](on_player_display_resolution_changed) event raised shortly afterwards.

attributes.name: display_scale
attributes.description: The display scale for this player.
notes: During [on_player_created](on_player_created), this attribute will always return a scale of `1`. To get the actual scale, listen to the [on_player_display_scale_changed](on_player_display_scale_changed) event raised shortly afterwards.

attributes.name: entity_copy_source
attributes.description:
The source entity used during entity settings copy-paste if any.

`nil` if there isn't currently a source entity.

attributes.name: game_view_settings
attributes.description: The player's game view settings.

attributes.name: hand_location
attributes.description: The original location of the item in the cursor, marked with a hand. When writing, the specified inventory slot must be empty and the cursor stack must not be empty.

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: This player's index in [LuaGameScript::players](LuaGameScript::players).

attributes.name: infinity_inventory_filters
attributes.description: The filters for this map editor infinity inventory settings.

attributes.name: last_online
attributes.description: At what tick this player was last online.

attributes.name: map_view_settings
attributes.description: The player's map view settings. To write to this, use a table containing the fields that should be changed.

attributes.name: minimap_enabled
attributes.description: `true` if the minimap is visible.

attributes.name: mod_settings
attributes.description: Gets the current per-player settings for the this player, indexed by prototype name. Returns the same structure as [LuaSettings::get_player_settings](LuaSettings::get_player_settings).
notes: This table will become invalid if its associated player does.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The player's username.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: online_time
attributes.description: How many ticks did this player spend playing this save (all sessions combined)

attributes.name: opened_self
attributes.description: `true` if the player opened itself. I.e. if they opened the character or god-controller GUI.

attributes.name: permission_group
attributes.description: The permission group this player is part of or `nil` if not part of any group.

attributes.name: remove_unfiltered_items
attributes.description: If items not included in this map editor infinity inventory filters should be removed.

attributes.name: render_mode
attributes.description: The render mode of the player, like map or zoom to world. The render mode can be set using [LuaPlayer::open_map](LuaPlayer::open_map), [LuaPlayer::zoom_to_world](LuaPlayer::zoom_to_world) and [LuaPlayer::close_map](LuaPlayer::close_map).

attributes.name: show_on_map
attributes.description: If `true`, circle and name of given player is rendered on the map/chart.

attributes.name: spectator
attributes.description: If `true`, zoom-to-world noise effect will be disabled and environmental sounds will be based on zoom-to-world view instead of position of player's character.

attributes.name: stashed_controller_type
attributes.description: The stashed controller type or `nil` if no controller is stashed.
notes: This is mainly useful when a player is in the map editor.

attributes.name: tag
attributes.description: The tag that is shown after the player in chat and on the map.

attributes.name: ticks_to_respawn
attributes.description: The number of ticks until this player will respawn or `nil` if not waiting to respawn.
notes: Set to `nil` to immediately respawn the player.
Set to any positive value to trigger the respawn state for this player.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: zoom
attributes.description: The player's zoom-level.

classes.name: LuaProfiler
classes.description: An object used to measure script performance.
notes: Since performance is non-deterministic these objects don't allow reading the raw time values from lua. They can be used anywhere a [LocalisedString](LocalisedString) is used.

methods.name: add
methods.description: Add the duration of another timer to this timer. Useful to reduce start/stop overhead when accumulating time onto many timers at once.
notes: If other is running, the time to now will be added.

parameters.name: other
parameters.description: The timer to add to this timer.

methods.name: divide
methods.description: Divides the current duration by a set value. Useful for calculating the average of many iterations.
notes: Does nothing if this isn't stopped.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to divide by. Must be > 0.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the clock, also restarting it.

methods.name: restart
methods.description: Start the clock again, without resetting it.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the clock.

classes.name: LuaRandomGenerator
classes.description: A deterministic random generator independent from the core games random generator that can be seeded and re-seeded at will. This random generator can be saved and loaded and will maintain its state. Note this is entirely different from calling [math.random](Libraries.html#math.random)() and you should be sure you actually want to use this over calling `math.random()`. If you aren't sure if you need to use this over calling `math.random()` then you probably don't need to use this.
examples:
Create a generator and use it to print a random number. 
```
global.generator = game.create_random_generator()
game.player.print(global.generator())
```

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.name: re_seed
methods.description: Re-seeds the random generator with the given value.
notes: Seeds that are close together will produce similar results. Seeds from 0 to 341 will produce the same results.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

operators.name: call
operators.description: Generates a random number. If no parameters are given a number in the [0, 1) range is returned. If a single parameter is given a floored number in the [1, N] range is returned. If 2 parameters are given a floored number in the [N1, N2] range is returned.

parameters.name: lower
parameters.description: Inclusive lower bound on the result

parameters.name: upper
parameters.description: Inclusive upper bound on the result

classes.name: LuaRecipe
classes.description: A crafting recipe. Recipes belong to forces (see [LuaForce](LuaForce)) because some recipes are unlocked by research, and researches are per-force.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Reload the recipe from the prototype.

attributes.name: category
attributes.description: Category of the recipe.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Can the recipe be used?

attributes.name: energy
attributes.description: Energy required to execute this recipe. This directly affects the crafting time: Recipe's energy is exactly its crafting time in seconds, when crafted in an assembling machine with crafting speed exactly equal to one.

attributes.name: force
attributes.description: The force that owns this recipe.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description: Group of this recipe.

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: Is the recipe hidden? Hidden recipe don't show up in the crafting menu.

attributes.name: hidden_from_flow_stats
attributes.description: Is the recipe hidden from flow statistics?

attributes.name: ingredients
attributes.description: Ingredients for this recipe.
examples:
What the "steel-chest" recipe would return 
```
{{type="item", name="steel-plate", amount=8}}
```

What the "advanced-oil-processing" recipe would return 
```
{{type="fluid", name="crude-oil", amount=10}, {type="fluid", name="water", amount=5}}
```

It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. classes.name: LuaRemote
classes.description: Registry of interfaces between scripts. An interface is simply a dictionary mapping names to functions. A script or mod can then register an interface with [LuaRemote](LuaRemote), after that any script can call the registered functions, provided it knows the interface name and the desired function name. An instance of LuaRemote is available through the global object named `remote`.
examples:
Will register a remote interface containing two functions. Later, it will call these functions through `remote`. 
```
remote.add_interface("human interactor",
                     {hello = function() game.player.print("Hi!") end,
                      bye = function(name) game.player.print("Bye " .. name) end})
-- Some time later, possibly in a different mod...
remote.call("human interactor", "hello")
remote.call("human interactor", "bye", "dear reader")
```

methods.name: add_interface
methods.description: Add a remote interface.
notes: It is an error if the given interface `name` is already registered.

parameters.name: functions
parameters.description: List of functions that are members of the new interface.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the interface.

methods.name: call
methods.description: Call a function of an interface.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: Function name that belongs to `interface`.

parameters.name: interface
parameters.description: Interface to look up `function` in.

methods.variadic_description: Arguments to pass to the called function.

methods.name: remove_interface
methods.description: Removes an interface with the given name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the interface.

methods.return_description: If the interface was removed. `False` if the interface didn't exist.

attributes.name: interfaces
attributes.description: List of all registered interfaces. For each interface name, `remote.interfaces[name]` is a dictionary mapping the interface's registered functions to the value `true`.
examples:
Assuming the "human interactor" interface is registered as above 
```
game.player.print(tostring(remote.interfaces["human interactor"]["hello"]))        -- prints true
game.player.print(tostring(remote.interfaces["human interactor"]["nonexistent"]))  -- prints nil
```

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: This object's name.

classes.name: LuaRendering
classes.description: Allows rendering of geometric shapes, text and sprites in the game world. Each render object is identified by an id that is universally unique for the lifetime of a whole game.
notes: If an entity target of an object is destroyed or changes surface, then the object is also destroyed.

methods.name: bring_to_front
methods.description: Reorder this object so that it is drawn in front of the already existing objects.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Destroys all render objects.

parameters.name: mod_name
parameters.description: If provided, only the render objects created by this mod are destroyed.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroy the object with the given id.

methods.name: draw_animation
methods.description: Create an animation.

parameters.name: animation
parameters.description: Name of an [animation prototype](https://wiki.factorio.com/Prototype/Animation).

parameters.name: animation_offset
parameters.description: Offset of the animation in frames. Default is 0.

parameters.name: animation_speed
parameters.description: How many frames the animation goes forward per tick. Default is 1.

parameters.name: forces
parameters.description: The forces that this object is rendered to.

parameters.name: only_in_alt_mode
parameters.description: If this should only be rendered in alt mode. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: The orientation of the animation. Default is 0.

parameters.name: orientation_target
parameters.description: If given, the animation rotates so that it faces this target. Note that `orientation` is still applied to the animation.

parameters.name: orientation_target_offset
parameters.description: Only used if `orientation_target` is a LuaEntity.

parameters.name: oriented_offset
parameters.description: Offsets the center of the animation if `orientation_target` is given. This offset will rotate together with the animation.

parameters.name: players
parameters.description: The players that this object is rendered to.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Center of the animation.

parameters.name: target_offset
parameters.description: Only used if `target` is a LuaEntity.

parameters.name: time_to_live
parameters.description: In ticks. Defaults to living forever.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: If this is rendered to anyone at all. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: x_scale
parameters.description: Horizontal scale of the animation. Default is 1.

parameters.name: y_scale
parameters.description: Vertical scale of the animation. Default is 1.

methods.return_description: Id of the render object

methods.name: draw_line
methods.description: Create a line.
examples:
Draw a white and 2 pixel wide line from {0, 0} to {2, 2}. 
```
rendering.draw_line{surface = game.player.surface, from = {0, 0}, to = {2, 2}, color = {1, 1, 1}, width = 2}
```

Draw a red and 3 pixel wide line from {0, 0} to {0, 5}. The line has 1 tile long dashes and gaps. 
```
rendering.draw_line{surface = game.player.surface, from = {0, 0}, to = {0, 5}, color = {r = 1}, width = 3, gap_length = 1, dash_length = 1}
```

parameters.name: dash_length
parameters.description: Length of the dashes that this line has. Used only if gap_length > 0. Default is 0.

parameters.name: draw_on_ground
parameters.description: If this should be drawn below sprites and entities.

parameters.name: forces
parameters.description: The forces that this object is rendered to.

parameters.name: from_offset
parameters.description: Only used if `from` is a LuaEntity.

parameters.name: gap_length
parameters.description: Length of the gaps that this line has, in tiles. Default is 0.

parameters.name: only_in_alt_mode

parameters.name: players
parameters.description: The players that this object is rendered to.

parameters.name: time_to_live
parameters.description: In ticks. Defaults to living forever.

parameters.name: to_offset
parameters.description: Only used if `to` is a LuaEntity.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: If this is rendered to anyone at all. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: In pixels (32 per tile).

methods.return_description: Id of the render object

methods.name: draw_sprite
methods.description: Create a sprite.
examples:
This will draw an iron plate icon at the character's feet. The sprite will move together with the character. 
```
rendering.draw_sprite{sprite = "item.iron-plate", target = game.player.character, surface = game.player.surface}
```

This will draw an iron plate icon at the character's head. The sprite will move together with the character. 
```
rendering.draw_sprite{sprite = "item.iron-plate", target = game.player.character, target_offset = {0, -2}, surface = game.player.surface}
```

parameters.name: forces
parameters.description: The forces that this object is rendered to.

parameters.name: only_in_alt_mode
parameters.description: If this should only be rendered in alt mode. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: orientation_target
parameters.description: If given, the sprite rotates so that it faces this target. Note that `orientation` is still applied to the sprite.

parameters.name: orientation_target_offset
parameters.description: Only used if `orientation_target` is a LuaEntity.

parameters.name: oriented_offset
parameters.description: Offsets the center of the sprite if `orientation_target` is given. This offset will rotate together with the sprite.

parameters.name: players
parameters.description: The players that this object is rendered to.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Center of the sprite.

parameters.name: target_offset
parameters.description: Only used if `target` is a LuaEntity.

parameters.name: time_to_live
parameters.description: In ticks. Defaults to living forever.

parameters.description: If this is rendered to anyone at all. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: x_scale
parameters.description: Horizontal scale of the sprite. Default is 1.

parameters.name: y_scale
parameters.description: Vertical scale of the sprite. Default is 1.

methods.description: The object rotates so that it faces this target. Note that `orientation` is still applied to the object. Get the orientation_target of the object with this id or `nil` if no target or if this object is not a polygon, sprite, or animation.
notes: Polygon vertices that are set to an entity will ignore this.

methods.description: Offsets the center of the sprite or animation if `orientation_target` is given. This offset will rotate together with the sprite or animation. Get the oriented_offset of the sprite or animation with this id or `nil` if this object is not a sprite or animation.

methods.return_description: or `nil` if the object does not support width.

parameters.description: Animation offset in frames.

methods.name: set_animation_speed
methods.description: Set the animation speed of the animation with this id. Does nothing if this object is not an animation.

parameters.name: animation_speed
parameters.description: Animation speed in frames per tick.

methods.name: set_color
methods.description: Set the color or tint of the object with this id. Does nothing if this object does not support color.

methods.name: set_corners
methods.description: Set the corners of the rectangle with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a rectangle.

methods.name: set_dash_length
methods.description: Set the dash length of the line with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a line.

methods.name: set_dashes
methods.description: Set the length of the dashes and the length of the gaps in the line with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a line.

methods.name: set_draw_on_ground
methods.description: Set whether this is being drawn on the ground, under most entities and sprites.

methods.name: set_filled
methods.description: Set if the circle or rectangle with this id is filled. Does nothing if this object is not a circle or rectangle.

methods.name: set_font
methods.description: Set the font of the text with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a text.

methods.name: set_forces
methods.description: Set the forces that the object with this id is rendered to.

parameters.name: forces
parameters.description: Providing an empty array will set the object to be visible to all forces.

methods.name: set_from
methods.description: Set from where the line with this id is drawn. Does nothing if the object is not a line.

methods.name: set_gap_length
methods.description: Set the length of the gaps in the line with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a line.

methods.name: set_intensity
methods.description: Set the intensity of the light with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a light.

methods.name: set_left_top
methods.description: Set where top left corner of the rectangle with this id is drawn. Does nothing if this object is not a rectangle.

methods.name: set_max_radius
methods.description: Set the radius of the outer edge of the arc with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a arc.

methods.name: set_min_radius
methods.description: Set the radius of the inner edge of the arc with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a arc.

methods.name: set_minimum_darkness
methods.description: Set the minimum darkness at which the light with this id is rendered. Does nothing if this object is not a light.

methods.name: set_only_in_alt_mode
methods.description: Set whether this is only rendered in alt-mode.

methods.name: set_orientation
methods.description: Set the orientation of the object with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a text, polygon, sprite, light or animation.
notes: Polygon vertices that are set to an entity will ignore this.

methods.name: set_orientation_target
methods.description: The object rotates so that it faces this target. Note that `orientation` is still applied to the object. Set the orientation_target of the object with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a polygon, sprite, or animation. Set to `nil` if the object should not have an orientation_target.
notes: Polygon vertices that are set to an entity will ignore this.

methods.name: set_oriented
methods.description: Set if the light with this id is rendered has the same orientation as the target entity. Does nothing if this object is not a light. Note that `orientation` is still applied to the sprite.

methods.name: set_oriented_offset
methods.description: Offsets the center of the sprite or animation if `orientation_target` is given. This offset will rotate together with the sprite or animation. Set the oriented_offset of the sprite or animation with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a sprite or animation.

methods.name: set_players
methods.description: Set the players that the object with this id is rendered to.

parameters.name: players
parameters.description: Providing an empty array will set the object to be visible to all players.

methods.name: set_radius
methods.description: Set the radius of the circle with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a circle.

methods.name: set_render_layer
methods.description: Set the render layer of the sprite or animation with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a sprite or animation.

methods.name: set_right_bottom
methods.description: Set where top bottom right of the rectangle with this id is drawn. Does nothing if this object is not a rectangle.

methods.name: set_scale
methods.description: Set the scale of the text or light with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a text or light.

methods.name: set_scale_with_zoom
methods.description: Set if the text with this id scales with player zoom, resulting in it always being the same size on screen, and the size compared to the game world changes. Does nothing if this object is not a text.

methods.name: set_sprite
methods.description: Set the sprite of the sprite or light with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a sprite or light.

methods.name: set_start_angle
methods.description: Set where the arc with this id starts. Does nothing if this object is not a arc.

parameters.name: start_angle
parameters.description: angle in radian

methods.name: set_target
methods.description: Set where the object with this id is drawn. Does nothing if this object does not support target.
notes: Polygon vertices that are set to an entity will ignore this.

methods.name: set_text
methods.description: Set the text that is displayed by the text with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a text.

methods.name: set_time_to_live
methods.description: Set the time to live of the object with this id. Set to 0 if the object should not expire.

methods.name: set_to
methods.description: Set where the line with this id is drawn to. Does nothing if this object is not a line.

methods.name: set_vertical_alignment
methods.description: Set the vertical alignment of the text with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a text.

parameters.name: alignment
parameters.description: "top", "middle", "baseline" or "bottom"

methods.name: set_vertices
methods.description: Set the vertices of the polygon with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a polygon.

methods.name: set_visible
methods.description: Set whether this is rendered to anyone at all.

methods.name: set_width
methods.description: Set the width of the object with this id. Does nothing if this object does not support width. Value is in pixels (32 per tile).

methods.name: set_x_scale
methods.description: Set the horizontal scale of the sprite or animation with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a sprite or animation.

methods.name: set_y_scale
methods.description: Set the vertical scale of the sprite or animation with this id. Does nothing if this object is not a sprite or animation.

attributes.description: Order string of this prototype.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

classes.name: LuaSettings
classes.description: Object containing mod settings of three distinct types: `startup`, `global`, and `player`. An instance of LuaSettings is available through the global object named `settings`.

methods.name: get_player_settings
methods.description: Gets the current per-player settings for the given player, indexed by prototype name. Returns the same structure as [LuaPlayer::mod_settings](LuaPlayer::mod_settings).
notes: This table will become invalid if its associated player does.

attributes.name: global
attributes.description:
The current global mod settings, indexed by prototype name.

Even though these are marked as read-only, they can be changed by overwriting individual [ModSetting](ModSetting) tables in the custom table. Mods can only change their own settings. Using the in-game console, all global settings can be changed.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: This object's name.

attributes.name: player
attributes.description:
The default player mod settings for this map, indexed by prototype name.

Even though these are marked as read-only, they can be changed by overwriting individual [ModSetting](ModSetting) tables in the custom table. Mods can only change their own settings. Using the in-game console, all player settings can be changed.

attributes.description: The startup mod settings, indexed by prototype name.

classes.name: LuaStyle
classes.description: Style of a GUI element. All of the attributes listed here may be `nil` if not available for a particular GUI element.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

attributes.name: bottom_cell_padding
attributes.description: Space between the table cell contents bottom and border.

attributes.name: cell_padding
attributes.description: Space between the table cell contents and border. Sets top/right/bottom/left cell paddings to this value.

attributes.name: column_alignments
attributes.description: Array containing the alignment for every column of this table element. Even though this property is marked as read-only, the alignment can be changed by indexing the LuaCustomTable, like so:
examples:
```
table_element.style.column_alignments[1] = "center"
```

attributes.name: extra_margin_when_activated
attributes.description: Sets extra_top/right/bottom/left_margin_when_activated to this value. An array with two values sets top/bottom margin to the first value and left/right margin to the second value. An array with four values sets top, right, bottom, left margin respectively.

attributes.name: extra_padding_when_activated
attributes.description: Sets extra_top/right/bottom/left_padding_when_actived to this value. An array with two values sets top/bottom padding to the first value and left/right padding to the second value. An array with four values sets top, right, bottom, left padding respectively.

attributes.name: gui
attributes.description: Gui of the [LuaGuiElement](LuaGuiElement) of this style.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Sets both minimal and maximal height to the given value.

attributes.name: horizontal_align
attributes.description: Horizontal align of the inner content of the widget, possible values are "left", "center" or "right"

attributes.name: horizontal_spacing
attributes.description: Horizontal space between individual cells.

attributes.name: horizontally_squashable
attributes.description: If the GUI element can be squashed (by maximal width of some parent element) horizontally. This is mainly meant to be used for scroll-pane The default value is false.

attributes.name: horizontally_stretchable
attributes.description: If the GUI element stretches its size horizontally to other elements.

attributes.name: left_cell_padding
attributes.description: Space between the table cell contents left and border.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Sets top/right/bottom/left margins to this value. An array with two values sets top/bottom margin to the first value and left/right margin to the second value. An array with four values sets top, right, bottom, left margin respectively.

attributes.name: maximal_height
attributes.description: Maximal height ensures, that the widget will never be bigger than than that size. It can't be stretched to be bigger.

attributes.name: maximal_width
attributes.description: Maximal width ensures, that the widget will never be bigger than than that size. It can't be stretched to be bigger.

attributes.name: minimal_height
attributes.description: Minimal height ensures, that the widget will never be smaller than than that size. It can't be squashed to be smaller.

attributes.name: minimal_width
attributes.description: Minimal width ensures, that the widget will never be smaller than than that size. It can't be squashed to be smaller.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of this style.

attributes.name: natural_height
attributes.description: Natural height specifies the height of the element tries to have, but it can still be squashed/stretched to have a smaller or bigger size.

attributes.name: natural_width
attributes.description: Natural width specifies the width of the element tries to have, but it can still be squashed/stretched to have a smaller or bigger size.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: padding
attributes.description: Sets top/right/bottom/left paddings to this value. An array with two values sets top/bottom padding to the first value and left/right padding to the second value. An array with four values sets top, right, bottom, left padding respectively.

attributes.name: rich_text_setting
attributes.description: How this GUI element handles rich text.

attributes.name: right_cell_padding
attributes.description: Space between the table cell contents right and border.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Sets both width and height to the given value. Also accepts an array with two values, setting width to the first and height to the second one.

attributes.name: top_cell_padding
attributes.description: Space between the table cell contents top and border.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: vertical_align
attributes.description: Vertical align of the inner content of the widget, possible values are "top", "center" or "bottom"

attributes.name: vertical_spacing
attributes.description: Vertical space between individual cells.

attributes.name: vertically_squashable
attributes.description: If the GUI element can be squashed (by maximal height of some parent element) vertically. This is mainly meant to be used for scroll-pane The default (parent) value for scroll pane is true, false otherwise.

attributes.name: vertically_stretchable
attributes.description: If the GUI element stretches its size vertically to other elements.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Sets both minimal and maximal width to the given value.

classes.name: LuaSurface
classes.description: A "domain" of the world. Surfaces can only be created and deleted through the API. Surfaces are uniquely identified by their name. Every game contains at least the surface "nauvis".

methods.name: add_script_area

methods.return_description: The id of the created area.

methods.name: add_script_position

methods.return_description: The id of the created position.

methods.name: build_checkerboard
methods.description: Sets the given area to the checkerboard lab tiles.

parameters.name: area
parameters.description: The tile area.

methods.name: build_enemy_base
methods.description: Send a group to build a new base.
notes: The specified force must be AI-controlled; i.e. `force.ai_controllable` must be `true`.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force the new base will belong to. Defaults to enemy.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Location of the new base.

parameters.name: unit_count

parameters.description: The force that would place the entity. If not specified, the enemy force is assumed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the entity to check

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the entity would be placed

parameters.description: Which type of check should be carried out.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the placed entity.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force that would place the entity. If not specified, the enemy force is assumed.

parameters.name: forced
parameters.description: If `true`, entities that can be marked for deconstruction are ignored. Only used if `build_check_type` is either `manual_ghost`, `script_ghost` or `blueprint_ghost`.

parameters.name: inner_name
parameters.description: The prototype name of the entity contained in the ghost. Only used if `name` is `entity-ghost`.

parameters.name: name

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where the entity would be placed.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The deconstruction item to use if any.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: The player to set the last_user to if any.

parameters.name: skip_fog_of_war
parameters.description: If chunks covered by fog-of-war are skipped.

methods.name: cancel_upgrade_area

parameters.description: If chunks covered by fog-of-war are skipped.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears this surface deleting all entities and chunks on it.
notes: This won't clear the surface immediately. It will be cleared at the end of the current tick.

parameters.name: ignore_characters
parameters.description: Whether characters on this surface that are connected to or associated with players should be ignored (not destroyed).

methods.name: clear_pollution
methods.description: Clears all pollution on this surface.

methods.name: clone_area
methods.description: Clones the given area.
notes: [defines.events.on_entity_cloned](defines.events.on_entity_cloned) is raised for each entity, and then [defines.events.on_area_cloned](defines.events.on_area_cloned) is raised.
Entities are cloned in an order such that they can always be created, eg rails before trains.

parameters.name: clear_destination_decoratives
parameters.description: If the destination decoratives should be cleared

parameters.name: clear_destination_entities
parameters.description: If the destination entities should be cleared

parameters.name: clone_decoratives
parameters.description: If decoratives should be cloned

parameters.name: clone_entities
parameters.description: If entities should be cloned

parameters.name: clone_tiles
parameters.description: If tiles should be cloned

parameters.name: create_build_effect_smoke
parameters.description: If true, the building effect smoke will be shown around the new entities.

parameters.name: expand_map
parameters.description: If the destination surface should be expanded when destination_area is outside current bounds. Default false.

methods.name: clone_brush
methods.description: Clones the given area.
notes: [defines.events.on_entity_cloned](defines.events.on_entity_cloned) is raised for each entity, and then [defines.events.on_area_cloned](defines.events.on_area_cloned) is raised.
Entities are cloned in an order such that they can always be created, eg rails before trains.

parameters.name: clear_destination_decoratives
parameters.description: If the destination decoratives should be cleared

parameters.name: clear_destination_entities
parameters.description: If the destination entities should be cleared

parameters.name: clone_decoratives
parameters.description: If decoratives should be cloned

parameters.name: clone_entities
parameters.description: If entities should be cloned

parameters.name: clone_tiles
parameters.description: If tiles should be cloned

parameters.name: create_build_effect_smoke
parameters.description: If true, the building effect smoke will be shown around the new entities.

parameters.name: expand_map
parameters.description: If the destination surface should be expanded when destination_area is outside current bounds. Default false.

parameters.name: manual_collision_mode
parameters.description: If manual-style collision checks should be done.

methods.name: clone_entities
methods.description: Clones the given entities.
notes: [defines.events.on_entity_cloned](defines.events.on_entity_cloned) is raised for each entity.
Entities are cloned in an order such that they can always be created, eg rails before trains.

parameters.name: create_build_effect_smoke
parameters.description: If true, the building effect smoke will be shown around the new entities.

methods.name: count_entities_filtered
methods.description:
Count entities of given type or name in a given area. Works just like [LuaSurface::find_entities_filtered](LuaSurface::find_entities_filtered), except this only returns the count. As it doesn't construct all the wrapper objects, this is more efficient if one is only interested in the number of entities.

If no `area` or `position` are given, the entire surface is searched. If `position` is given, this returns the entities colliding with that position (i.e the given position is within the entity's collision box). If `position` and `radius` are given, this returns entities in the radius of the position. If `area` is specified, this returns entities colliding with that area.

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: If the filters should be inverted. These filters are: name, type, ghost_name, ghost_type, direction, collision_mask, force.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: If given with position, will count all entities within the radius of the position.

methods.name: count_tiles_filtered
methods.description:
Count tiles of a given name in a given area. Works just like [LuaSurface::find_tiles_filtered](LuaSurface::find_tiles_filtered), except this only returns the count. As it doesn't construct all the wrapper objects, this is more efficient if one is only interested in the number of tiles.

If no `area` or `position` and `radius` is given, the entire surface is searched. If `position` and `radius` are given, only tiles within the radius of the position are included.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Ignored if not given with radius.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: If given with position, will return all entities within the radius of the position.

methods.name: create_decoratives
methods.description: Adds the given decoratives to the surface.
notes: This will merge decoratives of the same type that already exist effectively increasing the "amount" field.

parameters.name: check_collision
parameters.description: If collision should be checked against entities/tiles.

methods.name: create_entity
methods.description: Create an entity on this surface.
examples:
```
game.surfaces[1].create_entity{name = "big-biter", position = {15, 3}, force = game.forces.player} -- Friendly biter
game.surfaces[1].create_entity{name = "medium-biter", position = {15, 3}, force = game.forces.enemy} -- Enemy biter
```

Creates a basic inserter at the player's location facing north 
```
game.surfaces[1].create_entity{name = "inserter", position = game.player.position, direction = defines.direction.north}
```

parameters.name: create_build_effect_smoke
parameters.description: If false, the building effect smoke will not be shown around the new entity.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Desired orientation of the entity after creation.

parameters.name: fast_replace
parameters.description: If true, building will attempt to simulate fast-replace building.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force of the entity, default is enemy.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: If provided, the entity will attempt to pull stored values from this item (for example; creating a spidertron from a previously named and mined spidertron)

parameters.name: move_stuck_players
parameters.description: If true, any characters that are in the way of the entity are teleported out of the way.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The entity prototype name to create.

parameters.name: player
parameters.description: If given set the last_user to this player. If fast_replace is true simulate fast replace using this player.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Where to create the entity.

parameters.name: raise_built
parameters.description: If true; [defines.events.script_raised_built](defines.events.script_raised_built) will be fired on successful entity creation.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source entity. Used for beams and highlight-boxes.

parameters.name: spawn_decorations
parameters.description: If true, entity types that have spawn_decorations property will apply triggers defined in the property.

parameters.name: spill
parameters.description: If false while fast_replace is true and player is nil any items from fast-replacing will be deleted instead of dropped on the ground.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Entity with health for the new entity to target.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: If set, beam will be destroyed after this value of ticks.

parameters.name: max_length
parameters.description: If set, beam will be destroyed when distance between source and target is greater than this value.

parameters.name: source_offset
parameters.description: Source position will be offset by this value when rendering the beam.

parameters.name: source_position
parameters.description: Absolute source position that can be used instead of source entity (entity has precedence if both entity and position are defined).

parameters.name: target_position
parameters.description: Absolute target position that can be used instead of target entity (entity has precedence if both entity and position are defined).

parameters.name: cliff_orientation
parameters.description: If not specified, `direction` will be used instead.

parameters.name: bar
parameters.description: Inventory index where the red limiting bar should be set.

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: If `false` the ghost entity will not expire. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: inner_name
parameters.description: The prototype name of the entity contained in the ghost.

parameters.name: initial_ground_flame_count
parameters.description: With how many small flames should the fire on ground be created. Defaults to the initial flame count of the prototype.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Color of the displayed text.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The string to show.

parameters.name: blink_interval
parameters.description: The blink interval for this highlight box. Makes it be shown every `blink_interval` ticks. Defaults to `0` (constantly shown).

parameters.name: bounding_box
parameters.description: The bounding box defining the highlight box using absolute map coordinates. If specified, the `position` parameter is ignored, but needs to be present anyways. If not specified, the game falls back to the `source` parameter first, then the `target` parameter second. One of these three parameters need to be specified.

parameters.name: box_type
parameters.description: Specifies the graphical appearance (color) of the highlight box. Defaults to `"electricity"`.

parameters.name: render_player_index
parameters.description: The player to render the highlight box for. If not provided, it will be rendered for all players.

parameters.name: time_to_live
parameters.description: The amount of time in ticks that the highlight box will exist for. Defaults to existing forever.

parameters.name: stack
parameters.description: The stack of items to create.

parameters.name: modules
parameters.description: The stacks of items to be delivered to target entity from logistic network.

parameters.name: target

parameters.name: snap_to_train_stop

methods.name: find_decoratives_filtered
methods.description:
Find decoratives of a given name in a given area.

If no filters are given, returns all decoratives in the search area. If multiple filters are specified, returns only decoratives matching every given filter. If no area and no position are given, the entire surface is searched.
examples:
```
game.surfaces[1].find_decoratives_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, name = "sand-decal"} -- gets all sand-decals in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_decoratives_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, limit = 5}  -- gets the first 5 decoratives in the rectangle
```

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: If the filters should be inverted.

methods.name: find_enemy_units
methods.description: Find enemy units (entities with type "unit") of a given force within an area.
notes: This is more efficient than [LuaSurface::find_entities](LuaSurface::find_entities).
examples:
Find all units who would be interested to attack the player, within 100-tile area. 
```
local enemies = game.player.surface.find_enemy_units(game.player.position, 100)
```

parameters.name: center
parameters.description: Center of the search area

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force to find enemies of. If not given, uses the player force.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius of the circular search area

methods.name: find_entities
methods.description:
Find entities in a given area.

If no area is given all entities on the surface are returned.
examples:
Will evaluate to a list of all entities within given area. 
```
game.surfaces["nauvis"].find_entities({{-10, -10}, {10, 10}})
```

methods.name: find_entities_filtered
methods.description:
Find all entities of the given type or name in the given area.

If no filters (`name`, `type`, `force`, etc.) are given, this returns all entities in the search area. If multiple filters are specified, only entities matching all given filters are returned.

If no `area` or `position` are given, the entire surface is searched. If `position` is given, this returns the entities colliding with that position (i.e the given position is within the entity's collision box). If `position` and `radius` are given, this returns the entities within the radius of the position. If `area` is specified, this returns the entities colliding with that area.
examples:
```
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, type = "resource"} -- gets all resources in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, name = "iron-ore"} -- gets all iron ores in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, name = {"iron-ore", "copper-ore"}} -- gets all iron ore and copper ore in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, force = "player"}  -- gets player owned entities in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{area = {{-10, -10}, {10, 10}}, limit = 5}  -- gets the first 5 entities in the rectangle
game.surfaces[1].find_entities_filtered{position = {0, 0}, radius = 10}  -- gets all entities within 10 tiles of the position [0,0].
```

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: If the filters should be inverted. These filters are: name, type, ghost_name, ghost_type, direction, collision_mask, force.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Has precedence over area field.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: If given with position, will return all entities within the radius of the position.

methods.name: find_entity
methods.description: Find a specific entity at a specific position.
examples:

game.player.selected.surface.find_entity('filter-inserter', {0,0})
```

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Coordinates to look at

methods.name: find_non_colliding_position
methods.description: Find a non-colliding position within a given radius.
notes: Special care needs to be taken when using a radius of `0`. The game will not stop searching until it finds a suitable position, so it is important to make sure such a position exists. One particular case where it would not be able to find a solution is running it before any chunks have been generated.

parameters.name: center
parameters.description: Center of the search area.

parameters.name: force_to_tile_center
parameters.description: Will only check tile centers. This can be useful when your intent is to place a building at the resulting position, as they must generally be placed at tile centers. Default false.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the entity to find a position for. (The bounding box for the collision checking is taken from this prototype.)

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The step length from the given position as it searches, in tiles. Minimum value is `0.01`.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Max distance from `center` to search in. A radius of `0` means an infinitely-large search area.

methods.return_description: The non-colliding position. May be `nil` if no suitable position was found.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the entity to find a position for. (The bounding box for the collision checking is taken from this prototype.)

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The step length from the given position as it searches, in tiles. Minimum value is 0.01.

parameters.name: search_space
parameters.description: The rectangle to search inside.

methods.return_description: The non-colliding position. May be `nil` if no suitable position was found.

local friendly_units = game.player.surface.find_units({area = {{-10, -10},{10, 10}}, force = "player", condition = "friend")

local units = game.player.surface.find_units({area = {{-10, -10},{10, 10}}, force = "player", condition = "same"})

methods.name: request_path
methods.description:
Generates a path with the specified constraints (as an array of [PathfinderWaypoints](PathfinderWaypoint)) using the unit pathfinding algorithm. This path can be used to emulate pathing behavior by script for non-unit entities. If you want to command actual units to move, use the [LuaEntity::set_command](LuaEntity::set_command) functionality instead.

The resulting path is ultimately returned asynchronously via [on_script_path_request_finished](on_script_path_request_finished).

parameters.name: bounding_box
parameters.description: The dimensions of the object that's supposed to travel the path.

parameters.name: can_open_gates
parameters.description: Whether the path request can open gates. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: collision_mask
parameters.description: The list of masks the `bounding_box` collides with.

parameters.name: entity_to_ignore
parameters.description: Makes the pathfinder ignore collisions with this entity if it is given.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: The force for which to generate the path, determining which gates can be opened for example.

parameters.name: goal
parameters.description: The position to find a path to.

parameters.name: path_resolution_modifier
parameters.description: Defines how coarse the pathfinder's grid is. Smaller values mean a coarser grid (negative numbers allowed). Defaults to `0`.

parameters.name: pathfind_flags
parameters.description: Flags that affect pathfinder behavior.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: How close the pathfinder needs to get to its `goal` (in tiles). Defaults to `1`.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The position from which to start pathfinding.

methods.return_description: A unique handle to identify this call when [on_script_path_request_finished](on_script_path_request_finished) fires.

methods.name: request_to_generate_chunks
methods.description: Request that the game's map generator generate chunks at the given position for the given radius on this surface.

parameters.name: position

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: The chunk radius from `position` to generate new chunks in.

methods.description: Set the hidden tile for the specified position. While during normal gameplay only [non-mineable](LuaTilePrototype::mineable_properties) tiles can become hidden, this method allows any kind of tile to be set as the hidden one.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The tile position.

parameters.name: tile
parameters.description: The new hidden tile or `nil` to clear the hidden tile.

methods.name: set_multi_command
methods.description: Give a command to multiple units. This will automatically select suitable units for the task.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force of the units this command is to be given to. If not specified, uses the enemy force.

parameters.name: unit_count
parameters.description: Number of units to give the command to.

parameters.name: unit_search_distance
parameters.description: Radius to search for units. The search area is centered on the destination of the command.

methods.return_description: Number of units actually sent. May be less than `count` if not enough units were available.

methods.name: set_tiles
methods.description:
Set tiles at specified locations. Can automatically correct the edges around modified tiles.

Placing a [mineable](LuaTilePrototype::mineable_properties) tile on top of a non-mineable one will turn the latter into the [LuaTile::hidden_tile](LuaTile::hidden_tile) for that tile. Placing a mineable tile on a mineable one or a non-mineable tile on a non-mineable one will not modify the hidden tile. This restriction can however be circumvented by using [LuaSurface::set_hidden_tile](LuaSurface::set_hidden_tile).
notes: It is recommended to call this method once for all the tiles you want to change rather than calling it individually for every tile. As the tile correction is used after every step, calling it one by one could cause the tile correction logic to redo some of the changes. Also, many small API calls are generally more performance intensive than one big one.

parameters.name: correct_tiles
parameters.description: If `false`, the correction logic is not applied to the changed tiles. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: raise_event
parameters.description: `true` or `false`. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: remove_colliding_decoratives
parameters.description: `true` or `false`. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: remove_colliding_entities
parameters.description: `true`, `false`, or `abort_on_collision`. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: enable_looted
parameters.description: When true, each created item will be flagged with the [LuaEntity::to_be_looted](LuaEntity::to_be_looted) flag.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: When provided (and not `nil`) the items will be marked for deconstruction by this force.

attributes.name: always_day
attributes.description: When set to true, the sun will always shine.

attributes.name: brightness_visual_weights
attributes.description:
Defines how surface daytime brightness influences each color channel of the current color lookup table (LUT).

The LUT is multiplied by `((1 - weight) + brightness * weight)` and result is clamped to range [0, 1].

Default is `{0, 0, 0}`, which means no influence.
examples:
Makes night on the surface pitch black, assuming [LuaSurface::min_brightness](LuaSurface::min_brightness) being set to default value `0.15`. 
```
game.surfaces[1].brightness_visual_weights = { 1 / 0.85, 1 / 0.85, 1 / 0.85 }
```

attributes.name: darkness
attributes.description: Amount of darkness at the current time.

attributes.name: dawn
attributes.description: The daytime when dawn starts.

attributes.name: daytime
attributes.description: Current time of day, as a number in range [0, 1).

attributes.name: dusk
attributes.description: The daytime when dusk starts.

attributes.name: evening
attributes.description: The daytime when evening starts.

attributes.name: freeze_daytime
attributes.description: True if daytime is currently frozen.

attributes.name: generate_with_lab_tiles
attributes.description: When set to true, new chunks will be generated with lab tiles, instead of using the surface's map generation settings.

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: Unique ID associated with this surface.

attributes.name: map_gen_settings
attributes.description: The generation settings for this surface. These can be modified to after surface generation, but note that this will not retroactively update the surface. To manually adjust it, [LuaSurface::regenerate_entity](LuaSurface::regenerate_entity), [LuaSurface::regenerate_decorative](LuaSurface::regenerate_decorative) and [LuaSurface::delete_chunk](LuaSurface::delete_chunk) can be used.

attributes.name: min_brightness
attributes.description: The minimal brightness during the night. Default is `0.15`. The value has an effect on the game simalution only, it doesn't have any effect on rendering.

attributes.name: morning
attributes.description: The daytime when morning starts.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this surface. Names are unique among surfaces.
notes: the default surface can't be renamed.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: peaceful_mode
attributes.description: Is peaceful mode enabled on this surface?

attributes.name: show_clouds
attributes.description: If clouds are shown on this surface.
notes: If false, clouds are never shown. If true the player must also have clouds enabled in graphics settings for them to be shown.

attributes.name: solar_power_multiplier
attributes.description: The multiplier of solar power on this surface. Cannot be less than 0.
notes: Solar equipment is still limited to its maximum power output.

attributes.name: ticks_per_day
attributes.description: The number of ticks per day for this surface.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: wind_orientation
attributes.description: Current wind direction.

attributes.name: wind_orientation_change
attributes.description: Change in wind orientation per tick.

attributes.name: wind_speed
attributes.description: Current wind speed.

methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

attributes.description: The current level of this technology. For level-based technology writing to this is the same as researching the technology to the *previous* level. Writing the level will set [LuaTechnology::enabled](LuaTechnology::enabled) to `true`.

attributes.name: localised_name
attributes.description: Localised name of this technology.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of this technology.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: order

attributes.name: prerequisites
attributes.description: Prerequisites of this technology. The result maps technology name to the [LuaTechnology](LuaTechnology) object.

attributes.name: research_unit_count
attributes.description: Number of research units required for this technology.
notes: This is multiplied by the current research cost multiplier, unless [LuaTechnologyPrototype::ignore_tech_cost_multiplier](LuaTechnologyPrototype::ignore_tech_cost_multiplier) is `true`.

attributes.name: research_unit_count_formula
attributes.description: The count formula used for this infinite research or nil if this isn't an infinite research.

attributes.name: research_unit_energy
attributes.description: Amount of energy required to finish a unit of research.

attributes.name: research_unit_ingredients
attributes.description: Ingredients labs will require to research this technology.

attributes.name: researched
attributes.description: Has this technology been researched? Switching from `false` to `true` will trigger the technology advancement perks; switching from `true` to `false` will reverse them.

attributes.name: upgrade

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: prerequisites

attributes.name: research_unit_count

notes: This is multiplied by the current research cost multiplier, unless [LuaTechnologyPrototype::ignore_tech_cost_multiplier](LuaTechnologyPrototype::ignore_tech_cost_multiplier) is `true`.

attributes.name: research_unit_count_formula

attributes.name: research_unit_ingredients

methods.name: cancel_deconstruction

parameters.name: force

parameters.name: player

methods.name: collides_with

examples:
Check if the character would collide with a tile 
```
game.player.print(tostring(game.player.surface.get_tile(1, 1).collides_with("player-layer")))
```

methods.name: help

methods.name: order_deconstruction

methods.return_description: The deconstructible tile proxy created if any or `nil`.

methods.description: Is this tile marked for deconstruction?

During normal gameplay, only [non-mineable](LuaTilePrototype::mineable_properties) tiles can become hidden. This can however be circumvented with [LuaSurface::set_hidden_tile](LuaSurface::set_hidden_tile).

attributes.description: Prototype name of this tile. E.g. `"sand-3"` or `"grass-2"`.

attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: The position this tile references.

attributes.name: surface
attributes.description: The surface this tile is on.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

attributes.name: autoplace_specification
attributes.description: Autoplace specification for this prototype. `nil` if none.

attributes.name: can_be_part_of_blueprint
attributes.description: False if this tile is not allowed in blueprints regardless of the ability to build it.

attributes.name: check_collision_with_entities
attributes.description: True if building this tile should check for colliding entities above and prevent building if such are found. Also during mining tiles above this tile checks for entities colliding with this tile and prevents mining if such are found.

attributes.name: collision_mask
attributes.description: The collision mask this tile uses

attributes.name: decorative_removal_probability
attributes.description: The probability that decorative entities will be removed from on top of this tile when this tile is generated.

attributes.name: emissions_per_second

attributes.name: items_to_place_this
attributes.description: Items that when placed will produce this tile. It is a dictionary indexed by the item prototype name.

parameters.name: minable
parameters.description: Is this tile mineable at all?

parameters.name: miningparticle

parameters.name: miningtime
parameters.description: Energy required to mine a tile.

parameters.name: products
parameters.description: Products obtained by mining this tile.

attributes.name: name

attributes.name: needs_correction

attributes.name: next_direction
attributes.description: The next direction of this tile or `nil` - used when a tile has multiple directions (such as hazard concrete)

attributes.name: object_name

classes.name: LuaTrain
classes.description: A train. Trains are a sequence of connected rolling stocks -- locomotives and wagons.

methods.name: clear_fluids_inside
methods.description: Clears all fluids in this train.

methods.name: clear_items_inside
methods.description: Clear all items in this train.

methods.name: get_contents
methods.description: Get a mapping of the train's inventory.
methods.return_description: The counts, indexed by item names.

methods.name: get_fluid_contents
methods.description: Gets a mapping of the train's fluid inventory.
methods.return_description: The counts, indexed by fluid names.

methods.name: get_fluid_count
methods.description: Get the amount of a particular fluid stored in the train.

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: Fluid name to count. If not given, counts all fluids.

methods.name: get_item_count
methods.description: Get the amount of a particular item stored in the train.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Item name to count. If not given, counts all items.

methods.name: get_rails
methods.description: Gets all rails under the train.

methods.name: go_to_station
methods.description: Go to the station specified by the index in the train's schedule.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Insert a stack into the train.

methods.name: insert_fluid
methods.description: Inserts the given fluid into the first available location in this train.
methods.return_description: The amount inserted.

methods.name: recalculate_path
methods.description: Checks if the path is invalid and tries to re-path if it isn't.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Forces the train to re-path regardless of the current path being valid or not.

methods.return_description: If the train has a path after the repath attempt.

methods.name: remove_fluid
methods.description: Remove some fluid from the train.
methods.return_description: The amount of fluid actually removed.

methods.name: remove_item
methods.description: Remove some items from the train.

parameters.name: stack
parameters.description: The amount and type of items to remove

methods.return_description: Number of items actually removed.

attributes.name: back_rail
attributes.description: The rail at the back end of the train, possibly `nil`.

attributes.name: back_stock
attributes.description: The back stock of this train or `nil`.

attributes.name: cargo_wagons
attributes.description: The cargo carriages the train contains.

attributes.name: carriages
attributes.description: Rolling stocks the train is composed of.

attributes.name: fluid_wagons
attributes.description: The fluid carriages the train contains.

attributes.name: front_rail
attributes.description: The rail at the front end of the train, possibly `nil`.

attributes.name: front_stock
attributes.description: The front stock of this train or `nil`.

attributes.name: has_path
attributes.description: If this train has a path.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The unique train ID.

attributes.name: kill_count
attributes.description: The total number of kills by this train.

attributes.name: killed_players
attributes.description:
The players killed by this train.

The keys are the player indices, the values are how often this train killed that player.

attributes.name: locomotives
attributes.description: Arrays of locomotives. The result is two arrays, indexed by `"front_movers"` and `"back_movers"` containing the locomotives. E.g. `{front_movers={loco1, loco2}, back_movers={loco3}}`.

attributes.name: manual_mode
attributes.description: When `true`, the train is explicitly controlled by the player or script. When `false`, the train moves autonomously according to its schedule.

attributes.name: max_backward_speed
attributes.description: Current max speed when moving backwards, depends on locomotive prototype and fuel.

attributes.name: max_forward_speed
attributes.description: Current max speed when moving forward, depends on locomotive prototype and fuel.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: passengers
attributes.description: The player passengers on the train
notes: This does *not* index using player index. See [LuaPlayer::index](LuaPlayer::index) on each player instance for the player index.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: The path this train is using or `nil` if none.

attributes.name: path_end_rail
attributes.description: The destination rail this train is currently pathing to or `nil`.

attributes.name: path_end_stop
attributes.description: The destination train stop this train is currently pathing to or `nil`.

attributes.name: riding_state
attributes.description: The riding state of this train.

attributes.name: schedule
attributes.description: The trains current schedule or `nil` if empty. Set to `nil` to clear.
notes: The schedule can't be changed by modifying the returned table. Instead, changes must be made by assigning a new table to this attribute.

attributes.name: signal
attributes.description: The signal this train is arriving or waiting at or `nil` if none.

attributes.name: speed
attributes.description: Current speed.
notes: Changing the speed of the train is potentially an unsafe operation because train uses the speed for its internal calculations of break distances, etc.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: This train's current state.

attributes.name: station
attributes.description: The train stop this train is stopped at or `nil`.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`. Mods are advised to check for object validity if any change to the game state might have occurred between the creation of the Lua object and its access.

attributes.name: weight
attributes.description: The weight of this train.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

attributes.name: enable_disable
attributes.description: `true` if the train stop is enabled/disabled through the circuit network.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: read_from_train
attributes.description: `true` if the train stop should send the train contents to the circuit network.

attributes.name: read_stopped_train
attributes.description: `true` if the train stop should send the stopped train id to the circuit network.

attributes.name: read_trains_count
attributes.description: `true` if the train stop should send amount of incoming trains to the circuit network.

attributes.name: send_to_train
attributes.description: `true` if the train stop should send the circuit network contents to the train to use.

attributes.name: set_trains_limit
attributes.description: `true` if the trains_limit_signal is used to set a limit of trains incoming for train stop.

attributes.name: stopped_train_signal
attributes.description: The signal that will be sent when using the send-train-id option.

attributes.name: trains_count_signal
attributes.description: The signal that will be sent when using the read-trains-count option.

attributes.name: trains_limit_signal
attributes.description: The signal to be used by set-trains-limit to limit amount of incoming trains

attributes.name: valid

classes.name: LuaUnitGroup
classes.description: A collection of units moving and attacking together. The engine creates autonomous unit groups to attack polluted areas. The script can create and control such groups as well. Groups can accept commands in the same manner as regular units.

methods.name: add_member
methods.description: Make a unit a member of this group. Has the same effect as giving a `group_command` with this group to the unit.
notes: The member must have the same force as the unit group.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Dissolve this group. Its members won't be destroyed, they will be merely unlinked from this group.

methods.name: help
methods.description: All methods and properties that this object supports.

methods.name: set_autonomous
methods.description: Make this group autonomous. Autonomous groups will automatically attack polluted areas. Autonomous groups aren't considered to be script driven

methods.name: set_command
methods.description: Give this group a command.

methods.name: set_distraction_command
methods.description: Give this group a distraction command.

methods.name: start_moving
methods.description: Make the group start moving even if some of its members haven't yet arrived.

attributes.name: command
attributes.description: The command given to this group or `nil` is the group has no command.

attributes.name: distraction_command
attributes.description: The distraction command given to this group or `nil` is the group currently isn't distracted.

attributes.name: force
attributes.description: The force of this unit group.

attributes.name: group_number
attributes.description: The group number for this unit group.

attributes.name: is_script_driven
attributes.description: Whether this unit group is controlled by a script or by the game engine.

attributes.name: members
attributes.description: Members of this group.

attributes.name: object_name
attributes.description: The class name of this object. Available even when `valid` is false. For LuaStruct objects it may also be suffixed with a dotted path to a member of the struct.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: Group position. This can have different meanings depending on the group state. When the group is gathering, the position is the place of gathering. When the group is moving, the position is the expected position of its members along the path. When the group is attacking, it is the average position of its members.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: Whether this group is gathering, moving or attacking.

attributes.name: surface
attributes.description: The surface of this unit group.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Is this object valid? This Lua object holds a reference to an object within the game engine. It is possible that the game-engine object is removed whilst a mod still holds the corresponding Lua object. If that happens, the object becomes invalid, i.e. this attribute will be `false`.
