events.name: CustomInputEvent
events.description: Called when a [CustomInput](https://wiki.factorio.com/Prototype/CustomInput) is activated.

data.name: cursor_position
data.description: The mouse cursor position when the custom input was activated.

data.name: input_name
data.description: The prototype name of the custom input that was activated.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player that activated the custom input.

data.name: selected_prototype
data.description: Information about the prototype that is selected when the custom input is used. `nil` if none is selected.

events.name: on_ai_command_completed
events.description: Called when a unit/group completes a command.

data.name: unit_number
data.description: unit_number/group_number of the unit/group which just completed a command.

data.name: was_distracted
data.description: Was this command generated by a distraction.

events.name: on_area_cloned
events.description: Called when an area of the map is cloned.

events.name: on_biter_base_built
events.description: Called when a biter migration builds a base.
notes: This will be called multiple times for each migration, once for every biter that is sacrificed to build part of the new base.

events.name: on_brush_cloned
events.description: Called when a set of positions on the map is cloned.

events.name: on_build_base_arrived
events.description: Called when a [defines.command.build_base](defines.command.build_base) command reaches its destination, and before building starts.

data.name: group
data.description: The unit group the command was assigned to.

data.name: unit
data.description: The unit the command was assigned to.

events.name: on_built_entity
events.description: Called when player builds something. Can be filtered using [LuaPlayerBuiltEntityEventFilter](LuaPlayerBuiltEntityEventFilter).

data.name: item
data.description: The item prototype used to build the entity. Note this won't exist in some situations (built from blueprint, undo, etc).

data.name: tags
data.description: The tags associated with this entity if any.

events.name: on_cancelled_deconstruction
events.description: Called when the deconstruction of an entity is canceled. Can be filtered using [LuaEntityDeconstructionCancelledEventFilter](LuaEntityDeconstructionCancelledEventFilter).

events.name: on_cancelled_upgrade
events.description: Called when the upgrade of an entity is canceled. Can be filtered using [LuaUpgradeCancelledEventFilter](LuaUpgradeCancelledEventFilter).

events.name: on_character_corpse_expired
events.description: Called when a character corpse expires due to timeout or all of the items being removed from it.
notes: this is not called if the corpse is mined. See [defines.events.on_pre_player_mined_item](defines.events.on_pre_player_mined_item) to detect that.

events.name: on_chart_tag_added
events.description: Called when a chart tag is created.

events.name: on_chart_tag_modified
events.description: Called when a chart tag is modified by a player.

events.name: on_chart_tag_removed
events.description: Called just before a chart tag is deleted.

events.name: on_chunk_charted
events.description: Called when a chunk is charted or re-charted.

events.name: on_chunk_deleted
events.description: Called when one or more chunks are deleted using [LuaSurface::delete_chunk](LuaSurface::delete_chunk).

events.name: on_chunk_generated
events.description: Called when a chunk is generated.

data.name: surface
data.description: The surface the chunk is on.

events.name: on_combat_robot_expired
events.description: Called when a combat robot expires through a lack of energy, or timeout.

data.name: owner
data.description: The entity that owns the robot if any.

events.name: on_console_chat
events.description: Called when a message is sent to the in-game console, either by a player or through the server interface.
notes: This event only fires for plain messages, not for any commands (including `/shout` or `/whisper`).

data.name: message
data.description: The chat message that was sent.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player doing the chatting, if any.

events.name: on_console_command
events.description: Called when someone enters a command-like message regardless of it being a valid command.

data.name: command
data.description: The command as typed without the preceding forward slash ('/').

events.name: on_cutscene_cancelled
events.description: Called when a cutscene is cancelled by the player or by script.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player the cutscene was shown to.

events.name: on_cutscene_waypoint_reached
events.description:
Called when a cutscene is playing, each time it reaches a waypoint in that cutscene.

This refers to an index in the table previously passed to set_controller which started the cutscene.
notes: Due to implementation omission, waypoint_index is 0-based.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player index of the player viewing the cutscene.

data.name: waypoint_index
data.description: The index of the waypoint we just completed.

events.name: on_difficulty_settings_changed
events.description: Called when the map difficulty settings are changed.
notes: It's not guaranteed that both settings are changed - just that at least one has been changed.

events.name: on_entity_cloned
events.description: Called when an entity is cloned. Can be filtered for the source entity using [LuaEntityClonedEventFilter](LuaEntityClonedEventFilter).

events.name: on_entity_damaged
events.description: Called when an entity is damaged. Can be filtered using [LuaEntityDamagedEventFilter](LuaEntityDamagedEventFilter).
notes: This is not called when an entities health is set directly by another mod.

data.name: cause
data.description: The entity that did the attacking if available.

data.name: final_health
data.description: The health of the entity after the damage was applied.

data.name: force
data.description: The force that did the attacking if any.

events.name: on_entity_destroyed
events.description: Called after an entity is destroyed that has been registered with [LuaBootstrap::register_on_entity_destroyed](LuaBootstrap::register_on_entity_destroyed)
notes: Depending on when a given entity is destroyed this will be fired at the end of the current tick or end of the next tick.

events.name: on_entity_died
events.description: Called when an entity dies. Can be filtered using [LuaEntityDiedEventFilter](LuaEntityDiedEventFilter).

data.name: cause
data.description: The entity that did the killing if available.

data.name: force
data.description: The force that did the killing if any.

data.name: loot
data.description: The loot generated by this entity if any.

events.name: on_entity_logistic_slot_changed
events.description: Called when one of an entity's personal logistic slots changes.
notes: "Personal logistic slot" refers to a character or vehicle's personal request / auto-trash slots, not the request slots on logistic chests.

data.name: entity
data.description: The entity for whom a logistic slot was changed.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who changed the slot, or `nil` if changed by script.

data.name: slot_index
data.description: The slot index that was changed.

events.name: on_entity_renamed
events.description: Called after an entity has been renamed either by the player or through script.

data.name: player_index
data.description: If by_script is true this will not be included.

events.name: on_entity_settings_pasted
events.description: Called after entity copy-paste is done.

data.name: destination
data.description: The destination entity settings were copied to.

data.name: source
data.description: The source entity settings were copied from.

events.name: on_entity_spawned

events.name: on_equipment_inserted

events.description: Called after equipment is removed from an equipment grid.

data.name: added
data.description: If the other force was added or removed.

data.name: force
data.description: The force who's cease fire changed.

data.name: other_force
data.description: Which force was added or removed.

events.name: on_force_created
events.description: Called when a new force is created using `game.create_force()`
notes: This is not called when the default forces (`'player'`, `'enemy'`, `'neutral'`) are created as they will always exist.

data.name: added

events.name: on_forces_merged
events.description: Called after two forces have been merged using `game.merge_forces()`.
notes: The source force is invalidated before this event is called and the name can be re-used in this event if desired.

data.name: destination
data.description: The force entities where reassigned to.

data.description: The index of the destroyed force.

data.name: destination
data.description: The force to reassign entities to.

events.name: on_game_created_from_scenario
events.description: Called when a game is created from a scenario. This is fired for every mod, even when the scenario's save data already includes it. In those cases however, [LuaBootstrap::on_init](LuaBootstrap::on_init) is not fired.
notes: This event is not fired when the scenario is loaded via the map editor.

After this event any items in the buffer will be transferred into the player as if they came from mining the entity. Can be filtered using [LuaPlayerMinedEntityEventFilter](LuaPlayerMinedEntityEventFilter).
notes: The buffer inventory is special in that it's only valid during this event and has a dynamic size expanding as more items are transferred into it.

data.description: The temporary inventory that holds the result of mining the entity.

data.name: entity
data.description: The entity that has been mined.

events.name: on_robot_mined_tile
events.description: Called after a robot mines tiles.

data.name: surface_index
data.description: The surface the tile(s) were mined on.

events.name: on_robot_pre_mined
events.description: Called before a robot mines an entity. Can be filtered using [LuaPreRobotMinedEntityEventFilter](LuaPreRobotMinedEntityEventFilter).

data.name: entity
data.description: The entity which is about to be mined.

data.name: robot
data.description: The robot that's about to do the mining.

events.name: on_rocket_launch_ordered
events.description: Called when a rocket silo is ordered to be launched.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player that is riding the rocket, if any.

events.name: on_rocket_launched
events.description: Called when the rocket is launched.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player that is riding the rocket, if any.

events.name: on_runtime_mod_setting_changed
events.description: Called when a runtime mod setting is changed by a player.

data.name: player_index
data.description: If the `setting_type` is `"global"` and it was changed through the mod settings GUI, this is the index of the player that changed the global setting. If the `setting_type` is `"runtime-per-user"` and it changed a current setting of the player, this is the index of the player whose setting was changed. In all other cases, this is `nil`.

data.name: setting
data.description: The prototype name of the setting that was changed.

events.name: on_script_inventory_resized
events.description: Called just after a script inventory is resized.

data.name: mod
data.description: The mod that did the resizing. This will be `"core"` if done by console command or scenario script.

data.name: overflow_inventory
data.description: Any items which didn't fit into the new inventory size.

data.name: player_index
data.description: If done by console command; the player who ran the command.

events.name: on_script_path_request_finished
events.description: Called when a [LuaSurface::request_path](LuaSurface::request_path) call completes.

data.name: id
data.description: Handle to associate the callback with a particular call to [LuaSurface::request_path](LuaSurface::request_path).

data.name: path
data.description: The actual path that the pathfinder has determined. `nil` if pathfinding failed.

data.name: try_again_later
data.description: Indicates that the pathfinder failed because it is too busy, and that you can retry later.

events.name: on_script_trigger_effect
events.description: Called when a script trigger effect is triggered.

data.name: effect_id
data.description: The effect_id specified in the trigger effect.

data.name: surface_index
data.description: The surface the effect happened on.

events.name: on_sector_scanned
events.description: Called when an entity of type `radar` finishes scanning a sector. Can be filtered for the radar using [LuaSectorScannedEventFilter](LuaSectorScannedEventFilter).

data.name: radar
data.description: The radar that did the scanning.

events.name: on_selected_entity_changed
events.description: Called after the selected entity changes for a given player.

data.name: last_entity
data.description: The last selected entity if it still exists and there was one.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player whose selected entity changed.

events.name: on_spider_command_completed
events.description: Called when a spider finishes moving to its autopilot position.

data.name: vehicle
data.description: Spider vehicle which was requested to move.

events.name: on_string_translated
events.description: Called when a translation request generated through [LuaPlayer::request_translation](LuaPlayer::request_translation) is translated.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player whose locale was used for the translation.

data.name: translated
data.description: Whether the requested localised string was valid and could be translated.

events.name: on_surface_cleared
events.description: Called just after a surface is cleared (all entities removed and all chunks deleted).

events.name: on_surface_created
events.description: Called when a surface is created.
notes: This is not called when the default surface is created as it will always exist.

events.name: on_surface_deleted
events.description: Called after a surface is deleted.

events.name: on_surface_imported
events.description: Called after a surface is imported.

events.name: on_surface_renamed
events.description: Called when a surface is renamed.

events.name: on_technology_effects_reset
events.description: Called when [LuaForce::reset_technology_effects](LuaForce::reset_technology_effects) is finished.

events.name: on_tick
events.description: It is fired once every tick. Since this event is fired every tick, its handler shouldn't include performance heavy code.

events.name: on_train_changed_state
events.description: Called when a train changes state (started to stopped and vice versa)

events.name: on_train_created
events.description: Called when a new train is created either through disconnecting/connecting an existing one or building a new one.

data.name: old_train_id_1
data.description: The first old train id when splitting/merging trains.

data.name: old_train_id_2
data.description: The second old train id when splitting/merging trains.

events.name: on_train_schedule_changed
events.description: Called when a trains schedule is changed either by the player or through script.

data.name: player_index
data.description: The player who made the change if any.

events.name: on_trigger_created_entity
events.description: Called when an entity with a trigger prototype (such as capsules) create an entity AND that trigger prototype defined `trigger_created_entity="true"`.

events.name: on_trigger_fired_artillery
events.description: Called when an entity with a trigger prototype (such as capsules) fire an artillery projectile AND that trigger prototype defined `trigger_fired_artillery="true"`.

events.name: on_unit_added_to_group
events.description: Called when a unit is added to a unit group.

events.name: on_unit_group_created
events.description: Called when a new unit group is created, before any members are added to it.

events.name: on_unit_group_finished_gathering
events.description: Called when a unit group finishes gathering and starts executing its command.

events.name: on_unit_removed_from_group
events.description: Called when a unit is removed from a unit group.

events.name: on_worker_robot_expired
events.description: Called when a worker (construction or logistic) robot expires through a lack of energy.

events.name: script_raised_built
events.description: A static event mods can use to tell other mods they built something by script. This event is only raised if a mod does so with [LuaBootstrap::raise_event](LuaBootstrap::raise_event) or [LuaBootstrap::raise_script_built](LuaBootstrap::raise_script_built), or when `raise_built` is passed to [LuaSurface::create_entity](LuaSurface::create_entity). Can be filtered using [LuaScriptRaisedBuiltEventFilter](LuaScriptRaisedBuiltEventFilter).

data.name: entity
data.description: The entity that has been built.

events.name: script_raised_destroy
events.description: A static event mods can use to tell other mods they destroyed something by script. This event is only raised if a mod does so with [LuaBootstrap::raise_event](LuaBootstrap::raise_event) or [LuaBootstrap::raise_script_destroy](LuaBootstrap::raise_script_destroy), or when `raise_destroy` is passed to [LuaEntity::destroy](LuaEntity::destroy). Can be filtered using [LuaScriptRaisedDestroyEventFilter](LuaScriptRaisedDestroyEventFilter).

events.name: script_raised_revive
events.description: A static event mods can use to tell other mods they revived something by script. This event is only raised if a mod does so with [LuaBootstrap::raise_event](LuaBootstrap::raise_event) or [LuaBootstrap::raise_script_revive](LuaBootstrap::raise_script_revive), or when `raise_revive` is passed to [LuaEntity::revive](LuaEntity::revive). Can be filtered using [LuaScriptRaisedReviveEventFilter](LuaScriptRaisedReviveEventFilter).

data.name: tags
data.description: The tags associated with this entity, if any.

events.name: script_raised_set_tiles
events.description: A static event mods can use to tell other mods they changed tiles on a surface by script. This event is only raised if a mod does so with [LuaBootstrap::raise_event](LuaBootstrap::raise_event) or [LuaBootstrap::raise_script_set_tiles](LuaBootstrap::raise_script_set_tiles), or when `raise_event` is passed to [LuaSurface::set_tiles](LuaSurface::set_tiles).

data.name: surface_index
data.description: The surface whose tiles were changed.

defines.name: command
defines.description: Command given to units describing what they should do.

values.name: attack_area
values.description: Go to a place and attack what you see.

values.name: build_base
values.description: Go to a position and build a base there.

values.name: group
values.description: Do what your group wants you to do.

values.name: stop
values.description: Stop moving and stay where you are.

defines.name: compound_command
defines.description: How commands are joined together in a compound command (see [defines.command.compound](defines.command.compound)).

values.name: logical_and
values.description: Fail on first failure. Only succeeds if all commands (executed one after another) succeed.

values.name: logical_or
values.description: Succeed on first success. Only fails if all commands (executed one after another) fail.

values.name: return_last
values.description: Execute all commands in sequence and fail or succeed depending on the return status of the last command.

values.name: character
values.description: The controller controls a character. This is the default controller in freeplay.

values.name: cutscene
values.description: The player can't interact with the world, and the camera pans around in a predefined manner.

values.name: editor
values.description: The Editor Controller near ultimate power to do almost anything in the game.

values.name: ghost
values.description: Can't interact with the world, can only observe. Used in the multiplayer waiting-to-respawn screen.

values.name: god
values.description: The controller isn't tied to a character. This is the default controller in sandbox.

values.name: spectator
values.description: Can't change anything in the world but can view anything.

values.name: by_anything
values.description: Attack closer enemy entities, including entities "built" by player (belts, inserters, chests).

values.name: by_enemy
values.description: Attack closer enemy entities with force.

values.name: none
values.description: Perform command even if someone attacks the unit.

values.name: disabled
values.description: Used by constant combinators: Combinator is turned off via switch in GUI.

values.name: full_output
values.description: Used by crafting machines, boilers, burner energy sources and reactors: Reactor/burner has full burnt result inventory, boiler has full output fluidbox.

values.name: low_input_fluid
values.description: Used by boilers and fluid turrets: Boiler still has some fluid but is about to run out.

values.name: missing_required_fluid
values.description: Used by mining drills when the mining fluid is missing.

values.name: no_input_fluid
values.description: Used by boilers, fluid turrets and fluid energy sources: Boiler has no fluid to work with.

values.name: not_plugged_in_electric_network
values.description: Used by generators and solar panels.

values.name: waiting_for_space_in_destination
values.description: Used by inserters and mining drills.

values.name: waiting_for_target_to_be_built
values.description: Used by inserters targeting entity ghosts.

defines.name: events
defines.description: See the [events page](events.html) for more info on what events contain and when they get raised.

defines.name: prototypes
defines.description: A dictionary mapping all top-level prototypes by name to a list of their associated subtypes. This list is organized as a lookup table, meaning it maps the sub-prototype names to `0`. As an example, `defines.prototypes['entity']` looks like this: `{furnace=0, inserter=0, container=0, ...}`.

defines.name: signal_state
defines.description: State of an ordinary rail signal.

values.name: destination_full
values.description: Same as no_path but all candidate train stops are full

values.name: manual_control
values.description: Can move if user explicitly sits in and rides the train.

values.name: manual_control_stop
values.description: Switched to manual control and has to stop.

values.name: no_path
values.description: Has no path and is stopped.

values.name: path_lost
values.description: Had path and lost it -- must stop.

builtin_types.name: double
builtin_types.description: A double-precision floating-point number. This is the same data type as all Lua numbers use.

builtin_types.name: float
builtin_types.description: A floating-point number. This is a single-precision floating point number. Whilst Lua only uses double-precision numbers, when a function takes a float, the game engine will immediately convert the double-precision number to single-precision.

builtin_types.name: int
builtin_types.description: 32-bit signed integer. Possible values are -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.

builtin_types.name: int8
builtin_types.description: 8-bit signed integer. Possible values are -128 to 127.

builtin_types.name: string
builtin_types.description: Strings are enclosed in double-quotes, like this `"hi"`.

builtin_types.name: table
builtin_types.description: Tables are enclosed in curly brackets, like this `{}`

builtin_types.name: uint
builtin_types.description: 32-bit unsigned integer. Possible values are 0 to 4,294,967,295.

builtin_types.name: uint16
builtin_types.description: 16-bit unsigned integer. Possible values are 0 to 65535.

builtin_types.name: uint64
builtin_types.description: 64-bit unsigned integer. Possible values are 0 to 18,446,744,073,709,551,615.

builtin_types.name: uint8
builtin_types.description: 8-bit unsigned integer. Possible values are 0 to 255.

concepts.name: AchievementPrototypeFilter

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The condition to filter on. One of `"allowed-without-fight"`, `"type"`

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: Inverts the condition. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: How to combine this with the previous filter. Must be `"or"` or `"and"`. Defaults to `"or"`. When evaluating the filters, `"and"` has higher precedence than `"or"`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The prototype type

concepts.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `filter`:

parameters.name: icon
parameters.description: The SignalID used for a custom alert. Only present for custom alerts.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message for a custom alert. Only present for custom alerts.

parameters.name: tick
parameters.description: The tick this alert was created.

concepts.name: Alignment
concepts.description: A [string](string) that specifies where a gui element should be.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Ammo category of this ammo.

parameters.name: clamp_position
parameters.description: When `true`, the gun will be able to shoot even when the target is out of range. Only applies when `target_type` is `position`. The gun will fire at the maximum range in the direction of the target position. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: energy_consumption
parameters.description: Energy consumption of a single shot, if applicable. Defaults to `0`.

parameters.name: target_type
parameters.description: One of `"entity"` (fires at an entity), `"position"` (fires directly at a position), or `"direction"` (fires in a direction).

concepts.name: Any
concepts.description: Any basic type (string, number, boolean), table, or LuaObject.

concepts.name: AnyBasic
concepts.description: Any basic type (string, number, boolean) or table.

parameters.name: first_constant
parameters.description: Constant to use as the first argument of the operation. Has no effect when `first_signal` is set. Defaults to `0`.

parameters.name: first_signal
parameters.description: First signal to use in an operation. If not specified, the second argument will be the value of `first_constant`.

parameters.name: output_signal
parameters.description: Specifies the signal to output.

parameters.name: second_constant
parameters.description: Constant to use as the second argument of the operation. Has no effect when `second_signal` is set. Defaults to `0`.

parameters.name: second_signal
parameters.description: Second signal to use in an operation. If not specified, the second argument will be the value of `second_constant`.

parameters.name: damage_modifier
parameters.description: Multiplier applied to the damage of an attack.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Name of the [LuaFluidPrototype](LuaFluidPrototype).

concepts.name: AttackParameters

parameters.name: ammo_categories
parameters.description: List of the names of compatible [LuaAmmoCategoryPrototypes](LuaAmmoCategoryPrototype).

parameters.name: ammo_consumption_modifier
parameters.description: Multiplier applied to the ammo consumption of an attack.

parameters.name: cooldown
parameters.description: Minimum amount of ticks between shots. If this is less than `1`, multiple shots can be performed per tick.

parameters.name: damage_modifier
parameters.description: Multiplier applied to the damage of an attack.

parameters.name: fire_penalty
parameters.description: When searching for the nearest enemy to attack, `fire_penalty` is added to the enemy's distance if they are on fire.

parameters.name: health_penalty
parameters.description: When searching for an enemy to attack, a higher `health_penalty` will discourage targeting enemies with high health. A negative penalty will do the opposite.

parameters.name: min_attack_distance
parameters.description: If less than `range`, the entity will choose a random distance between `range` and `min_attack_distance` and attack from that distance. Used for spitters.

parameters.name: min_range
parameters.description: Minimum range of attack. Used with flamethrower turrets to prevent self-immolation.

parameters.name: range
parameters.description: Maximum range of attack.

parameters.name: range_mode
parameters.description: Defines how the range is determined. Either `'center-to-center'` or `'bounding-box-to-bounding-box'`.

parameters.name: rotate_penalty
parameters.description: When searching for an enemy to attack, a higher `rotate_penalty` will discourage targeting enemies that would take longer to turn to face.

parameters.name: turn_range
parameters.description: The arc that the entity can attack in as a fraction of a circle. A value of `1` means the full 360 degrees.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of AttackParameter. One of `'projectile'`, `'stream'` or `'beam'`.

parameters.name: warmup
parameters.description: Number of ticks it takes for the weapon to actually shoot after it has been ordered to do so.

concepts.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `type`:

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description: For things that are placed as spots such as ores and enemy bases, frequency is generally proportional to number of spots placed per unit area. For continuous features such as forests, frequency is how compressed the probability function is over distance, i.e. the inverse of 'scale' (similar to terrain_segmentation). When the [LuaAutoplaceControlPrototype](LuaAutoplaceControlPrototype) is of the category `"terrain"`, then scale is shown in the map generator GUI instead of frequency.

parameters.name: richness
parameters.description: Has different effects for different things, but generally affects the 'health' or density of a thing that is placed without affecting where it is placed. For trees, richness affects tree health. For ores, richness multiplies the amount of ore at any given tile in a patch. Metadata about autoplace controls (such as whether or not 'richness' does anything for them) can be found in the [LuaAutoplaceControlPrototype](LuaAutoplaceControlPrototype) by looking up `game.autoplace_control_prototypes[(control prototype name)]`, e.g. `game.autoplace_control_prototypes["enemy-base"].richness` is false, because enemy base autoplacement doesn't use richness.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: For things that are placed as spots, size is proportional to the area of each spot. For continuous features, size affects how much of the map is covered with the thing, and is called 'coverage' in the GUI.

parameters.name: treat_missing_as_default
parameters.description: Whether missing autoplace names for this type should be default enabled.

concepts.name: AutoplaceSpecification
concepts.description: Specifies how probability and richness are calculated when placing something on the map. Can be specified either using `probability_expression` and `richness_expression` or by using all the other fields.

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: Control prototype name.

parameters.name: noise_layer
parameters.description: Prototype name of the noise layer.

parameters.name: first
parameters.description: Tile prototype name

parameters.name: second
parameters.description: Second prototype name

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: The target entity.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The target position.

concepts.name: BlueprintEntity
concepts.description: The representation of an entity inside of a blueprint. It has at least these fields, but can contain additional ones depending on the kind of entity.

parameters.name: connections
parameters.description: The circuit network connections of the entity, if there are any. Only relevant for entities that support circuit connections.

parameters.name: control_behavior
parameters.description: The control behavior of the entity, if it has one. The format of the control behavior depends on the entity's type. Only relevant for entities that support control behaviors.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction the entity is facing. Only present for entities that can face in different directions and when the entity is not facing north.

parameters.name: entity_number
parameters.description: The entity's unique identifier in the blueprint.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: The items that the entity will request when revived, if there are any. It's a mapping of prototype names to amounts. Only relevant for entity ghosts.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The prototype name of the entity.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position of the entity.

parameters.name: schedule
parameters.description: The schedule of the entity, if it has one. Only relevant for locomotives.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The entity tags of the entity, if there are any. Only relevant for entity ghosts.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index of the icon in the blueprint icons slots. Has to be an integer in the range [1, 4].

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the item prototype whose icon should be used.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index of the icon in the blueprint icons slots. Has to be an integer in the range [1, 4].

parameters.name: signal
parameters.description: The icon to use. It can be any item icon as well as any virtual signal icon.

concepts.name: BoundingBox
concepts.description: Two positions, specifying the top-left and bottom-right corner of the box respectively. Like with [Position](Position), the names of the members may be omitted. When read from the game, the third member `orientation` is present if it is non-zero, however it is ignored when provided to the game.
examples:
Explicit definition: 
```
{left_top = {-2, -3}, right_bottom = {5, 8}}
```

parameters.name: attack_parameters
parameters.description: Only present when `type` is `"throw"` or `"use-on-self"`.

parameters.name: equipment
parameters.description: Only present when `type` is `"equipment-remote"`. It is the equipment prototype name.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: One of `"throw"`, `"equipment-remote"`, `"use-on-self"`.

concepts.name: ChartTagSpec
notes: Either `icon`, `text`, or both must be provided.

concepts.name: ChunkPosition
concepts.description: Coordinates of a chunk in a [LuaSurface](LuaSurface) where each integer `x`/`y` represents a different chunk. This uses the same format as [Position](Position), meaning it can be specified either with or without explicit keys. A [Position](Position) can be translated to a ChunkPosition by dividing the `x`/`y` values by 32.

concepts.name: ChunkPositionAndArea
concepts.description: A [ChunkPosition](ChunkPosition) with an added bounding box for the area of the chunk.

parameters.name: comparator
parameters.description: Specifies how the inputs should be compared. If not specified, defaults to `"<"`.

parameters.name: constant
parameters.description: Constant to compare `first_signal` to. Has no effect when `second_signal` is set. When neither `second_signal` nor `constant` are specified, the effect is as though `constant` were specified with the value `0`.

parameters.name: first_signal
parameters.description: Defaults to blank

parameters.name: second_signal
parameters.description: What to compare `first_signal` to. If not specified, `first_signal` will be compared to `constant`.

parameters.name: fulfilled
parameters.description: Whether the condition is currently fulfilled

parameters.name: wire
parameters.description: Wire color, either [defines.wire_type.red](defines.wire_type.red) or [defines.wire_type.green](defines.wire_type.green).

parameters.name: center
parameters.description: This vector is a table with `x` and `y` keys instead of an array.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the [LuaEntityPrototype](LuaEntityPrototype)

concepts.name: CircularProjectileCreationSpecification
concepts.description:
An array with the following members:
- A [RealOrientation](RealOrientation)
- A [Vector](Vector)

parameters.name: cliff_elevation_0
parameters.description: Elevation at which the first row of cliffs is placed. The default is `10`, and this cannot be set from the map generation GUI.

parameters.name: cliff_elevation_interval
parameters.description: Elevation difference between successive rows of cliffs. This is inversely proportional to 'frequency' in the map generation GUI. Specifically, when set from the GUI the value is `40 / frequency`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the cliff prototype.

parameters.name: richness
parameters.description: Corresponds to 'continuity' in the GUI. This value is not used directly, but is used by the 'cliffiness' noise expression, which in combination with elevation and the two cliff elevation properties drives cliff placement (cliffs are placed when elevation crosses the elevation contours defined by `cliff_elevation_0` and `cliff_elevation_interval` when 'cliffiness' is greater than `0.5`). The default 'cliffiness' expression interprets this value such that larger values result in longer unbroken walls of cliffs, and smaller values (between `0` and `1`) result in larger gaps in cliff walls.

concepts.name: CollisionMask
concepts.description: This is a set of masks given as a dictionary[[CollisionMaskLayer](CollisionMaskLayer) → [boolean](boolean)]. Only set masks are present in the dictionary and they have the value `true`. Unset flags aren't present at all.

concepts.name: CollisionMaskLayer
concepts.description:
A [string](string) specifying a collision mask layer.

Possible values for the string are:
- `"ground-tile"`
- `"water-tile"`
- `"resource-layer"`
- `"doodad-layer"`
- `"floor-layer"`
- `"item-layer"`
- `"ghost-layer"`
- `"object-layer"`
- `"player-layer"`
- `"train-layer"`
- `"rail-layer"`
- `"transport-belt-layer"`
- `"not-setup"`

Additionally the values `"layer-13"` through `"layer-55"`. These layers are currently unused by the game but may change. If a mod is going to use one of the unused layers it's recommended to start at the higher layers because the base game will take from the lower ones.

concepts.name: CollisionMaskWithFlags
concepts.description:
A [CollisionMask](CollisionMask) but also includes any flags this mask has.

Flags such as:
- `"not-colliding-with-itself"`
- `"consider-tile-transitions"`
- `"colliding-with-tiles-only"`

concepts.name: Color
concepts.description:
Red, green, blue and alpha values, all in range [0, 1] or all in range [0, 255] if any value is > 1. All values here are optional. Color channels default to `0`, the alpha channel defaults to `1`.

Similar to [Position](Position), Color allows the short-hand notation of passing an array of exactly 3 or 4 numbers. The game usually expects colors to be in pre-multiplied form (color channels are pre-multiplied by alpha).
examples:
```
red1 = {r = 0.5, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0.5}  -- Half-opacity red
red2 = {r = 0.5, a = 0.5}                -- Same color as red1
black = {}                               -- All channels omitted: black
red1_short = {0.5, 0, 0, 0.5}            -- Same color as red1 in short-hand notation
```

concepts.name: ColorModifier
concepts.description: Same as [Color](Color), but red, green, blue and alpha values can be any floating point number, without any special handling of the range [1, 255].

concepts.name: Command
concepts.description: Commands can be given to enemies and unit groups.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of command. The remaining fields depend on the value of this field.

parameters.name: distraction
parameters.description: Defaults to `defines.distraction.by_enemy`.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Center of the attack area.

parameters.name: distraction
parameters.description: Defaults to `defines.distraction.by_enemy`.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius of the attack area.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Where to build the base.

parameters.name: distraction

concepts.name: EnemyExpansionMapSettings
concepts.description:
Candidate chunks are given scores to determine which one of them should be expanded into. This score takes into account various settings noted below. The iteration is over a square region centered around the chunk for which the calculation is done, and includes the central chunk as well. Distances are calculated as [Manhattan distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taxicab_geometry).

The pseudocode algorithm to determine a chunk's score is as follows:

```
player = 0
for neighbour in all chunks within enemy_building_influence_radius from chunk:
  player += number of player buildings on neighbour
          * building_coefficient
          * neighbouring_chunk_coefficient^distance(chunk, neighbour)

base = 0
for neighbour in all chunk within friendly_base_influence_radius from chunk:
  base += num of enemy bases on neighbour
          * other_base_coefficient
          * neighbouring_base_chunk_coefficient^distance(chunk, neighbour)

score(chunk) = 1 / (1 + player + base)
```

parameters.name: building_coefficient
parameters.description: Defaults to `0.1`.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether enemy expansion is enabled at all.

parameters.name: enemy_building_influence_radius
parameters.description: Defaults to `2`.

parameters.name: friendly_base_influence_radius
parameters.description: Defaults to `2`.

parameters.name: max_colliding_tiles_coefficient
parameters.description: A chunk has to have at most this high of a percentage of unbuildable tiles for it to be considered a candidate to avoid chunks full of water as candidates. Defaults to `0.9`, or 90%.

parameters.name: max_expansion_cooldown
parameters.description: The maximum time between expansions in ticks. The actual cooldown is adjusted to the current evolution levels. Defaults to `60*3,600=216,000` ticks.

parameters.name: max_expansion_distance
parameters.description: Distance in chunks from the furthest base around to prevent expansions from reaching too far into the player's territory. Defaults to `7`.

parameters.name: min_expansion_cooldown
parameters.description: The minimum time between expansions in ticks. The actual cooldown is adjusted to the current evolution levels. Defaults to `4*3,600=14,400` ticks.

parameters.name: neighbouring_base_chunk_coefficient
parameters.description: Defaults to `0.4`.

parameters.name: neighbouring_chunk_coefficient
parameters.description: Defaults to `0.5`.

parameters.name: other_base_coefficient
parameters.description: Defaults to `2.0`.

parameters.name: settler_group_max_size
parameters.description: The maximum size of a biter group that goes to build a new base. This is multiplied by the evolution factor. Defaults to `20`.

parameters.name: settler_group_min_size
parameters.description: The minimum size of a biter group that goes to build a new base. This is multiplied by the evolution factor. Defaults to `5`.

concepts.name: LocalisedString
concepts.description:
Localised strings are a way to support translation of in-game text. It is an array where the first element is the key and the remaining elements are parameters that will be substituted for placeholders in the template designated by the key.

The key identifies the string template. For example, `"gui-alert-tooltip.attack"` (for the template `"__1__
    objects are being damaged"`; see the file `data/core/locale/en.cfg`).

The template can contain placeholders such as `__1__` or `__2__`. These will be replaced by the respective parameter in the LocalisedString. The parameters themselves can be other localised strings, which will be processed recursively in the same fashion. Localised strings can not be recursed deeper than 20 levels and can not have more than 20 parameters.

As a special case, when the key is just the empty string, all the parameters will be concatenated (after processing, if any are localised strings). If there is only one parameter, it will be used as is.

Furthermore, when an API function expects a localised string, it will also accept a regular string (i.e. not a table) which will not be translated, as well as a number or boolean, which will be converted to their textual representation.
examples:
In the English translation, this will print `"No ammo"`; in the Czech translation, it will print `"Bez munice"`: 
```
game.player.print({"description.no-ammo"})
``` The `description.no-ammo` template contains no placeholders, so no further parameters are necessary.

In the English translation, this will print `"Durability: 5/9"`; in the Japanese one, it will print `"耐久度: 5/9"`: 
```
game.player.print({"description.durability", 5, 9})
```

This will print `"hello"` in all translations: 
```
game.player.print({"", "hello"})
```

This will print `"Iron plate: 60"` in the English translation and `"Eisenplatte: 60"` in the German translation. 
```
game.print({"", {"item-name.iron-plate"}, ": ", 60})
```

concepts.name: MapAndDifficultySettings
concepts.description: All regular [MapSettings](MapSettings) plus an additional table that contains the [DifficultySettings](DifficultySettings).

parameters.name: max_failed_behavior_count
parameters.description: If a behavior fails this many times, the enemy (or enemy group) is destroyed. This solves biters getting stuck within their own base.

concepts.name: MapExchangeStringData
concepts.description: The data that can be extracted from a map exchange string, as a plain table.

concepts.name: MapGenSettings
concepts.description: The 'map type' dropdown in the map generation GUI is actually a selector for elevation generator. The base game sets `property_expression_names.elevation` to `"0_16-elevation"` to reproduce terrain from 0.16 or to `"0_17-island"` for the island preset. If generators are available for other properties, the 'map type' dropdown in the GUI will be renamed to 'elevation' and shown along with selectors for the other selectable properties.
examples:
Assuming a NamedNoiseExpression with the name "my-alternate-grass1-probability" is defined 
```
local surface = game.player.surface
local mgs = surface.map_gen_settings
mgs.property_expression_names["tile:grass1:probability"] = "my-alternate-grass1-probability"
surface.map_gen_settings = mgs
``` would override the probability of grass1 being placed at any given point on the current surface.

To make there be no deep water on (newly generated chunks) a surface: 
```
local surface = game.player.surface
local mgs = surface.map_gen_settings
mgs.property_expression_names["tile:deepwater:probability"] = -1000
surface.map_gen_settings = mgs
``` This does not require a NamedNoiseExpression to be defined, since literal numbers (and strings naming literal numbers, e.g. `"123"`) are understood to stand for constant value expressions.

parameters.name: autoplace_controls
parameters.description: Indexed by autoplace control prototype name.

parameters.name: autoplace_settings
parameters.description: Each setting in this dictionary maps the string type to the settings for that type. Valid types are `"entity"`, `"tile"` and `"decorative"`.

parameters.name: cliff_settings
parameters.description: Map generation settings for entities of the type "cliff".

parameters.name: default_enable_all_autoplace_controls
parameters.description: Whether undefined `autoplace_controls` should fall back to the default controls or not. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Height in tiles. If `0`, the map has 'infinite' height, with the actual limitation being one million tiles in each direction from the center.

parameters.name: peaceful_mode
parameters.description: Whether peaceful mode is enabled for this map.

parameters.name: property_expression_names
parameters.description:
Overrides for tile property value generators. Values either name a NamedNoiseExpression or can be literal numbers, stored as strings (e.g. `"5"`). All other controls can be overridden by a property expression names. Notable properties: 
- `moisture` - a value between 0 and 1 that determines whether a tile becomes sandy (low moisture) or grassy (high moisture).
- `aux` - a value between 0 and 1 that determines whether low-moisture tiles become sand or red desert.
- `temperature` - provides a value (vaguely representing degrees Celsius, varying between -20 and 50) that is used (together with moisture and aux) as part of tree and decorative placement.
- `elevation` - tiles values less than zero become water. Cliffs are placed along certain contours according to [CliffPlacementSettings](CliffPlacementSettings).
- `cliffiness` - determines whether (when >0.5) or not (when <0.5) a cliff will be placed at an otherwise suitable (according to [CliffPlacementSettings](CliffPlacementSettings)) location.
- `enemy-base-intensity` - a number that is referenced by both `enemy-base-frequency` and `enemy-base-radius`. i.e. if this is overridden, enemy base frequency and size will both be affected and do something reasonable. By default, this expression returns a value proportional to distance from any starting point, clamped at about 7.
- `enemy-base-frequency` - a number representing average number of enemy bases per tile for a region, by default in terms of `enemy-base-intensity`.
- `enemy-base-radius` - a number representing the radius of an enemy base, if one were to be placed on the given tile, by default proportional to a constant plus `enemy-base-intensity`. Climate controls ('Moisture' and 'Terrain type' at the bottom of the Terrain tab in the map generator GUI) don't have their own dedicated structures in MapGenSettings. Instead, their values are stored as property expression overrides with long names: 
- `control-setting:moisture:frequency:multiplier` - frequency (inverse of scale) multiplier for moisture noise. Default is 1.
- `control-setting:moisture:bias` - global bias for moisture (which normally varies between 0 and 1). Default is 0.
- `control-setting:aux:frequency:multiplier` - frequency (inverse of scale) multiplier for aux (called 'terrain type' in the GUI) noise. Default is 1.
- `control-setting:aux:bias` - global bias for aux/terrain type (which normally varies between 0 and 1). Default is 0. All other MapGenSettings feed into named noise expressions, and therefore placement can be overridden by including the name of a property in this dictionary. The probability and richness functions for placing specific tiles, entities, and decoratives can be overridden by including an entry named `{tile|entity|decorative}:(prototype name):{probability|richness}`.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: The random seed used to generated this map.

parameters.name: starting_area
parameters.description: Size of the starting area.

parameters.name: starting_points
parameters.description: Positions of the starting areas.

parameters.name: terrain_segmentation
parameters.description: The inverse of 'water scale' in the map generator GUI. Lower `terrain_segmentation` increases the scale of elevation features (lakes, continents, etc). This behavior can be overridden with alternate elevation generators (see `property_expression_names`, below).

parameters.name: water
parameters.description: The equivalent to 'water coverage' in the map generator GUI. Specifically, when this value is non-zero, `water_level = 10 * log2` (the value of this field), and the elevation generator subtracts water level from elevation before adding starting lakes. If water is set to 'none', elevation is clamped to a small positive value before adding starting lakes. This behavior can be overridden with alternate elevation generators (see `property_expression_names`, below).

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Width in tiles. If `0`, the map has 'infinite' width, with the actual limitation being one million tiles in each direction from the center.

concepts.name: MapGenSize
concepts.description:
A floating point number specifying an amount.

For backwards compatibility, MapGenSizes can also be specified as one of the following strings, which will be converted to a number (when queried, a number will always be returned):

- `"none"` - equivalent to `0`
- `"very-low"`, `"very-small"`, `"very-poor"` - equivalent to `1/2`
- `"low"`, `"small"`, `"poor"` - equivalent to `1/sqrt(2)`
- `"normal"`, `"medium"`, `"regular"` - equivalent to `1`
- `"high"`, `"big"`, `"good"` - equivalent to `sqrt(2)`
- `"very-high"`, `"very-big"`, `"very-good"` - equivalent to `2`
notes: The map generation algorithm officially supports the range of values the in-game map generation screen shows (specifically `0` and values from `1/6` to `6`). Values outside this range are not guaranteed to work as expected.

concepts.name: MapPosition
concepts.description: Coordinates of an entity on a map. This uses the same format as [Position](Position), meaning it can be specified either with or without explicit keys.

concepts.name: MapSettings
concepts.description: Various game-related settings. Updating any of the attributes will immediately take effect in the game engine.
examples:
Increase the number of short paths the pathfinder can cache. 
```
game.map_settings.path_finder.short_cache_size = 15
```

parameters.name: max_failed_behavior_count
parameters.description: If a behavior fails this many times, the enemy (or enemy group) is destroyed. This solves biters getting stuck within their own base.

concepts.name: MapViewSettings
concepts.description: What is shown in the map view. If a field is not given, that setting will not be changed.

parameters.name: new_version
parameters.description: New version of the mod. May be `nil` if the mod is no longer present (i.e. it was just removed).

parameters.name: old_version
parameters.description: Old version of the mod. May be `nil` if the mod wasn't previously present (i.e. it was just added).

concepts.name: ModSetting
notes: Runtime settings can be changed through console commands and by the mod that owns the settings by writing a new table to the ModSetting.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value of the mod setting. The type depends on the setting.

concepts.name: ModSettingPrototypeFilter

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The condition to filter on. One of `"type"`, `"mod"`, `"setting-type"`

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: Inverts the condition. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: How to combine this with the previous filter. Must be `"or"` or `"and"`. Defaults to `"or"`. When evaluating the filters, `"and"` has higher precedence than `"or"`.

parameters.name: mod
parameters.description: The mod name

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The setting scope type (startup, runtime-global, or runtime-per-user)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The prototype type

concepts.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `filter`:

parameters.name: bonus
parameters.description: The percentual increase of the attribute. A value of `0.6` means a 60% increase.

concepts.name: ModuleEffects
examples:
These are the effects of the vanilla Productivity Module 3 (up to floating point imprecisions): 
```
{consumption={bonus=0.6},
 speed={bonus=-0.15},
 productivity={bonus=0.06},
 pollution={bonus=0.075}}
```

concepts.name: MouseButtonFlags
concepts.description:
This is a set of flags given as a dictionary[[string](string) → [boolean](boolean)]. When a flag is set, it is present in the dictionary with the value `true`. Unset flags aren't present in the dictionary at all.

To write to this, use an array[[string](string)] of the mouse buttons that should be possible to use with on button.

When setting flags, the flag `"left-and-right"` can also be set which will set `"left"` and `"right"` true.

Possible flags when reading are:
- `"left"`
- `"right"`
- `"middle"`
- `"button-4"`
- `"button-5"`
- `"button-6"`
- `"button-7"`
- `"button-8"`
- `"button-9"`

concepts.name: NoiseExpression
concepts.description: A fragment of a functional program used to generate coherent noise, probably for purposes related to terrain generation. These can only be meaningfully written/modified during the data load phase. More detailed information is found on the [wiki](https://wiki.factorio.com/Types/NoiseExpression).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Names the type of the expression and determines what other fields are required.

parameters.name: nth_tick
parameters.description: The nth tick this handler was registered to.

parameters.name: tick
parameters.description: The tick during which the event happened.

concepts.name: Offer
concepts.description: A single offer on a market entity.

parameters.name: offer
parameters.description: The action that will take place when a player accepts the offer. Usually a `"give-item"` modifier.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: List of prices.

parameters.name: cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio
parameters.description: When looking for a path from cache, make sure it doesn't end too far from the requested end in relative terms. This is typically more lenient than the start ratio since the end target could be moving. Defaults to `0.15`.

parameters.name: cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio
parameters.description: When looking for a path from cache, make sure it doesn't start too far from the requested start in relative terms. Defaults to `0.2`.

parameters.name: cache_max_connect_to_cache_steps_multiplier
parameters.description: When looking for a connection to a cached path, search at most for this number of steps times the original estimate. Defaults to `100`.

parameters.name: cache_path_end_distance_rating_multiplier
parameters.description: When assigning a rating to the best path, this multiplier times end distances is considered. This value is typically higher than the start multiplier as this results in better end path quality. Defaults to `20`.

parameters.name: cache_path_start_distance_rating_multiplier
parameters.description: When assigning a rating to the best path, this multiplier times start distances is considered. Defaults to `10`.

parameters.name: direct_distance_to_consider_short_request
parameters.description: The maximum direct distance in tiles before a request is no longer considered short. Defaults to `100`.

parameters.name: enemy_with_different_destination_collision_penalty
parameters.description: A penalty that is applied for another unit that is too close and either not moving or has a different goal. Defaults to `30`.

parameters.name: extended_collision_penalty
parameters.description: The collision penalty for collisions in the extended bounding box but outside the entity's actual bounding box. Defaults to `3`.

parameters.name: fwd2bwd_ratio
parameters.description: The pathfinder performs a step of the backward search every `fwd2bwd_ratio`'th step. The minimum allowed value is `2`, which means symmetric search. The default value is `5`.

parameters.name: general_entity_collision_penalty
parameters.description: The general collision penalty with other units. Defaults to `10`.

parameters.name: general_entity_subsequent_collision_penalty
parameters.description: The collision penalty for positions that require the destruction of an entity to get to. Defaults to `3`.

parameters.name: goal_pressure_ratio
parameters.description: When looking at which node to check next, their heuristic value is multiplied by this ratio. The higher it is, the more the search is directed straight at the goal. Defaults to `2`.

parameters.name: ignore_moving_enemy_collision_distance
parameters.description: The distance in tiles after which other moving units are not considered for pathfinding. Defaults to `5`.

parameters.name: long_cache_min_cacheable_distance
parameters.description: The minimal distance to the goal in tiles required to be searched in the long path cache. Defaults to `30`.

parameters.name: long_cache_size
parameters.description: Number of elements in the long cache. Defaults to `25`.

parameters.name: max_clients_to_accept_any_new_request
parameters.description: The amount of path finder requests accepted per tick regardless of the requested path's length. Defaults to `10`.

parameters.name: max_clients_to_accept_short_new_request
parameters.description: When the `max_clients_to_accept_any_new_request` amount is exhausted, only path finder requests with a short estimate will be accepted until this amount (per tick) is reached. Defaults to `100`.

parameters.name: max_steps_worked_per_tick
parameters.description: The maximum number of nodes that are expanded per tick. Defaults to `1,000`.

parameters.name: max_work_done_per_tick
parameters.description: The maximum amount of work each pathfinding job is allowed to do per tick. Defaults to `8,000`.

parameters.name: min_steps_to_check_path_find_termination
parameters.description: The minimum amount of steps that are guaranteed to be performed for every request. Defaults to `2000`.

parameters.name: negative_cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio
parameters.description: Same principle as `cache_accept_path_end_distance_ratio`, but used for negative cache queries. Defaults to `0.3`.

parameters.name: negative_cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio
parameters.description: Same principle as `cache_accept_path_start_distance_ratio`, but used for negative cache queries. Defaults to `0.3`.

parameters.name: negative_path_cache_delay_interval
parameters.description: The delay in ticks between decrementing the score of all paths in the negative cache by one. Defaults to `20`.

parameters.name: overload_levels
parameters.description: The thresholds of waiting clients after each of which the per-tick work limit will be increased by the corresponding value in `overload_multipliers`. This is to avoid clients having to wait too long. Must have the same number of elements as `overload_multipliers`. Defaults to `{0, 100, 500}`.

parameters.name: overload_multipliers
parameters.description: The multipliers to the amount of per-tick work applied after the corresponding thresholds in `overload_levels` have been reached. Must have the same number of elements as `overload_multipliers`. Defaults to `{2, 3, 4}`.

parameters.name: short_cache_min_algo_steps_to_cache
parameters.description: The minimal number of nodes required to be searched in the short path cache. Defaults to `50`.

parameters.name: short_cache_min_cacheable_distance
parameters.description: The minimal distance to the goal in tiles required to be searched in the short path cache. Defaults to `10`.

parameters.name: short_cache_size
parameters.description: Number of elements in the short cache. Defaults to `5`.

parameters.name: short_request_max_steps
parameters.description: The maximum amount of nodes a short request will traverse before being rescheduled as a long request. Defaults to `1000`.

parameters.name: short_request_ratio
parameters.description: The amount of steps that are allocated to short requests each tick, as a percentage of all available steps. Defaults to `0.5`, or 50%.

parameters.name: stale_enemy_with_same_destination_collision_penalty
parameters.description: A penalty that is applied for another unit that is on the way to the goal. This is mainly relevant for situations where a group of units has arrived at the target they are supposed to attack, making units further back circle around to reach the target. Defaults to `30`.

parameters.name: start_to_goal_cost_multiplier_to_terminate_path_find
parameters.description: If the actual amount of steps is higher than the initial estimate by this factor, pathfinding is terminated. Defaults to `2000.0`.

parameters.name: use_path_cache
parameters.description: Whether to cache paths at all. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: allow_destroy_friendly_entities
parameters.description: Allows pathing through friendly entities. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: allow_paths_through_own_entities
parameters.description: Allows the pathfinder to path through entities of the same force. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: Enables path caching. This can be more efficient, but might fail to respond to changes in the environment. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: low_priority
parameters.description: Sets lower priority on the path request, meaning it might take longer to find a path at the expense of speeding up others. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: no_break
parameters.description: Makes the pathfinder not break in the middle of processing this pathfind, no matter how much work is needed. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: prefer_straight_paths
parameters.description: Makes the pathfinder try to path in straight lines. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: needs_destroy_to_reach
parameters.description: `true` if the path from the previous waypoint to this one goes through an entity that must be destroyed.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position of the waypoint on its surface.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The tile prototype.

options.description: A reference to [LuaPlayer](LuaPlayer) may be passed directly.

concepts.name: PollutionMapSettings
concepts.description: These values are for the time frame of one second (60 ticks).

parameters.name: aeging
parameters.description: The amount of pollution eaten by a chunk's tiles as a percentage of 1. Defaults to `1`.

parameters.name: diffusion_ratio
parameters.description: The amount that is diffused to a neighboring chunk (possibly repeated for other directions as well). Defaults to `0.02`.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether pollution is enabled at all.

parameters.name: enemy_attack_pollution_consumption_modifier
parameters.description: Defaults to `1`.

parameters.name: expected_max_per_chunk
parameters.description: Any amount of pollution larger than this value is visualized as this value instead. Defaults to `150`.

parameters.name: max_pollution_to_restore_trees
parameters.description: Defaults to `20`.

parameters.name: min_pollution_to_damage_trees
parameters.description: Defaults to `60`.

parameters.name: min_to_diffuse
parameters.description: The amount of PUs that need to be in a chunk for it to start diffusing. Defaults to `15`.

parameters.name: min_to_show_per_chunk
parameters.description: Any amount of pollution smaller than this value (but bigger than zero) is visualized as this value instead. Defaults to `50`.

parameters.name: pollution_per_tree_damage
parameters.description: Defaults to `50`.

parameters.name: pollution_restored_per_tree_damage
parameters.description: Defaults to `10`.

parameters.name: pollution_with_max_forest_damage
parameters.description: Defaults to `150`.

concepts.name: Position
concepts.description: Coordinates of a tile in a map. Positions may be specified either as a dictionary with `x`, `y` as keys, or simply as an array with two elements.

concepts.name: Product
examples:
Products of the "steel-chest" recipe (an array of Product): 
```
{{type="item", name="steel-chest", amount=1}}
```

Products of the "advanced-oil-processing" recipe: 
```
{{type="fluid", name="heavy-oil", amount=1},
 {type="fluid", name="light-oil", amount=4.5},
 {type="fluid", name="petroleum-gas", amount=5.5}}
```

What a custom recipe would look like that had a probability of 0.5 to return a minimum amount of 1 and a maximum amount of 5: 
```
{{type=0, name="custom-item", probability=0.5, amount_min=1, amount_max=5}}
```

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount of the item or fluid to give. If not specified, `amount_min`, `amount_max` and `probability` must all be specified.

parameters.name: amount_max
parameters.description: Maximum amount of the item or fluid to give. Has no effect when `amount` is specified.

parameters.name: amount_min
parameters.description: Minimal amount of the item or fluid to give. Has no effect when `amount` is specified.

parameters.name: catalyst_amount
parameters.description: How much of this product is a catalyst.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Prototype name of the result.

parameters.name: probability
parameters.description: A value in range [0, 1]. Item or fluid is only given with this probability; otherwise no product is produced.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: `"item"` or `"fluid"`.

parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: The fluid temperature of this product.

concepts.variant_parameter_description: Other attributes may be specified depending on `type`:

concepts.name: RealOrientation
concepts.description:
The smooth orientation. It is a [float](float) in the range `[0, 1)` that covers a full circle, starting at the top and going clockwise. This means a value of `0` indicates "north", a value of `0.5` indicates "south".

For example then, a value of `0.625` would indicate "south-west", and a value of `0.875` would indicate "north-west".

concepts.name: RecipePrototypeFilter

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The condition to filter on. One of `"enabled"`, `"hidden"`, `"hidden-from-flow-stats"`, `"hidden-from-player-crafting"`, `"allow-as-intermediate"`, `"allow-intermediates"`, `"allow-decomposition"`, `"always-show-made-in"`, `"always-show-products"`, `"show-amount-in-title"`, `"has-ingredients"`, `"has-products"`, `"has-ingredient-item"`, `"has-ingredient-fluid"`, `"has-product-item"`, `"has-product-fluid"`, `"subgroup"`, `"category"`, `"energy"`, `"emissions-multiplier"`, `"request-paste-multiplier"`, `"overload-multiplier"`

parameters.name: invert
parameters.description: Inverts the condition. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: How to combine this with the previous filter. Must be `"or"` or `"and"`. Defaults to `"or"`. When evaluating the filters, `"and"` has higher precedence than `"or"`.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: A [LuaRecipeCategoryPrototype](LuaRecipeCategoryPrototype) name

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

variant_parameter_groups.name: has-ingredient-fluid
variant_parameter_groups.description:
Usage example: 
```
-- selects recipes that consume sulfuric acid
{{filter = "has-ingredient-fluid", elem_filters = {{filter = "name", name = "sulfuric-acid"}}}}
```

parameters.name: elem_filters
parameters.description: Matches if at least 1 ingredient is a fluid that matches these filters.

parameters.name: elem_filters
parameters.description: Matches if at least 1 ingredient is an item that matches these filters.

parameters.name: elem_filters
parameters.description: Matches if at least 1 product is a fluid that matches these filters.

parameters.name: elem_filters
parameters.description: Matches if at least 1 product is an item that matches these filters.
